Lines.Text: insert new metal connector with a little loctite glue using a small box wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert new metal connector with a little loctite glue using a small box wrench.

Lines.Text: replace airfilter ( new one if needed ) and re-attach vacuum hoses to housing in car . pat self on the back for saving 400.

Steps.Text_raw: Replace airfilter (new one if needed) and re-attach vacuum hoses to housing in car. Pat self on the back for saving $400.

Lines.Text: let your jeep cool down by leaving it off for 30 minutes .
if you do not let it cool , you can be easily burned . the oil filter will be hot .
locate the oil filter . it is a cylindrical dome on the bottom side of the engine .

Steps.Text_raw: Let your Jeep cool down by leaving it off for 30 minutes. If you do not let it cool, you can be easily burned. The oil filter will be hot. Locate the oil filter. It is a cylindrical dome on the bottom side of the engine.

Lines.Text: you will need to access the filter from underneath the vehicle .

before unscrewing oil filter , make sure an oil pan is below the filter . when you unscrew the filter , oil will begin flowing instantly . this is extremely bad for the environment and will damage your pavement .

Steps.Text_raw: You will need to access the filter from underneath the vehicle. Before unscrewing oil filter, make sure an oil pan is below the filter.  When you unscrew the filter, oil will begin flowing instantly. This is extremely bad for the environment and will damage your pavement.

Lines.Text: use an oil filter wrench to loosen the oil filter . twist it to the left to remove the filter .
we did not have the correct wrench available while making this guide .
oil will begin to leak at this point ! be sure to catch all of the oil with the oil pan .
once loosened , unscrew and remove the filter with your hand .
let all of the oil drain from the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use an oil filter wrench to loosen the oil filter. Twist it to the left to remove the filter. We did not have the correct wrench available while making this guide. Oil will begin to leak at this point! Be sure to catch all of the oil with the oil pan. Once loosened, unscrew and remove the filter with your hand. Let all of the oil drain from the vehicle.

Lines.Text: after the oil is drained , begin to hand screw the new oil filter into place .
use the oil filter wrench to tighten the oil filter until it is secure . this will prevent leaking .

Steps.Text_raw: After the oil is drained, begin to hand screw the new oil filter into place. Use the oil filter wrench to tighten the oil filter until it is secure.  This will prevent leaking.

Lines.Text: once the new oil filter is secure locate the oil cap on the engine .
unscrew and add 6 quarts of 5 w-30 type synthetic engine oil .
replace the oil cap and the installation is complete !
be sure to dispose of the old oil properly . look up oil recycling services in your area . do not dump the oil down any drain . it will seriously damage the environment and plumbing systems .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the new oil filter is secure locate the oil cap on the engine. Unscrew and add 6 quarts of 5W-30 type synthetic engine oil. Replace the oil cap and the installation is complete! Be sure to dispose of the old oil properly. Look up oil recycling services in your area. DO NOT dump the oil down any drain. It will seriously damage the environment and plumbing systems.

Lines.Text: open the rear part of the middle console .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the rear part of the middle console.

Lines.Text: grip the right side of the console and pull up towards the passenger seat to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the right side of the console and pull up towards the passenger seat to remove it.

Lines.Text: locate the two bolts under the air conditioning controls at the bottom of the face plate .
loosen these two bolts with a basic socket wrench suited for 7 mm bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two bolts under the air conditioning controls at the bottom of the face plate. Loosen these two bolts with a basic socket wrench suited for 7mm bolts.

Lines.Text: wedge a spudger or plastic opening tool ( in place of the screwdriver shown ) under the top of the face plate .
apply pressure until the corners pop out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge a spudger or plastic opening tool (in place of the screwdriver shown) under the top of the face plate. Apply pressure until the corners "pop" out of place.

Lines.Text: inspect the interior of the center console for damaged wires or other faulty components .

Steps.Text_raw: Inspect the interior of the center console for damaged wires or other faulty components.

Lines.Text: read over the guidelines for safety reasons before you begin .
place the hydraulic jack under the metal frame of the car near the tire that you want to change .
consult the car owner's manual for exact locations to place the hydraulic jack .

Steps.Text_raw: Read over the guidelines for safety reasons before you begin. Place the hydraulic jack under the metal frame of the car near the tire that you want to change. Consult the car owner's manual for exact locations to place the hydraulic jack.

Lines.Text: cars are very heavy and can pose danger when they are elevated by the car jack . exercise caution around the elevated vehicle .
crack the bolts loose before raising the car
pump the jack handle evenly until the tire raises only an inch or two off of the ground . be sure not to lay underneath the vehicle until the new wheel is properly installed .

Steps.Text_raw: Cars are very heavy and can pose danger when they are elevated by the car jack. Exercise caution around the elevated vehicle. Crack the bolts loose before raising the car Pump the jack handle evenly until the tire raises only an inch or two off of the ground. Be sure not to lay underneath the vehicle until the new wheel is properly installed.

Lines.Text: lug nuts hold the wheel in place . use the 13 /16 socket with a breaker bar to remove the lug nuts by turning the nuts counterclockwise .
store the lug nuts in a safe place so that you do not lose them .

Steps.Text_raw: Lug nuts hold the wheel in place. Use the 13/16" socket with a breaker bar to remove the lug nuts by turning the nuts counterclockwise. Store the lug nuts in a safe place so that you do not lose them.

Lines.Text: the wheel will be heavy . you should brace yourself to bear the weight . seek help if the wheel is too heavy for you .
grab the wheel with both hands and pull the wheel straight off and away from the car .
do not risk dropping the wheel onto the brake rotor , which would cause damage to it .

Steps.Text_raw: The wheel will be heavy. You should brace yourself to bear the weight. Seek help if the wheel is too heavy for you. Grab the wheel with both hands and pull the wheel straight off and away from the car. Do not risk dropping the wheel onto the brake rotor, which would cause damage to it.

Lines.Text: place a new wheel on the hub , and then fix it in place by tightening the lug nuts clockwise . in other words , skip every other nut as you go around the wheel .
lower the car after snugging the bolts then torque the wheel nuts to 100 ftlb

Steps.Text_raw: Place a new wheel on the hub, and then fix it in place by tightening the lug nuts clockwise. In other words, skip every other nut as you go around the wheel. Lower the car after snugging the bolts then torque the wheel nuts to 100ftlb

Title: 2003-2007 Honda Accord Front Brake Pads Replacement

Lines.Text: place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember''''' .
the '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car .
the '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember'''''. The '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car. The '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up.

Lines.Text: push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember . continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward .

Steps.Text_raw: Push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember. Continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward.

Lines.Text: place the jack stand under the jack mounting point .
the jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack stand under the jack mounting point. The jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors.

Lines.Text: raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point .
in the event the floor jack fails , the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point. In the event the floor jack fails, the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling.

Lines.Text: once car is raised , remove the lug nuts on one of the front tires with the 3 /4 '' socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Once car is raised, remove the lug nuts on one of the front tires with the 3/4'' socket.

Lines.Text: remove the wheel and tire off the wheel studs , and place it aside .
this exposes the caliper ( shown in rectangle ) and rotor ( shown in circle ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wheel and tire off the wheel studs, and place it aside. This exposes the caliper (shown in rectangle) and rotor (shown in circle).

Lines.Text: identify the two mounting bolts on the rear of the caliper .
using a 12 mm wrench or socket , remove the two caliper mounting bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the two mounting bolts on the rear of the caliper. Using a 12 mm wrench or socket, remove the two caliper mounting bolts.

Lines.Text: slide the caliper off and rest it on the top of the rotor .
do '''not''' let the caliper hang freely because the brake lines may stretch and weaken .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the caliper off and rest it on the top of the rotor. Do '''not''' let the caliper hang freely because the brake lines may stretch and weaken.

Lines.Text: pull the two old brake pads out of both the front and rear of the pad bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the two old brake pads out of both the front and rear of the pad bracket.

Lines.Text: inspect the brake pad wear sensor on the old brake pad . the sensor is a metallic tab attached to the brake pad . when the brake pads wear down too much , the metallic tab contacts the rotor and makes a screeching sound .

Steps.Text_raw: Inspect the brake pad wear sensor on the old brake pad. The sensor is a metallic tab attached to the brake pad. When the brake pads wear down too much, the metallic tab contacts the rotor and makes a screeching sound.

Lines.Text: place the new brake pads into the bracket . make sure that the new pads are secure .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the new brake pads into the bracket. Make sure that the new pads are secure.

Lines.Text: the new brake pads are thicker than the old pads . because of this , the caliper piston protrudes too far out to allow enough clearance for the caliper to be placed over the new pads . you will need to manually retract the caliper piston .
to do this , place an old brake pad over the caliper piston .

Steps.Text_raw: The new brake pads are thicker than the old pads. Because of this, the caliper piston protrudes too far out to allow enough clearance for the caliper to be placed over the new pads. You will need to manually retract the caliper piston. To do this, place an old brake pad over the caliper piston.

Lines.Text: place one end of the c-clamp jaw over the old pad . place the other end of the jaw on the rear of the caliper . tighten the c-clamp to push the piston back into the caliper .

this will push oil back into the brake reservoir , which could overflow . this can be wasteful , messy , and damage your car's paint job . make sure the reservoir isn't topped off . it is also a good idea to remove the cap from the reservoir before retracting the piston . the reservoir is located under the hood and should be clearly labeled .

Steps.Text_raw: Place one end of the c-clamp jaw over the old pad. Place the other end of the jaw on the rear of the caliper. Tighten the c-clamp to push the piston back into the caliper. This will push oil back into the brake reservoir, which could overflow. This can be wasteful, messy, and damage your car's paint job. Make sure the reservoir isn't topped off. It is also a good idea to remove the cap from the reservoir before retracting the piston. The reservoir is located under the hood and should be clearly labeled.

Lines.Text: slide the caliper over the brake pad bracket with the new brake pads .
if you removed the cap from the brake fluid reservoir replace it as soon as the brake caliper piston has been retracted . do not leave the cap off any longer than absolutely necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the caliper over the brake pad bracket with the new brake pads. If you removed the cap from the brake fluid reservoir replace it as soon as the brake caliper piston has been retracted. Do not leave the cap off any longer than absolutely necessary.

Lines.Text: to reassemble the wheel assembly . follow the steps 1-7 in '''reverse order''' .

the caliper mounting bolts and the lug nuts must be tightened to the correct torque value , using a torque wrench . the values may differ depending on your car's configuration and options , but are typically listed as :
caliper bolts : 54 ft lbs
lug nuts : 80 ft lbs
remove the jack stand . then lower and remove the floor jack .

caution ! : before driving the car , pump the brake pedal several times in order to push the caliper piston back against the brake pads . if this step is not performed , the car may not brake reliably when first driven . for your safety , this step is essential .

Steps.Text_raw: To reassemble the wheel assembly. Follow the Steps 1-7 in '''reverse order'''. The caliper mounting bolts and the lug nuts must be tightened to the correct torque value, using a torque wrench. The values may differ depending on your car's configuration and options, but are typically listed as: Caliper bolts: 54 ft lbs Lug nuts: 80 ft lbs Remove the jack stand. Then lower and remove the floor jack. CAUTION! : Before driving the car, pump the brake pedal several times in order to push the caliper piston back against the brake pads. If this step is not performed, the car may not brake reliably when first driven. For your safety, this step is essential.

Subject: Front Brake Pads

Title: 2003-2007 Honda Accord Oil and Oil Filter Change

Lines.Text: locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door , right next to the left foot rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door, right next to the left foot rest.

Lines.Text: pull the latch toward you to release the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the latch toward you to release the hood.

Lines.Text: walk around to the front of the vehicle .
slide your hand under the hood , directly above the honda emblem . locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood .
once the tab is released , lift the hood up .

Steps.Text_raw: Walk around to the front of the vehicle. Slide your hand under the hood, directly above the Honda emblem. Locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood. Once the tab is released, lift the hood up.

Lines.Text: use your left hand to hold the hood up . locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your left hand to hold the hood up. Locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip.

Lines.Text: place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood .
let the hood rest on the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood. Let the hood rest on the stand.

Lines.Text: place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember''''' .
the '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car .
the '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember'''''. The '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car. The '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up.

Lines.Text: push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember . continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward .

Steps.Text_raw: Push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember. Continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward.

Lines.Text: place the jack stand under the jack mounting point .
the jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack stand under the jack mounting point. The jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors.

Lines.Text: raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point .
in the event the floor jack fails , the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point. In the event the floor jack fails, the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling.

Lines.Text: remove the dipstick by lifting vertically .
wipe all the oil off of the dipstick and put it back into the dipstick port .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the dipstick by lifting vertically. Wipe all the oil off of the dipstick and put it back into the dipstick port.

Lines.Text: remove the dipstick and examine the oil levels . the oil level should be between the two dots on the dipstick .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the dipstick and examine the oil levels. The oil level should be between the two dots on the dipstick.

Lines.Text: after driving , engine oil needs time to cool before it can be safely changed . wait about one hour after the engine has been turned off before attempting to change the oil .
crawl under the front of the car on your backside and identify the oil drain plug .
if there is any oil or residue around the drain plug , be sure to wipe it off before continuing .

Steps.Text_raw: After driving, engine oil needs time to cool before it can be safely changed. Wait about one hour after the engine has been turned off before attempting to change the oil. Crawl under the front of the car on your backside and identify the oil drain plug. If there is any oil or residue around the drain plug, be sure to wipe it off before continuing.

Lines.Text: place the oil drip pan under the drain plug and begin to loosen the drain plug with a 17 mm wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the oil drip pan under the drain plug and begin to loosen the drain plug with a 17mm wrench.

Lines.Text: loosen drain plug slowly by hand until the bolt is completely removed and oil begins to flow , re-positioning the oil drip pan if needed .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen drain plug slowly by hand until the bolt is completely removed and oil begins to flow, re-positioning the oil drip pan if needed.

Lines.Text: let the oil completely drain into the drip pan and replace and tighten the drain plug .
set the drip pan aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Let the oil completely drain into the drip pan and replace and tighten the drain plug. Set the drip pan aside.

Lines.Text: identify the oil filter and place drip pan under the oil filter to catch falling oil .
using a pair of channel locks , grip the oil filter tightly and twist counterclockwise to loosen .
oil will drip out from the threads as you loosen it so have the oil drip pan ready .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the oil filter and place drip pan under the oil filter to catch falling oil. Using a pair of channel locks, grip the oil filter tightly and twist counterclockwise to loosen. Oil will drip out from the threads as you loosen it so have the oil drip pan ready.

Lines.Text: slowly loosen the oil filter by hand until it is free .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly loosen the oil filter by hand until it is free.

Lines.Text: drain the remaining oil in the filter by inverting it over the drip pan .
be sure to wipe down any oil that might have leaked during the process .

Steps.Text_raw: Drain the remaining oil in the filter by inverting it over the drip pan. Be sure to wipe down any oil that might have leaked during the process.

Lines.Text: get the replacement filter and lightly spread clean engine oil onto the rubber gasket of the new filter .

Steps.Text_raw: Get the replacement filter and lightly spread clean engine oil onto the rubber gasket of the new filter.

Lines.Text: thread the new filter into the oil filter port by turning the filter clockwise .
once the rubber gasket contacts the engine block , use the channel locks to turn the filter one full turn cw .
over tightening may cause the gasket to break and leak oil .

Steps.Text_raw: Thread the new filter into the oil filter port by turning the filter clockwise. Once the rubber gasket contacts the engine block, use the channel locks to turn the filter one full turn CW. Over tightening may cause the gasket to break and leak oil.

Lines.Text: locate the oil fill cap on top of the engine and unscrew it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the oil fill cap on top of the engine and unscrew it.

Lines.Text: using a funnel , pour 5 quarts of 5 w-20 oil into the opening , making sure not to spill oil onto or around the engine .
screw on and tighten the oil fill cap .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a funnel, pour 5 quarts of 5W-20 oil into the opening, making sure not to spill oil onto or around the engine. Screw on and tighten the oil fill cap.

Subject: Engine oil and oil filter

Title: 2003-2007 Honda Accord Engine Air Filter Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door , right next to the left foot rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door, right next to the left foot rest.

Lines.Text: pull the latch toward you to release the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the latch toward you to release the hood.

Lines.Text: walk around to the front of the vehicle .
slide your hand under the hood , directly above the honda emblem . locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood .
once the tab is released , lift the hood up .

Steps.Text_raw: Walk around to the front of the vehicle. Slide your hand under the hood, directly above the Honda emblem. Locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood. Once the tab is released, lift the hood up.

Lines.Text: use your left hand to hold the hood up . locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your left hand to hold the hood up. Locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip.

Lines.Text: place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood .
let the hood rest on the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood. Let the hood rest on the stand.

Lines.Text: be sure your engine is turned off .
identify the engine's air duct hose .
the emission hose is located on the top .
remove the emission hose by gently wiggling it out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure your engine is turned off. Identify the engine's air duct hose. The emission hose is located on the top. Remove the emission hose by gently wiggling it out of place.

Lines.Text: remove the smog hose by squeezing the tubing and pulling it off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the smog hose by squeezing the tubing and pulling it off.

Lines.Text: using a phillips screwdriver , loosen air duct clamp screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips screwdriver, loosen air duct clamp screws.

Lines.Text: once the screws are loose , completely remove the air duct hose by gently wiggling it off the engine and the air filter housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are loose, completely remove the air duct hose by gently wiggling it off the engine and the air filter housing.

Lines.Text: remove the air filter housing cap .
using a long phillips screwdriver or a long 5 /16 hex driver , remove the four screws holding down the air filter housing cap .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the air filter housing cap. Using a Long Philips Screwdriver or a Long 5/16 Hex Driver, remove the four screws holding down the air filter housing cap.

Lines.Text: lift the engine air filter housing cap and place it aside .
do not turn the housing cap upside down . screws left in holes of housing cap might fall out .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the engine air filter housing cap and place it aside. Do not turn the housing cap upside down. Screws left in holes of housing cap might fall out.

Lines.Text: lift the dirty filter out of the housing .
vacuum any dirt or debris out of the air filter box .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the dirty filter out of the housing. Vacuum any dirt or debris out of the air filter box.

Lines.Text: replace the old filter with the new filter .
ensure that it seats properly in the lip of the air cleaner box .
screw down the air filter housing cap . connect air dust , emission , and smog hoses .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the old filter with the new filter. Ensure that it seats properly in the lip of the air cleaner box. Screw down the air filter housing cap. Connect air dust, emission, and smog hoses.

Subject: Engine Air Filter

Lines.Text: place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember''''' .
the '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car .
the '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember'''''. The '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car. The '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up.

Lines.Text: push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember . continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward .

Steps.Text_raw: Push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember. Continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward.

Lines.Text: place the jack stand under the jack mounting point .
the jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack stand under the jack mounting point. The jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors.

Lines.Text: raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point .
in the event the floor jack fails , the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point. In the event the floor jack fails, the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling.

Lines.Text: once the car is raised , remove the lug nuts with the ratchet attached to a 3 /4 '' socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the car is raised, remove the lug nuts with the ratchet attached to a 3/4'' socket.

Lines.Text: remove the tire off the '''''wheel studs''''' and place it aside .
the '''''wheel studs''''' are the metal bolts sticking out of the wheel hub in the center .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tire off the '''''wheel studs''''' and place it aside. The '''''wheel studs''''' are the metal bolts sticking out of the wheel hub in the center.

Lines.Text: on the same side of the vehicle , go to the rear tire .
using a ratchet attached to a 3 /4 socket , loosen wheel lug nuts . do not remove them .
loosening the lug nuts while the tire is on the ground prevents the tire from spinning .

Steps.Text_raw: On the same side of the vehicle, go to the rear tire. Using a ratchet attached to a 3/4" socket, loosen wheel lug nuts. Do not remove them. Loosening the lug nuts while the tire is on the ground prevents the tire from spinning.

Lines.Text: place the floor jack under the frame in front of the rear tire .
make sure that you are not pressed against the plastic and you are directly on the metal frame of the vehicle .
raise the jack until the tire is off the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the floor jack under the frame in front of the rear tire. Make sure that you are not pressed against the plastic and you are directly on the metal frame of the vehicle. Raise the jack until the tire is off the ground.

Lines.Text: remove the lug nuts by loosening them with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lug  nuts by loosening them with your hands.

Lines.Text: remove the rear tire . roll and place the tire onto the wheel studs on the front wheel .
tighten the lug nuts using your hand until they are tight .
roll the previous front tire to the rear and repeat the tightening process

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rear tire. Roll and place the tire onto the wheel studs on the front wheel. Tighten the lug nuts using your hand until they are tight. Roll the previous front tire to the rear and repeat the tightening process

Lines.Text: using a torque wrench , tighten the lug nuts on each wheel to 80 ft-lbs .
if a torque wrench is not available , use the ratchet attached to the 3 /4 '' socket to hand-tighten the lug nuts until very tight .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a torque wrench, tighten the lug nuts on each wheel to 80 ft-lbs. If a torque wrench is not available, use the ratchet attached to the 3/4'' socket to hand-tighten the lug nuts until very tight.

Lines.Text: using an air compressor and the air pressure gauge , fill the front and rear tires to appropriate amount .

Steps.Text_raw: Using an air compressor and the air pressure gauge, fill the front and rear tires to appropriate amount.

Lines.Text: locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door , right next to the left foot rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hood latch beside the driver's side door, right next to the left foot rest.

Lines.Text: pull the latch toward you to release the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the latch toward you to release the hood.

Lines.Text: walk around to the front of the vehicle .
slide your hand under the hood , directly above the honda emblem . locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood .
once the tab is released , lift the hood up .

Steps.Text_raw: Walk around to the front of the vehicle. Slide your hand under the hood, directly above the Honda emblem. Locate and pull the hood tab to unlock the hood. Once the tab is released, lift the hood up.

Lines.Text: use your left hand to hold the hood up . locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your left hand to hold the hood up. Locate the hood stand and pull it out of the clip.

Lines.Text: place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood .
let the hood rest on the stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the tip of the hood stand into the hole located in the upper left of the hood. Let the hood rest on the stand.

Lines.Text: use a 10 mm hex driver or socket to remove the four screws that hold the spark plug cover in place .
lift the plastic cover and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a 10 mm hex driver or socket to remove the four screws that hold the spark plug cover in place. Lift the plastic cover and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the spark plug wire by pinching the locking tabs on either side of it and pulling it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the spark plug wire by pinching the locking tabs on either side of it and pulling it out.

Lines.Text: use a 10 mm hex driver or socket to remove the four spark plug boot screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a 10 mm hex driver or socket to remove the four spark plug boot screws.

Lines.Text: lift the boot screws out of the spark plug bores .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the boot screws out of the spark plug bores.

Lines.Text: locate the spark plug at the bottom of the bore .
use a ratchet , extension , and 5 /8 socket to remove the plug by turning counterclockwise until it's free .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the spark plug at the bottom of the bore. Use a ratchet, extension, and 5/8 socket to remove the plug by turning counterclockwise until it's free.

Lines.Text: pull the plug out of the bore .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the plug out of the bore.

Lines.Text: determine if the spark plug needs to be replaced by examining the gap for the problems listed below :
the gap is bridged by corrosion .
the gap is too large .
the area around the gap is black and dark .

Steps.Text_raw: Determine if the spark plug needs to be replaced by examining the gap for the problems listed below: The gap is bridged by corrosion. The gap is too large. The area around the gap is black and dark.

Lines.Text: if the spark plug doesn't need to be replaced , return it to the spark plug bore . if it does need to be replaced , use a new one .
use of anti-seize on the thread of spark plug is highly recommended to ensure threads don't get damaged while tightening .
use a ratchet , extension , and 5 /8 socket to tighten the spark plug by turning clockwise . use your hand to tighten as well .
if a torque wrench is available , tighten to 13 ft-lbs .
repeat steps 10-13 for the three remaining spark plugs .

Steps.Text_raw: If the spark plug doesn't need to be replaced, return it to the spark plug bore. If it does need to be replaced, use a new one. Use of Anti-Seize on the thread of spark plug is highly recommended to ensure threads don't get damaged while tightening. Use a ratchet, extension, and 5/8 socket to tighten the spark plug by turning clockwise. Use your hand to tighten as well. If a torque wrench is available, tighten to 13 ft-lbs. Repeat Steps 10-13 for the three remaining spark plugs.

Lines.Text: remove the three screws holding the speaker panel in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three screws holding the speaker panel in place.

Lines.Text: disconnect the wiring harness in trunk .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the wiring harness in trunk.

Lines.Text: slide the speaker panel towards the center of car and pull it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the speaker panel towards the center of car and pull it out.

Lines.Text: remove the four screws holding the speaker in .
lift the speaker out and removal is complete .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four screws holding the speaker in. Lift the speaker out and removal is complete.

Title: 1996-1998 Acura TL Front Door Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: roll the window down all the way and open the door as far as it can go .
locate the screw cap in the bottom of the armrest cavity .
remove the cap by finger or pry it off with a flathead screwdriver if necessary to reveal the screws beneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Roll the window down all the way and open the door as far as it can go. Locate the screw cap in the bottom of the armrest cavity. Remove the cap by finger or pry it off with a flathead screwdriver if necessary to reveal the screws beneath.

Lines.Text: locate the screw cap inside of the door opening cavity .
remove the cap by finger or pry it off if necessary to reveal the screws beneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screw cap inside of the door opening cavity. Remove the cap by finger or pry it off if necessary to reveal the screws beneath.

Lines.Text: unscrew both of the screws that are now uncovered .
one of the screws is in the armrest cavity , the other is in the back of the door handle's cavity .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both of the screws that are now uncovered. One of the screws is in the armrest cavity, the other is in the back of the door handle's cavity.

Lines.Text: wtth the screw gone , slide the entire wooden armrest unit to the right ( away from the car ) .
once the armrest can not go any further lift straight up out of its spot .
before lifting too far reach under and remove the wiring from the wire harness by pinching down on the white tab and pulling straight back .
the window control is now removed and you can set the wooden door panel unit aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Wtth the screw gone, slide the entire wooden armrest unit to the right (away from the car). Once the armrest can not go any further lift straight up out of its spot. Before lifting too far reach under and remove the wiring from the wire harness  by pinching down on the white tab and pulling straight back. The window control is now removed and you can set the wooden door panel unit aside.

Lines.Text: similarly wiggle the door handle frame to its right to remove .
you must move the handle out of the way as if opening the door to get the frame around it and out of the door .
just like last time reach behind , pinch the tab and pull straight back to remove the circuitry for the door lock .
once the entire frame is removed from the door and the circuitry , place it to the side with the armrest part .

Steps.Text_raw: Similarly wiggle the door handle frame to its right to remove. You must move the handle out of the way as if opening the door to get the frame around it and out of the door. Just like last time reach behind, pinch the tab and pull straight back to remove the circuitry for the door lock. Once the entire frame is removed from the door and the circuitry, place it to the side with the armrest part.

Lines.Text: pry the inside door frame off of the actual metal exterior door .
use a flathead screwdriver for leverage to pop all of the plugs off . do not be afraid to use force as they are just snaps that will not break and will go back into place perfectly .
the locations of the plugs have been circled for your convenience . although applying leverage at all points around the sides and bottom will pop them off just as easily and safely .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the inside door frame off of the actual metal exterior door. Use a flathead screw driver for leverage to pop all of the plugs off. Do not be afraid to use force as they are just snaps that will not break and will go back into place perfectly. The locations of the plugs have been circled for your convenience. Although applying leverage at all points around the sides and bottom will pop them off just as easily and safely.

Lines.Text: lift the door panel straight up and off . the metal strip on the top of the door panel will come with the panel as you remove it from the door .
it should slide off quite easily if all the plugs are unsnapped . do not pull past the tension of the circuitry , as the wires are still plugged into the harness .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the door panel straight up and off. The metal strip on the top of the door panel will come with the panel as you remove it from the door. It should slide off quite easily if all the plugs are unsnapped. Do not pull past the tension of the circuitry, as the wires are still plugged into the harness.

Lines.Text: unplug the harness to the interior door light in the bottom right corner ( farthest from the car )
simply push down on the grey tab and pull straight out .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the harness to the interior door light in the bottom right corner (farthest from the car) Simply push down on the grey tab and pull straight out.

Lines.Text: remove the interior door panel completely , exposing the inside of the door and the front speaker .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the interior door panel completely, exposing the inside of the door and the front speaker.

Subject: Front Door Panel

Lines.Text: place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember''''' .
the '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car .
the '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the hydraulic floor jack under the vehicle until the '''''saddle''''' is directly under the '''''crossmember'''''. The '''''crossmember''''' is the long metal support beam that runs underneath from the front fender to the rear fender on both sides of the car. The '''''saddle''''' is the round metal part of the jack that moves upward as you pump the jack up.

Lines.Text: push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember . continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward .

Steps.Text_raw: Push downward on the jack's lever to lift the saddle upward so that it contacts the crossmember. Continue pushing downward on the lever to lift the car upward.

Lines.Text: place the jack stand under the jack mounting point .
the jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack stand under the jack mounting point. The jack mounting point is a metallic protrusion beneath each of the car doors.

Lines.Text: raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point .
in the event the floor jack fails , the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the jack stand until it contacts the jack mounting point. In the event the floor jack fails, the jack stand is designed to prevent the car from falling.

Lines.Text: first , open the box containing the electronic ignition .
check that all the parts are included as pictured . ( if you are using a different brand or model of electronic ignition , continue to step 2 , however success cannot be guaranteed )

there are many variants of the ignitor and most electronic ignitions , each designed for a different application . make sure that the unit being installed is intend for the corvair , otherwise , it likely will not work .

Steps.Text_raw: First, open the box containing the electronic ignition. Check that all the parts are included as pictured. (if you are using a different brand or model of electronic ignition, continue to step 2, however success cannot be guaranteed) There are many variants of the Ignitor and most electronic ignitions, each designed for a different application. Make sure that the unit being installed is intend for the Corvair, otherwise, it likely will not work.

Lines.Text: remove the two screws holding down the distributor cap , by using a flat head screwdriver , and remove the cap , but do not disconnect the spark plug wires .
disconnect the wire that goes from the coil to the distributor at the negative terminal of the coil .
carefully pull the rotor off the distributor shaft .
remove the two screws holding down the breaker plate and pull off the entire breaker plate/points assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two screws holding down the distributor cap, by using a flat head screwdriver, and remove the cap, but do not disconnect the spark plug wires. Disconnect the wire that goes from the coil to the distributor at the negative terminal of the coil. Carefully pull the rotor off the distributor shaft. Remove the two screws holding down the breaker plate and pull off the entire breaker plate/points assembly.

Lines.Text: your distributor should now look the same as the one pictured to the left .
take note of the notch on the body of the distributor opposite the vacuum advance can : this is where the new leads exit .
place the new breaker plate back on the distributor , so that the threads face up , and the advance pin slides into the vacuum advance shaft .
place the ignition module on the threaded studs as shown .
set one end of the ground strap on the stud nearest to the notch and loosely put on the two locking nuts .

Steps.Text_raw: Your distributor should now look the same as the one pictured to the left. Take note of the notch on the body of the distributor opposite the vacuum advance can: this is where the new leads exit. Place the new breaker plate back on the distributor, so that the threads face up, and the advance pin slides into the vacuum advance shaft. Place the ignition module on the threaded studs as shown. Set one end of the ground strap on the stud nearest to the notch and loosely put on the two locking nuts.

Lines.Text: align the breaker plate with the distributor body and screw it into place .
attach the other side of the grounding strap to the breaker plate hold-down screw as shown .
slide the magnetic sleeve onto the distributor shaft . make sure that it is pressed firmly in place .
using the provided plastic feeler gauge , or a 0.030 feeler gauge , set the gap between the ignition unit and the magnetic sleeve .
while holding the ignition unit in place tighten the two locking nuts .

Steps.Text_raw: Align the breaker plate with the distributor body and screw it into place. Attach the other side of the grounding strap to the breaker plate hold-down screw as shown. Slide the magnetic sleeve onto the distributor shaft. Make sure that it is pressed firmly in place. Using the provided plastic feeler gauge, or a 0.030" feeler gauge, set the gap between the ignition unit and the magnetic sleeve. While holding the ignition unit in place tighten the two locking nuts.

Lines.Text: route the new ignition module wires along the inside of the distributor , to the notch on the body .
firmly press the new insulating seal in as show .
slide the rotor back onto the distributor shaft making sure that the notch lines up an it presses all the way down .
place the distributor cap back on top of the distributor in the same orientation it was removed , this is the only way it will properly fit .
insert and tighten both distributor hold down screws .
attach the black wire from the new ignition unit to the negative terminal on the coil , and the red wire to the positive terminal on the coil , but do not remove other wires attached to the coil .
it is important to ensure that the new ignition unit wires are secure and will not come in contact with any of the pulleys or the fan belt while driving .

Steps.Text_raw: Route the new  ignition module wires along the inside of the distributor, to the notch on the body. Firmly press the new insulating seal in as show. Slide the rotor back onto the distributor shaft making sure that the notch lines up an it presses all the way down. Place the distributor cap back on top of the distributor in the same orientation it was removed, this is the only way it will properly fit. Insert and tighten both distributor hold down screws. Attach the black wire from the new ignition unit to the negative terminal on the coil, and the red wire to the positive terminal on the coil, but do not remove other wires attached to the coil. It is important to ensure that the new ignition unit wires are secure and will not come in contact with any of the pulleys or the fan belt while driving.

Title: How to optimize the timing of your 1965-1969 Chevrolet Corvair ignition

Lines.Text: attach stroboscopic timing light to the battery
negative ( black ) lead attaches first
then attach the positive ( red ) lead

Steps.Text_raw: Attach stroboscopic timing light to the battery Negative (black) lead attaches first Then attach the positive (red) lead

Lines.Text: attach stroboscopic timing light's current sensor to the wire leading to cylinder 1
you can identify the cylinder by the printed number .
the current sensor attaches around the wire leading out of the cylinder .

Steps.Text_raw: Attach stroboscopic timing light's current sensor to the wire leading to Cylinder #1 You can identify the cylinder by the printed number. The current sensor attaches around the wire leading out of the cylinder.

Lines.Text: using a 9 /16 inch wrench , loosen the distributor adjustment bolt and leave the wrench in place

Steps.Text_raw: Using a 9/16 inch wrench, loosen the distributor adjustment bolt and leave the wrench in place

Lines.Text: start the engine
remove the vacuum advance hose from the carburetor and plug it
you are now ready to begin reading the timing

Steps.Text_raw: Start the engine Remove the vacuum advance hose from the carburetor and plug it You are now ready to begin reading the timing

Lines.Text: point the timing light at the timing scale
the light will strobe when the cylinder fires and a mark on the crank shaft pulley will become visible .
the mark will appear next to the timing scale . the mark next to the timing scale indicates where the timing is currently set .
there are numbers on the scale , although they may be faded , and your timing value will likely be in between the marked values
the scale contains major marks at 0 , 8 , and 16 with minor marks at 4 and 12 before top dead center ( btdc )
all models will have differing timing values depending on the year and transmission .
our model-year was 1965 which has an ideal timing value of 14 degrees btdc ( in between 12 and 16 marks )
for other model-years , consult the list of timing values provided

Steps.Text_raw: Point the timing light at the timing scale The light will strobe when the cylinder fires and a mark on the crank shaft pulley will become visible. The mark will appear next to the timing scale. The mark next to the timing scale indicates where the timing is currently set. There are numbers on the scale, although they may be faded, and your timing value will likely be in between the marked values The scale contains major marks at 0, 8, and 16 with minor marks at 4 and 12 Before Top Dead Center (BTDC) All models will have differing timing values depending on the year and transmission. Our model-year was 1965 which has an ideal timing value of 14 degrees BTDC (in between 12 and 16 marks) For other model-years, consult the list of timing values provided [http://autoxer.skiblack.com/nallm/disdata.jpg|here]

Lines.Text: now that you know what your timing is currently set to , and you have looked up what it should be set at , you are ready to adjust the distributor to correct any differences .

grab the distributor and , while watching the timing mark as explained previously , rotate it '''''slowly''''' to one side or the other . continue rotating until the timing mark is in the correct position . refer to step 4 for how to read the timing mark .
you must turn very slowly , otherwise you can go outside of the acceptable timing range and severely damage your engine .
carefully tighten the 9 /16 locking bolt , and remove the wrench , making sure not to accidently rotate the distributor or contact the spinning pulley and belt .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that you know what your timing is currently set to, and you have looked up what it should be set at, you are ready to adjust the distributor to correct any differences. Grab the distributor and, while watching the timing mark as explained previously, rotate it '''''slowly''''' to one side or the other. Continue rotating until the timing mark is in the correct position. Refer to step 4 for how to read the timing mark. You must turn very slowly, otherwise you can go outside of the acceptable timing range and severely damage your engine. Carefully tighten the 9/16 locking bolt, and remove the wrench, making sure not to accidently rotate the distributor or contact the spinning pulley and belt.

Lines.Text: adjusting the valves first requires removing the valve cover . there are two valve covers , one on each side of the car . in this guide we'll be adjusting the valves on the drivers side , which does not have the exhaust in the way .
look under the back of the car , and on the side of the engine you will see the valve cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjusting the valves first requires removing the valve cover. There are two valve covers, one on each side of the car. In this guide we'll be adjusting the valves on the drivers side, which does not have the exhaust in the way. Look under the back of the car, and on the side of the engine you will see the valve cover.

Lines.Text: in order to remove the valve cover , locate the 4 bolts which hold it in place and remove them using a 7 /16 socket or wrench .
remove them carefully to avoid stripping the holes .

Steps.Text_raw: In order to remove the valve cover, locate the 4 bolts which hold it in place and remove them using a 7/16" socket or wrench. Remove them carefully to avoid stripping the holes.

Lines.Text: next , remove the valve cover and the gasket by pulling out gently .
put a piece of cardboard below to capture the oil which will spill out .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, remove the valve cover and the gasket by pulling out gently. Put a piece of cardboard below to capture the oil which will spill out.

Lines.Text: now you must attach the 1 /3 valve cover , which is essentially 1 /3 of a valve cover that keeps the oil in while exposing the valves so you can adjust them when the engine is running .
place the valve cover on the lower side of the valves and line up the bolt holes . verify the gasket is in place and use the bolts you previously removed to attach the adjustment cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Now you must attach the 1/3 Valve Cover, which is essentially 1/3 of a valve cover that keeps the oil in while exposing the valves so you can adjust them when the engine is running. Place the valve cover on the lower side of the valves and line up the bolt holes. Verify the gasket is in place and use the bolts you previously removed to attach the adjustment cover.

Lines.Text: finally , turn on the engine and you are ready to adjust .
start on the left side and adjust each one at a time using a 5 /16 socket .
loosen the bolt on the lifter till you hear that lifter start ticking . the ticking noise should be quite apparent .
then slowly tighten it till it stops ticking . and then tighten in one half turn . now you can move on to the next valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Finally, turn on the engine and you are ready to adjust. Start on the left side and adjust each one at a time using a 5/16" socket. Loosen the bolt on the lifter till you hear that lifter start ticking. The ticking noise should be quite apparent. Then slowly tighten it till it stops ticking. And then tighten in one half turn. Now you can move on to the next valve.

Lines.Text: open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell .
reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell. Reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch.

Lines.Text: in this guide we will be removing the left headlight . the steps are mirrored for the right headlight .

Steps.Text_raw: In this guide we will be removing the left headlight. The steps are mirrored for the right headlight.

Lines.Text: use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly . the screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly .
unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first .
locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove .
when re-installing the screws do not over tighten . over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly. The screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly. Unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first. Locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove. When re-installing the screws do not over tighten.  Over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads.

Lines.Text: approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind .
be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted . use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary . manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing .
pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic buttons on the headlight assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind. Be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted.  Use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary.  Manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing. Pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic "buttons" on the headlight assembly.

Lines.Text: locate the blue headlight wire . use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off .
locate the green turn signal wire clamp . use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector .
now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected , it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the blue headlight wire. Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off. Locate the green turn signal wire clamp. Use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector. Now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected, it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck.

Title: Fixing 2004-2010 Volkswagen Touareg Touareg Gas Leak

Lines.Text: start by removing the rear seat backs . here's some detailed steps .
flip the bottom of the seats forward . remove the headrests , and lay the seat-backs down flat .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing the rear seat backs.  Here's some detailed steps. Flip the bottom of the seats forward.  Remove the headrests, and lay the seat-backs down flat.

Lines.Text: using a t30 torx driver , remove the bolt that secures the clip in place .

remove the clip . do this by rotating the clip toward the front of the car - don't worry if you can't get it completely out . you can remove the clip after the left seatback is removed . just be sure you can get the left seatback loose .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T30 Torx driver, remove the bolt that secures the clip in place. Remove the clip.  Do this by rotating the clip toward the front of the car - don't worry if you can't get it completely out.  You can remove the clip after the left seatback is removed.  Just be sure you can get the left seatback loose.

Lines.Text: remove the left seatback .
to accomplish this , the seatback needs to be free of the mounting bracket toward the inside of the car ( see previous step ) .
the seat needs to lean forward then pushed toward the center of the car to release it from the side of the vehicle .
see the pics to get an idea of the angle needed and what the mounting pin looks like on the side of the vehicle .
'''a couple important notes about my pictures : '''

the picture of the seatback leaning forward shows the seat bottom being used as a support - this was for the photo only to give you an idea of the angle . when removing the seatback , the seat bottom needs to be all the way forward .

the picture of the seat ( removed from the vehicle ) lets you see inside the hole that engages the mounting pin . there's a piece of plastic trim missing from this photo . my trim broke during a prior removal attempt . . .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the left seatback. To accomplish this, the seatback needs to be free of the mounting bracket toward the inside of the car (see previous step). The seat needs to lean forward then pushed toward the center of the car to release it from the side of the vehicle. See the pics to get an idea of the angle needed and what the mounting pin looks like on the side of the vehicle. '''A couple important notes about my pictures:''' The picture of the seatback leaning forward shows the seat bottom being used as a support - this was for the photo only to give you an idea of the angle.  When removing the seatback, the seat bottom needs to be all the way forward. The picture of the seat (removed from the vehicle) lets you see inside the hole that engages the mounting pin.  There's a piece of plastic trim missing from this photo.  My trim broke during a prior removal attempt...

Lines.Text: prepare to cut the carpet to access the fuel tank ports .
raise the left seatback and lock it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Prepare to cut the carpet to access the fuel tank ports. Raise the left seatback and lock it in place.

Lines.Text: cut open the carpet to access the fuel tank ports . notice that the interior carpet is perforated giving you a guide of where to cut .
do this on both sides of the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut open the carpet to access the fuel tank ports.  Notice that the interior carpet is perforated giving you a guide of where to cut. Do this on both sides of the vehicle.

Lines.Text: remove the seatback bracket .
use a 10 mm triple square driver to remove the 4 bolts on the seatback bracket .
you will have to move the right seatback around a bit to free it up from the bracket .
when free , remove the bracket from the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the seatback bracket. Use a 10mm triple square driver to remove the 4 bolts on the seatback bracket. You will have to move the right seatback around a bit to free it up from the bracket. When free, remove the bracket from the vehicle.

Lines.Text: remove the right seatback .
this is similar to the left seatback .
lean the seat forward 30 or so . while leaning forward , push the seat toward the center of the vehicle to release the seat from the pin on the side of the vehicle .
the center seatbelt is attached to the floor . you need to remove the 10 mm triple square bolt before the seat can be removed from the vehicle .
once the seatback is free , remove it from the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the right seatback. This is similar to the left seatback. Lean the seat forward 30° or so.  While leaning forward, push the seat toward the center of the vehicle to release the seat from the pin on the side of the vehicle. The center seatbelt is attached to the floor.  You need to remove the 10mm triple square bolt before the seat can be removed from the vehicle. Once the seatback is free, remove it from the vehicle.

Lines.Text: remove the seatbelt bracket for the right side .
to do this , remove the three 10 mm triple square bolts attaching the bracket to the floor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the seatbelt bracket for the right side. To do this, remove the three 10mm triple square bolts attaching the bracket to the floor.

Lines.Text: here's some notes about the triple square tool and bolts .
i've tried a number of triple square drivers over the years , mostly with poor results . good ones are expensive !
here's a rather inexpensive triple square driver set ( around 30 ) : from amazon

i had a set from sk tools that was very poor - the drivers were very loose when you put them in the bolt head you were trying to remove . they'd slip and strip the head of the bolt . not recommended !

please note that these triple square bolts are extremely tight and difficult to remove . it's not that their just tight , they have lock-tight or something on them that make them hard to remove all together . they don't just break loose .
the official vw repair manual states these bolts are to be replaced and not re-used . vw part number for these : n 910 260 03. available from impex .

Steps.Text_raw: Here's some notes about the triple square tool and bolts. I've tried a number of triple square drivers over the years, mostly with poor results.  Good ones are expensive! Here's a rather inexpensive triple square driver set (around $30):  [http://www.amazon.com/8Pc-Triple-Square-4Mm-16Mm-Set/dp/B000I1Q60O|VIMXZN100 from Amazon] I had a set from SK Tools that was very poor - the drivers were very loose when you put them in the bolt head you were trying to remove.  They'd slip and strip the head of the bolt.  Not recommended! Please note that these triple square bolts are extremely tight and difficult to remove.  It's not that their just tight, they have lock-tight or something on them that make them hard to remove all together.  They don't just "break loose". The official VW repair manual states these bolts are to be replaced and not re-used.  VW part number for these: N 910 260 03.  Available from [http://www.worldimpex.com/search_by_partno.html?searchmode=partno&partno=N+910+260+03&x=0&y=0|World Impex].

Lines.Text: using a 10 mm socket , remove the 4 bolts that cover the gas tank access cover .
remove the covers - on mine , the smell of gas was very much present now !
do this on both sides of the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a 10mm socket, remove the 4 bolts that cover the gas tank access cover. Remove the covers - on mine, the smell of gas was very much present now! Do this on both sides of the vehicle.

Lines.Text: look here ! there's gas floating around on top of the driver's side . it also looks clean and shiny ( compared to the passenger side ) .
upon closer inspection ( and a tip from the leak is at the top of the dome . zooming in shows about a 1 /8 crack seen in the pictures as a discoloration at the top of the dome .
when the fuel pump is on , the gas is flowing . even after the pump stops , the gas keeps coming out ( as i imagine the system is still under pressure ) .
vw part number for this assembly is 7 l0 919 679. world impex has a vdo equivalent ( the original is made by vdo as well ) for under 100. here .

Steps.Text_raw: Look here!  There's gas floating around on top of the driver's side.  It also looks "clean" and shiny (compared to the passenger side). Upon closer inspection (and a tip from [http://www.clubtouareg.com/forums/f43/gas-leak-on-2005-touareg-80027.html#post375000|Crazyhippy]) the leak is at the top of the dome.  Zooming in shows about a 1/8" crack seen in the pictures as a discoloration at the top of the dome. When the fuel pump is on, the gas is flowing.  Even after the pump stops, the gas keeps coming out (as I imagine the system is still under pressure). VW part number for this assembly is 7L0 919 679.  World Impex has a VDO equivalent (the original is made by VDO as well) for under $100.  [http://www.worldimpex.com/parts/vdo-fuel-filter_3646321.html|See here.]

Lines.Text: on the passenger side , the gas tank looks dirty and un-touched . i don't think there's a gas leak here .
you can see that some gas is present outside of the access port - i suspect this is from the leak on the driver side being splashed around .

Steps.Text_raw: On the passenger side, the gas tank looks dirty and un-touched.  I don't think there's a gas leak here. You can see that some gas is present outside of the access port - I suspect this is from the leak on the driver side being splashed around.

Lines.Text: remove the fuses for the fuel pumps . these are fuse number 13 and 14 ( according to the vw service manual ) . these are found under the hood .
pop the hood
remove the two access panels on the driver's side near the firewall .
use a large flat blade screwdriver to open each . the screws turn 90 to disengage .
these fuses are highlighted and removed in the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the fuses for the fuel pumps.  These are fuse number 13 and 14 (according to the VW service manual).  These are found under the hood. Pop the hood Remove the two access panels on the driver's side near the firewall. Use a large flat blade screwdriver to open each.  The screws turn 90° to disengage. These fuses are highlighted and removed in the next step.

Lines.Text: fuses 13 and 14 are highlighted . note that these are marked as 15 amp fuses .
pull them out and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Fuses 13 and 14 are highlighted.  Note that these are marked as 15 amp fuses. Pull them out and set them aside.

Lines.Text: go back to the fuel tank access ports .
remove the electrical connector for the fuel pump .
use a large flat blade screwdriver to insert into the tab . gently push the top of the screwdriver toward the wires .
pull up on the connector . if yours is difficult to remove , you can get some extra leverage from a 90 screwdriver as shown .
be sure to release the latch ( using the large flat blade screwdriver ) before prying up with the 90 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Go back to the fuel tank access ports. Remove the electrical connector for the fuel pump. Use a large flat blade screw driver to insert into the tab.  Gently push the top of the screw driver toward the wires. Pull up on the connector.  If yours is difficult to remove, you can get some extra leverage from a 90° screwdriver as shown. Be sure to release the latch (using the large flat blade screwdriver) before prying up with the 90° screwdriver.

Lines.Text: on my vehicle , the amount of gas that was leaking caused the gasket in the electrical connector to breakdown .
as you can see here , the gasket came out and was in pieces .
we'll fix this later .

Steps.Text_raw: On my vehicle, the amount of gas that was leaking caused the gasket in the electrical connector to breakdown. As you can see here, the gasket came out and was in pieces. We'll fix this later.

Lines.Text: remove the vent hose from the fuel filter assembly .
do this by pressing down on the small tab on top of the connector .
this tab stands out as a white part on the otherwise black connector .
while the tab is pressed down , slide the connector off the filter assembly and push it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the vent hose from the fuel filter assembly. Do this by pressing down on the small tab on top of the connector. This tab stands out as a white part on the otherwise black connector. While the tab is pressed down, slide the connector off the filter assembly and push it aside.

Lines.Text: place vw tool t10202 on the ring that secures the fuel filter assembly in place .
use t10202 to remove the ring .
pull the ring off and set it aside .
tool t10202 is a specialty tool that can be ordered from a few vw tool places for 25-50.
this tool made things incredibly easy to remove ( and later reinstall ) the ring . the alternative is to beat around in here with a screwdriver and hammer . i can't imagine doing that .
this tool was worth every penny for this job !

Steps.Text_raw: Place VW Tool T10202 on the ring that secures the fuel filter assembly in place. Use T10202 to remove the ring. Pull the ring off and set it aside. Tool T10202 is a specialty tool that can be ordered from a few VW tool places for $25-$50. This tool made things incredibly easy to remove (and later reinstall) the ring.  The alternative is to beat around in here with a screwdriver and hammer.  I can't imagine doing that. This tool was worth every penny for this job!

Lines.Text: pull the fuel filter assembly out of the gas tank .
there are many connections on the assembly that will restrict you from pulling it out .
the first thing you'll run into are the electrical connections .
pull these off and set them aside . they are going to fall into the tank . you may be able to rest them on something - or you may have to fish them out of the tank later if you lose track of them .

notice how these connectors are installed so you can reinstall them later . one is polarized ( meaning it can only attach in one direction ) - the other is not . i suspect that the non-polarized connector can go on either way without harm - but i wouldn't chance it .
pay attention to the direction it is when you take it off so you can reinstall it the same way later .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the fuel filter assembly out of the gas tank. There are many connections on the assembly that will restrict you from pulling it out. The first thing you'll run into are the electrical connections. Pull these off and set them aside.  They are going to fall into the tank.  You may be able to rest them on something - or you may have to fish them out of the tank later if you lose track of them. Notice how these connectors are installed so you can reinstall them later.  One is polarized (meaning it can only attach in one direction) - the other is not.  I suspect that the non-polarized connector can go on either way without harm - but I wouldn't chance it. Pay attention to the direction it is when you take it off so you can reinstall it the same way later.

Lines.Text: remove the fuel lines from the fuel filter assembly .
there are three lines - you are only removing two of them .
remove the two lines that have plastic connectors on the ends .
release the connections by pressing in on the plastic tabs similar to the vent hose connection we did in a previous step .
the large fuel line has two tabs ( one on each side ) - i was able to squeeze this with my fingers to remove .
the small fuel line has one tab - i used a screwdriver to push that tab in .
after you push the tab ( s ) in , pull the fuel line off .
the third hose on the fuel filter assembly is fastened by a metal clip - do not remove this one . we'll remove the other end of this hose in the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the fuel lines from the fuel filter assembly. There are three lines - you are only removing two of them. Remove the two lines that have plastic connectors on the ends. Release the connections by pressing in on the plastic tabs similar to the vent hose connection we did in a previous step. The large fuel line has two tabs (one on each side) - I was able to squeeze this with my fingers to remove. The small fuel line has one tab - I used a screw driver to push that tab in. After you push the tab(s) in, pull the fuel line off. The third hose on the fuel filter assembly is fastened by a metal clip - do not remove this one.  We'll remove the other end of this hose in the next step.

Lines.Text: now move to the passenger side .
remove the fuel pump electrical connector just like you did on the other side .
remove the vent hose the same as you did on the other side ( the white line ) .
remove the black fuel line by pressing in on the tab as shown . when the tab is depressed , gently pull up on the fuel line .
i had a little gas come out of the fuel line - so have a rag handy to clean it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Now move to the passenger side. Remove the fuel pump electrical connector just like you did on the other side. Remove the vent hose the same as you did on the other side (the white line). Remove the black fuel line by pressing in on the tab as shown.  When the tab is depressed, gently pull up on the fuel line. I had a little gas come out of the fuel line - so have a rag handy to clean it up.

Lines.Text: use the t10202 tool again here to remove the retaining ring . set the ring aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the T10202 tool again here to remove the retaining ring.  Set the ring aside.

Lines.Text: pull this fuel assembly up and out of the fuel tank .

you need to remove the fuel line indicated in the picture . this is the line that connects to the fuel filter assembly on the other end ( and the other end is permanently attached to the fuel filter assembly ) .
like all the other connections , this connector is removed by depressing the tab and pulling the fuel line off .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull this fuel assembly up and out of the fuel tank. You need to remove the fuel line indicated in the picture.  This is the line that connects to the fuel filter assembly on the other end (and the other end is permanently attached to the fuel filter assembly). Like all the other connections, this connector is removed by depressing the tab and pulling the fuel line off.

Lines.Text: now go back to the driver's side .
you can pull the fuel filter assembly out of the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Now go back to the driver's side. You can pull the fuel filter assembly out of the vehicle.

Lines.Text: prepare the new fuel filter assembly for installation .
temporarily place a new fuel tank gasket on the fuel filter assembly ( the gasket is orange )
remove the protective caps from the new fuel filter assembly . they are found on every fuel line connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Prepare the new fuel filter assembly for installation. Temporarily place a new fuel tank gasket on the fuel filter assembly (the gasket is orange) Remove the protective caps from the new fuel filter assembly.  They are found on every fuel line connection.

Lines.Text: now you need to fish the long fuel line through the gas tank to the passenger side port .
start by inserting the new fuel filter assembly and fuel line into the driver's side .
go to the passenger side and find the new fuel line and pull it far enough to reach the assembly on that side .
attach the new fuel line to the existing passenger side assembly .
push the new fuel line on until you hear or feel a click .
when successfully mated , you shouldn't be able to pull the fuel line off ( unless you press on the tabs ) .
temporarily set things down on the passenger side and go back to the driver's side .

Steps.Text_raw: Now you need to fish the long fuel line through the gas tank to the passenger side port. Start by inserting the new fuel filter assembly and fuel line into the driver's side. Go to the passenger side and find the new fuel line and pull it far enough to reach the assembly on that side. Attach the new fuel line to the existing passenger side assembly. Push the new fuel line on until you hear or feel a click. When successfully mated, you shouldn't be able to pull the fuel line off (unless you press on the tabs). Temporarily set things down on the passenger side and go back to the driver's side.

Lines.Text: back on the driver's side . . .
connect the two fuel lines inside the fuel tank to the fuel filter assembly .
these lines are different sizes so you can't mix them up .
again , press these lines on until you hear or feel a click . you shouldn't be able to remove the hose by pulling on it ( unless you press the release tab ) .
place the new gasket in place on the fuel tank as shown . clean the mating edge of the fuel tank first so you get a good seal .
continue connecting the electrical connections to the fuel filter assembly . these connections should be the same as when you removed the original fuel filter assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Back on the driver's side... Connect the two fuel lines inside the fuel tank to the fuel filter assembly. These lines are different sizes so you can't mix them up. Again, press these lines on until you hear or feel a click.  You shouldn't be able to remove the hose by pulling on it (unless you press the release tab). Place the new gasket in place on the fuel tank as shown.  Clean the mating edge of the fuel tank first so you get a good seal. Continue connecting the electrical connections to the fuel filter assembly.  These connections should be the same as when you removed the original fuel filter assembly.

Lines.Text: press the fuel filter assembly into the gas tank .
it shouldn't take much force - you're just overcoming the friction of the gasket .
the fuel filter assembly has a tab to align it with the gas tank .
remove the protective cover from the vent hose connection , but don't connect the vent hose yet .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the fuel filter assembly into the gas tank. It shouldn't take much force - you're just overcoming the friction of the gasket. The fuel filter assembly has a tab to align it with the gas tank. Remove the protective cover from the vent hose connection, but don't connect the vent hose yet.
