Lines.Text: move back to the passenger side .
remove the gas tank old gasket . i was able to slide this over the assembly without needing to remove it .
likewise , install a new gasket ( shown in orange here ) . again , i could slip this over the existing assembly without much effort .
clean the mating surface of the gasket before installation to ensure a good seal .
push the assembly back into place . the assembly has a tab to align it to the proper direction .
do not make any connections yet .

Steps.Text_raw: Move back to the passenger side. Remove the gas tank old gasket.  I was able to slide this over the assembly without needing to remove it. Likewise, install a new gasket (shown in orange here).  Again, I could slip this over the existing assembly without much effort. Clean the mating surface of the gasket before installation to ensure a good seal. Push the assembly back into place.  The assembly has a tab to align it to the proper direction. Do not make any connections yet.

Lines.Text: place the retaining ring onto the assembly .
use tool t10202 to tighten the ring .
tighten to 110 nm ( 80 ft lbs )
reconnect the fuel pump electrical connection . ensure it clicks and locks in place .
reconnect the vent line . ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab .
reconnect the fuel line . ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the retaining ring onto the assembly. Use tool T10202 to tighten the ring. Tighten to 110 NM (80 ft lbs) Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connection.  Ensure it clicks and locks in place. Reconnect the vent line.  Ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab. Reconnect the fuel line.  Ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab.

Lines.Text: go back to the driver's side .
install the retaining ring .
use tool t10202 to tighten to 110 nm ( 80 ft lbs ) .
reconnect the fuel pump electrical connector ( remember , mine is missing the gasket - i'll come back later and fix that ) .
reconnect the vent line . ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab .

Steps.Text_raw: Go back to the driver's side. Install the retaining ring. Use tool T10202 to tighten to 110 NM (80 ft lbs). Reconnect the fuel pump electrical connector (remember, mine is missing the gasket - I'll come back later and fix that). Reconnect the vent line.  Ensure you can't pull it off without using the release tab.

Lines.Text: reinstall fuses 13 and 14.
reinstall the covers and close the hood .
start the car and let it run for a few minutes and see if you observe any gas leaks .
if everything looks good - it's time for reassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Reinstall fuses 13 and 14. Reinstall the covers and close the hood. Start the car and let it run for a few minutes and see if you observe any gas leaks. If everything looks good - it's time for reassembly.

Lines.Text: here's a new gas tank connector with the gasket inside .
push the purple locking mechanism in .
gently remove the orange gasket from the connector body .
i used a small pick to get underneath the gasket and slowly worked it out of the connector body .
this connector is vw part number 1 j0 919 231. i bought mine from impex for about 6 bucks .

Steps.Text_raw: Here's a new gas tank connector with the gasket inside. Push the purple locking mechanism in. Gently remove the orange gasket from the connector body. I used a small pick to get underneath the gasket and slowly worked it out of the connector body. This connector is VW part number 1J0 919 231.  I bought mine from [http://www.worldimpex.com/search_by_partno.html?searchmode=partno&partno=1J0+919+231&x=0&y=0|World Impex] for about 6 bucks.

Lines.Text: disconnect the connector on the fuel filter assembly .
gently push the new gasket all the way inside the connector .
reattach the connector to the fuel filter assembly . you should hear a click when the lock mechanism engages .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the connector on the fuel filter assembly. Gently push the new gasket all the way inside the connector. Reattach the connector to the fuel filter assembly.  You should hear a click when the lock mechanism engages.

Lines.Text: install the covers back on top of the gas tank ports .

Steps.Text_raw: Install the covers back on top of the gas tank ports.

Lines.Text: get your new bolts ready for installation .
vw recommends that these bolts are replaced once removed .
vw part number is n 910 260 03. you need 8 of them . i bought mine from impex for around 1.70 each .

Steps.Text_raw: Get your new bolts ready for installation. VW recommends that these bolts are replaced once removed. VW part number is N 910 260 03.  You need 8 of them.  I bought mine from [http://www.worldimpex.com/search_by_partno.html?searchmode=partno&partno=N+910+260+03&x=0&y=0|World Impex] for around $1.70 each.

Lines.Text: install the passenger side seat belt mount .
vw states that the order of installation of these bolts is important . see the picture of the service manual for the order .
torque these bolts to 20 nm .
notice there's only 3 bolts on this side .

Steps.Text_raw: Install the passenger side seat belt mount. VW states that the order of installation of these bolts is important.  See the picture of the service manual for the order. Torque these bolts to 20 Nm. Notice there's only 3 bolts on this side.

Lines.Text: the process is similar for the driver's side .
again , vw recommends the order of bolt installation . see the service manual picture .
torque these 4 bolts to 20 nm .

Steps.Text_raw: The process is similar for the driver's side. Again, VW recommends the order of bolt installation.  See the service manual picture. Torque these 4 bolts to 20 Nm.

Lines.Text: go back to the passenger side .
set the passenger side of the rear seat near it's final position ( i set mine up on the ledge of the trunk ) .
install the seatbelt bolt .
vw states to torque this bolt to 50 nm . yes that's right , 50 nm for this bolt . the other bolts from the previous steps had a different torque spec .

Steps.Text_raw: Go back to the passenger side. Set the passenger side of the rear seat near it's final position (I set mine up on the ledge of the "trunk"). Install the seatbelt bolt. VW states to torque this bolt to 50 Nm.  Yes that's right, 50 Nm for this bolt.  The other bolts from the previous steps had a different torque spec.

Lines.Text: install the passenger side seat back in place .
this is similar to the removal step - you need to angle the seat back at about a 45 angle to get it to fit on the pin in the side of the vehicle .
be sure to get the seat belt fastener on the right side of the seat ( i had to remove my seat to fix this because i didn't check the first time i set the seat in place ! )
lay the passenger seat flat .
install the driver's side seat back in a similar manner ( angle at 45 to install on the pin ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Install the passenger side seat back in place. This is similar to the removal step - you need to angle the seat back at about a 45° angle to get it to fit on the pin in the side of the vehicle. Be sure to get the seat belt fastener on the right side of the seat (I had to remove my seat to fix this because I didn't check the first time I set the seat in place!) Lay the passenger seat flat. Install the driver's side seat back in a similar manner (angle at 45° to install on the pin).

Lines.Text: install the clip that retains the seat backs .
install the torx screw to retain the clip .

Steps.Text_raw: Install the clip that retains the seat backs. Install the Torx screw to retain the clip.

Lines.Text: lift the seat backs up .
install the head rests
install the carpet over the fuel tank port covers ( i just set mine on top of the ports - no glue or anything ) .
put the seats back in place
you're done !

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the seat backs up. Install the head rests Install the carpet over the fuel tank port covers (I just set mine on top of the ports - no glue or anything). Put the seats back in place You're done!

Title: How to adjust a Chevrolet Corvair steering box

Lines.Text: open the ( front ) hood of the car .
on the drivers side of the luggage compartment is a black seal .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the (front) hood of the car. On the drivers side of the luggage compartment is a black seal.

Lines.Text: remove the black seal .
under the seal is the adjustment screw and locking nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black seal. Under the seal is the adjustment screw and locking nut.

Lines.Text: if the screw threads do not rise above the locking nut then '''stop''' : the steering box is worn out , it is time to rebuild it , or replace it ! failure to do so could result in your steering system failing .
loosen the locking nut , so the set screw can be turned with a flat head screwdriver .
with the wheels straight and the steering wheel centered . turn the lash adjustment screw clockwise until it stops , but don't force it any farther !
making sure that the screw does not turn , carefully tighten the locking nut .

Steps.Text_raw: If the screw threads do not rise above the locking nut then '''STOP''': The steering box is worn out, it is time to rebuild it, or replace it! Failure to do so could result in your steering system failing. Loosen the Locking nut, so the set screw can be turned with a flat head screwdriver. With the wheels straight and the steering wheel centered. Turn the lash adjustment screw clockwise until it stops, but don't force it any farther! Making sure that the screw does not turn, carefully tighten the locking nut.

Lines.Text: close the hood , drive around and check the steering wheel play .
if the play is still too loose , then repeat steps 2 and 3.

if the steering wheel does not return to center after making a turn then it is too tight . this can cause unnecessary wear and damage your steering box ! return to step 2 , but instead of tightening the lash screw , loosen it a quarter turn at a time and recheck .

Steps.Text_raw: Close the hood, drive around and check the steering wheel play. If the play is still too loose, then repeat steps 2 and 3. If the steering wheel does not return to center after making a turn then it is too tight. This can cause unnecessary wear and damage your steering box! Return to step 2, but instead of tightening the lash screw, loosen it a quarter turn at a time and recheck.

Lines.Text: use the 1 /2 socket to loosen and remove the four bolts and washers on the spark plug cover labeled 2.4 l twin cam .
these four bolts should be torqued to 18 ft-lbs when putting the spark plug cover back on .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 1/2" socket to loosen and remove the four bolts and washers on the spark plug cover labeled 2.4L Twin Cam. These four bolts should be torqued to 18 ft-lbs when putting the spark plug cover back on.

Lines.Text: with a flathead screwdriver remove the ignition coil electrical connector on the right side of spark plug cover .
be careful while disconnecting the ignition coil electrical connector as it may break .

Steps.Text_raw: With a flathead screwdriver remove the ignition coil electrical connector on the right side of spark plug cover. Be careful while disconnecting the ignition coil electrical connector as it may break.

Lines.Text: remove the spark plug cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the spark plug cover.

Lines.Text: when working with compressed air , wear safety glasses to protect your eyes from flying debris .
use compressed air to clear any debris from the area around the spark plugs .
any particles that fall into the cylinder could cause serious engine damage .
use a 5 /8 spark plug socket with an extension to loosen and remove the spark plugs .

Steps.Text_raw: When working with compressed air, wear safety glasses to protect your eyes from flying debris. Use compressed air to clear any debris from the area around the spark plugs. Any particles that fall into the cylinder could cause serious engine damage. Use a 5/8" spark plug socket with an extension to loosen and remove the spark plugs.

Lines.Text: before installing the new spark plugs check that the spark plugs' gap is between 0.048 and 0.052 inches .
if it needs to be widened , use a gap setter to increase the size of the gap until it reaches the desired width .

Steps.Text_raw: Before installing the new spark plugs check that the spark plugs' gap is between 0.048 and 0.052 inches. If it needs to be widened, use a gap setter to increase the size of the gap until it reaches the desired width.

Lines.Text: wedge the new spark plugs into a 5 /8 '' spark plug socket .
place the spark plug into the cylinder using the socket and hand tighten the spark plugs as much as possible .
tighten the spark plugs to 13 ft-lbs with a torque wrench .
do not over tighten spark plugs . this could strip out the threaded holes in the head .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the new spark plugs into a 5/8'' spark plug socket. Place the spark plug into the cylinder using the socket and hand tighten the spark plugs as much as possible. Tighten the spark plugs to 13 ft-lbs with a torque wrench. Do not over tighten spark plugs.  This could strip out the threaded holes in the head.

Lines.Text: use caution while handling brake fluid . brake fluid strips paint and dissolves plastic .
there is a maximum fluid line on the right side of the reservoir . remove the brake fluid cap and fill the brake fluid to the maximum level line .

Steps.Text_raw: Use caution while handling brake fluid. Brake fluid strips paint and dissolves plastic. There is a maximum fluid line on the right side of the reservoir. Remove the brake fluid cap and fill the brake fluid to the maximum level line.

Lines.Text: do not overfill the power steering fluid reservoir , as this can overwork the power steering pump and cause it to burn up .
remove the power steering fluid cap . check the fluid level using the dipstick attached to the cap .
fill the power steering fluid to the appropriate level indicated by the h for hot and the c for cold .
if the car has not been started then the fluid is cold . if the engine has been running for five minutes or more , then it is hot .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not overfill the power steering fluid reservoir, as this can overwork the power steering pump and cause it to burn up. Remove the power steering fluid cap. Check the fluid level using the dipstick attached to the cap. Fill the power steering fluid to the appropriate level indicated by the "H" for hot and the "C" for cold. If the car has not been started then the fluid is cold.  If the engine has been running for five minutes or more, then it is hot.

Lines.Text: use the yellow handled oil dipstick to check the oil level by removing the dipstick , wiping off the oil , and re-inserting it .
remove the dipstick again and check the oil level . full level is read on the right side of the dipstick .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the yellow handled oil dipstick to check the oil level by removing the dipstick, wiping off the oil, and re-inserting it. Remove the dipstick again and check the oil level. Full level is read on the right side of the dipstick.

Lines.Text: if the oil level is below full , add oil to the car by removing the cap labeled engine oil .
add a small amount of oil and repeat step 3 until the oil level is full .

Steps.Text_raw: If the oil level is below full, add oil to the car by removing the cap labeled "Engine Oil." Add a small amount of oil and repeat Step 3 until the oil level is full.

Lines.Text: make sure the engine is cool before removing the radiator reservoir cap . radiator coolant needs to be disposed of properly . visit this link for more information
remove the radiator reservoir cap and fill it with coolant until it reaches the full level indicator line on the front side of the reservoir .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the engine is cool before removing the radiator reservoir cap. Radiator coolant needs to be disposed of properly. Visit this link for more information http://www.epa.gov/osw/conserve/materials/antifree.htm Remove the radiator reservoir cap and fill it with coolant until it reaches the full level indicator line on the front side of the reservoir.

Title: 1997-2003 Chevrolet Malibu Front Brake Pads Replacement

Lines.Text: if using the car's emergency scissor-jack , identify the designated placement locations for this specific jack .
the jack needs to be placed behind the front tire in one of the two slots indicated by the red markers .
the slots are one foot behind each front tire , and 8-10 inches inward from the outer edge of the car .
while on flat ground , put the jack in the slot closest to the front .

Steps.Text_raw: If using the car's emergency scissor-jack, identify the designated placement locations for this specific jack. The jack needs to be placed behind the front tire in one of the two slots indicated by the red markers. The slots are one foot behind each front tire, and 8-10 inches inward from the outer edge of the car. While on flat ground,  put the jack in the slot closest to the front.

Lines.Text: '''do not go under the car unless the car is support by a jack stand . '''
put a block in front of one of the rear tires and another block behind the same rear tire . this prevents the car from rolling in either direction while the front is jacked up .
to operate the jack stand , turn clockwise to lift up and turn counter clockwise to low down .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Do not go under the car unless the car is support by a jack stand. ''' Put a block in front of one of the rear tires and another block behind the same rear tire. This prevents the car from rolling in either direction while the front is jacked up. To operate the jack stand, turn clockwise to lift up and turn counter clockwise to low down.

Lines.Text: loosen the plastic lug nuts , located on the hub-cap , with a 19 mm socket .
when putting the hub-cap back onto the wheel , tighten the lugs until you feel firm resistance . do not over tighten because the threads will strip .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the plastic lug nuts, located on the hub-cap, with a 19mm socket. When putting the hub-cap back onto the wheel, tighten the lugs until you feel firm resistance. Do not over tighten because the threads will strip.

Lines.Text: loosen and remove the five metal lug nuts with a 19 mm socket .
torque the metal lug nuts to 100 ft-lbs when putting the wheels back on the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen and remove the five metal lug nuts with a 19mm socket. Torque the metal lug nuts to 100 ft-lbs when putting the wheels back on the car.

Lines.Text: remove the wheel from the hub .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wheel from the hub.

Lines.Text: loosen and remove the two bolts located on the backside of the caliper with a 12 mm socket .
torque the two bolts to 33 ft-lbs when putting the caliper back on the mounting bracket .
remove the caliper from the mounting bracket .
do not allow the caliper to hang freely . this will causes stretching or internal blocking of the brake line .
tip : using hang wire to hang the caliper on the spring mount to keep it out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen and remove the two bolts located on the backside of the caliper with a 12mm socket. Torque the two bolts to 33 ft-lbs when putting the caliper back on the mounting bracket. Remove the caliper from the mounting bracket. Do not allow the caliper to hang freely.  This will causes stretching or internal blocking of the brake line. TIP: Using hang wire to hang the caliper on the spring mount to keep it out of the way.

Lines.Text: use a pry bar to remove the old brake pad from the bracket .
use the same procedure for removing the pads on the other sides .
tip : using c-clamp to compress the caliper to refit the new brake pads
after removing the pads , you can check the rotor for irregular wear or damage . run your finger across the face of the rotor to feel for grooves or chipping .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pry bar to remove the old brake pad from the bracket. Use the same procedure for removing the pads on the other sides. TIP: Using C-clamp to compress the caliper to refit the new brake pads After removing the pads, you can check the rotor for irregular wear or damage.  Run your finger across the face of the rotor to feel for grooves or chipping.

Lines.Text: pull the two caliper pins out of the mounting bracket by hand .
if needed , apply brake lubricant to the two caliper pins . this fights corrosion buildup and allows the pins to slide off more smoothly .
before putting the new brake pads on , apply disc brake quiet compound to the metal backing of the pads to keep them from squeaking .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the two caliper pins out of the mounting bracket by hand. If needed,  apply "Brake Lubricant" to the two caliper pins. This fights corrosion buildup and allows the pins to slide off more smoothly. Before putting the new brake pads on, apply "Disc Brake Quiet" compound to the metal backing of the pads to keep them from squeaking.

Subject: Front Brake Pads

Lines.Text: open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell .
reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell. Reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch.

Lines.Text: in this guide we will be removing the left headlight . the steps are mirrored for the right headlight .

Steps.Text_raw: In this guide we will be removing the left headlight. The steps are mirrored for the right headlight.

Lines.Text: use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly . the screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly .
unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first .
locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove .
when re-installing the screws do not over tighten . over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly. The screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly. Unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first. Locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove. When re-installing the screws do not over tighten.  Over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads.

Lines.Text: approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind .
be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted . use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary . manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing .
pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic buttons on the headlight assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind. Be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted.  Use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary.  Manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing. Pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic "buttons" on the headlight assembly.

Lines.Text: locate the blue headlight wire . use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off .
locate the green turn signal wire clamp . use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector .
now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected , it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the blue headlight wire. Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off. Locate the green turn signal wire clamp. Use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector. Now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected, it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck.

Lines.Text: rotate the outer ring of the headlight bulb holder counterclockwise to remove it .
carefully pull the headlight bulb holder out of its socket .

when installing a headlight bulb , '''do not touch the bulb with your bare skin''' . wear gloves when installing a new headlight bulb . halogen bulbs are sensitive to skin oils , and the bulb may burn out quickly if you touch the bulb during installation .
if you accidentally touch the bulb , clean it immediately using rubbing alcohol on a clean cloth .

Steps.Text_raw: Rotate the outer ring of the headlight bulb holder counterclockwise to remove it. Carefully pull the headlight bulb holder out of its socket. When installing a headlight bulb, '''do not touch the bulb with your bare skin'''. Wear gloves when installing a new headlight bulb. Halogen bulbs are sensitive to skin oils, and the bulb may burn out quickly if you touch the bulb during installation. If you accidentally touch the bulb, clean it immediately using rubbing alcohol on a clean cloth.

Lines.Text: open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell .
reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the hood by pulling the hood lever in the driver-side footwell. Reach under the center of the grille and press the hood latch.

Lines.Text: in this guide we will be removing the left headlight . the steps are mirrored for the right headlight .

Steps.Text_raw: In this guide we will be removing the left headlight. The steps are mirrored for the right headlight.

Lines.Text: use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly . the screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly .
unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first .
locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove .
when re-installing the screws do not over tighten . over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 10 mm socket wrench to unscrew the first of three 12 mm long 10 mm hex-head screws holding in the headlight assembly. The screw is located just to the left of the headlight assembly. Unscrew the second screw located approximately 6 inches below the first. Locate the third screw at the bottom left corner of the headlight assembly just behind the bumper and remove. When re-installing the screws do not over tighten.  Over tightening the screws will result in stripped threads.

Lines.Text: approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind .
be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted . use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary . manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing .
pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic buttons on the headlight assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Approach this step with the process of unbuttoning a shirt in mind. Be careful if the rubber gasket is dry-rotted.  Use vaseline to re-moisturize if necessary.  Manipulating dry-rotted rubber will result in tearing. Pinch the bottom of the rubber gasket at the left side of the assembly and remove it from the plastic "buttons" on the headlight assembly.

Lines.Text: locate the blue headlight wire . use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off .
locate the green turn signal wire clamp . use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector .
now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected , it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the blue headlight wire. Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up one side of the clamping teeth and pull the connector off. Locate the green turn signal wire clamp. Use a flathead screwdriver to push in the tab on the side and pull off the connector. Now that all connections between the car and the headlight assembly are disconnected, it is safe to remove the headlight assembly from the truck.

Lines.Text: turn the turn signal bulb holder counterclockwise until it stops .
remove the bulb holder .
inspect the bulb . check for broken filaments or cracked glass .
be sure to replace the turn signal bulb with the correct type for your dodge . using an incorrect bulb will result in shortened bulb or fuse lifespan .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the turn signal bulb holder counterclockwise until it stops. Remove the bulb holder. Inspect the bulb. Check for broken filaments or cracked glass. Be sure to replace the turn signal bulb with the correct type for your Dodge. Using an incorrect bulb will result in shortened bulb or fuse lifespan.

Lines.Text: locate the twelve 10 mm long 14 mm hex head bolts holding on the backplate of the differential .
position an oil pan under the differential .
loosen the bottom 4 bolts first with the 14 mm socket wrench . slowly loosen the rest of the bolts in a random order until oil flows out and enters the drain pan .
due to limited resources the oil was not actually replaced in this guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the twelve 10mm long 14mm hex head bolts holding on the backplate of the differential. Position an oil pan under the differential. Loosen the bottom 4 bolts first with the 14mm socket wrench. Slowly loosen the rest of the bolts in a random order until oil flows out and enters the drain pan. Due to limited resources the oil was not actually replaced in this guide.

Lines.Text: when tightening the bolts on the diff plate it is vital that you tighten them in a star pattern to avoid warping the plate . do not exceed a torque of 40 ft-lbs per bolt .
repeat the last step in reverse to re-tighten the bolts on the differential cover while following the star method of tightening bolts . use a torque wrench to ensure proper torque specifications .
now the differential is fully sealed and ready for new oil .

Steps.Text_raw: When tightening the bolts on the diff plate it is vital that you tighten them in a star pattern to avoid warping the plate. Do not exceed a torque of 40 ft-lbs per bolt. Repeat the last step in reverse to re-tighten the bolts on the differential cover while following the star method of tightening bolts. Use a torque wrench to ensure proper torque specifications. Now the differential is fully sealed and ready for new oil.

Lines.Text: locate the differential filler plug .
use a 2 flathead screwdriver to lift the outer lip of the plug . pinch the outer lip of the rubber filler plug between your fingers and pull off .
use a vacuum pump to pump in new differential fluid until the oil level reaches the bottom of the plug hole .
re-insert the rubber filler plug .
due to limited resources the differential oil was not changed in this guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the differential filler plug. Use a #2 flathead screwdriver to lift the outer lip of the plug.  Pinch the outer lip of the rubber filler plug between your fingers and pull off. Use a vacuum pump to pump in new differential fluid until the oil level reaches the bottom of the plug hole. Re-insert the rubber filler plug. Due to limited resources the differential oil was not changed in this guide.

Title: 2002-2008 Dodge Ram 1500 Transfer Case Oil Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the transfer case in the center of the undercarriage of your dodge . position yourself under the drivers side seat and look upwards toward the front left tire .
locate the fill plug on the transfer case . and remove it using the 10 mm hex driver . the fill plug is the upper steel plug just to the left of the rear output of the transfer case .
no oil will drain after the filler plug is removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the transfer case in the center of the undercarriage of your Dodge. Position yourself under the drivers side seat and look upwards toward the front left tire. Locate the fill plug on the transfer case. and remove it using the 10 mm hex driver. The fill plug is the upper steel  plug just to the left of the rear output of the transfer case. No oil will drain after the filler plug is removed.

Lines.Text: set the drain pan underneath the transfer case . make sure that the drain pan has enough room for about 2 quarts of oil .
locate the drain plug just left and under the filler plug .
as soon as the filler plug is removed the transfer case oil will begin to drain . take caution when removing the drain plug .
due to limited resources , the transfer case oil was not actually changed for this guide .
while applying pressure towards the front of the car unscrew the drain plug with the 10 mm hex . once you feel that the plug is fully unthreaded quickly pull the plug away allowing the oil to drain .
the oil will take upwards of 5 minutes to completely drain .

Steps.Text_raw: Set the drain pan underneath the transfer case. Make sure that the drain pan has enough room for about 2 quarts of oil. Locate the drain plug just left and under the filler plug. As soon as the filler plug is removed the Transfer case oil will begin to drain. Take caution when removing the drain plug. Due to limited resources, the transfer case oil was not actually changed for this guide. While applying pressure towards the front of the car unscrew the drain plug with the 10mm Hex.  Once you feel that the Plug is fully unthreaded quickly pull the plug away allowing the oil to drain. The oil will take upwards of 5 minutes to completely drain.

Lines.Text: tighten the drain plug using the 10 mm hex .
fill the transfer case with the atf oil using the vacuum oil pump . when the case is full , oil will begin dripping out of the fill hole .
insert and tighten the filler plug using the 10 mm hex .
be careful to line up each plug carefully to prevent cross-threading . do not overtighten the plugs , as overtightening may cause the threads to strip .
due to limited resources the transfer case oil was not actually changed .

Steps.Text_raw: Tighten the drain plug using the 10mm hex. Fill the transfer case with the ATF oil using the vacuum oil pump. When the case is full, oil will begin dripping out of the fill hole. Insert and tighten the filler plug using the 10 mm hex. Be careful to line up each plug carefully to prevent cross-threading. Do not overtighten the plugs, as overtightening may cause the threads to strip. Due to limited resources the transfer case oil was not actually changed.

Subject: Transfer Case Oil

Title: Changing a Tire on the 2007-2012 Jeep Wrangler

Lines.Text: (picture 2 , view from rear bumper ) open the trunk and remove the trunk's carpeting by simply reaching underneath and pulling up . the tools needed for changing a spare tire are located underneath the carpeting . take out the following tools :
the jack , which is used to lift the car ( top of picture 3 )
the jack handle driver and its extension rod , which are used to turn the clasp ( middle of picture 3 )
a lug wrench , which is used to release lug nuts on the hubcap ( bottom of picture 3 )
the tire in this picture was not flat for the purposes of making this guide .

Steps.Text_raw: (Picture 2, view from rear bumper) Open the trunk and remove the trunk's carpeting by simply reaching underneath and pulling up.  The tools needed for changing a spare tire are located underneath the carpeting.  Take out the following tools: The jack, which is used to lift the car (top of picture 3) The jack handle driver and its extension rod, which are used to turn the clasp (middle of picture 3) A lug wrench, which is used to release lug nuts on the hubcap (bottom of picture 3) The tire in this picture was not flat for the purposes of making this guide.

Lines.Text: the jack will be holding up the car so that the car does not fall on you . make sure that the vehicle is secure on the jack . check that your vehicle is in park and has the emergency brake/parking brake on .
place the jack in the proper location on the axle between either the front or rear tires , depending on which tire is flat .
refer to your jeep manual to determine the proper location for the jack under your vehicle .
in this case , the rear driver's side tire was the flat tire so the jack will be placed on the axle between the rear tires on the driver's side of the jeep .

Steps.Text_raw: The jack will be holding up the car so that the car does not fall on you. Make sure that the vehicle is secure on the jack.  Check that your vehicle is in park and has the emergency brake/parking brake on. Place the jack in the proper location on the axle between either the front or rear tires, depending on which tire is flat. Refer to your Jeep manual to determine the proper location for the jack under your vehicle. In this case, the rear driver's side tire was the "flat tire" so the jack will be placed on the axle between the rear tires on the driver's side of the Jeep.

Lines.Text: on the end of the jack is a rotatable clasp . spin that clasp counter-clockwise using the jack handle driver and extension rod . the jack will begin to rise .
continue spinning the clasp counter-clockwise until the vehicle is lifted enough so that your wheel is no longer on the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: On the end of the jack is a rotatable clasp.  Spin that clasp counter-clockwise using the jack handle driver and extension rod.  The jack will begin to rise. Continue spinning the clasp counter-clockwise until the vehicle is lifted enough so that your wheel is no longer on the ground.

Lines.Text: use the lug wrench in a star pattern to properly loosen the lug nuts . refer to picture 1 regarding the loosening pattern .
to physically loosen the lug nuts , use the lug wrench and push down very hard in a counter-clockwise direction .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the lug wrench in a star pattern to properly loosen the lug nuts.  Refer to picture 1 regarding the loosening pattern. To physically loosen the lug nuts, use the lug wrench and push down very hard in a counter-clockwise direction.

Lines.Text: take all 5 lug nuts off and remove the wheel by pulling it straight away from the vehicle .
pull straight out and off in order to not damage any of the wheel studs that the wheel is resting on .

Steps.Text_raw: Take all 5 lug nuts off and remove the wheel by pulling it straight away from the vehicle. Pull straight out and off in order to not damage any of the wheel studs that the wheel is resting on.

Lines.Text: locate the spare tire on the back of the jeep .
push hard in a counter-clockwise motion to remove the three lug nuts using the lug wrench .
pull spare wheel straight off of the back of the jeep ( picture 2 has wheel off ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the spare tire on the back of the Jeep. Push hard in a counter-clockwise motion to remove the three lug nuts using the lug wrench. Pull spare wheel straight off of the back of the Jeep (picture 2 has wheel off).

Subject: Changing a Tire on the 2007-2012 Jeep Wrangler

Lines.Text: locate the two grey latches on each side of the hood near the headlights .
pull the latches away from the hood to release the latches .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two grey latches on each side of the hood near the headlights. Pull the latches away from the hood to release the latches.

Lines.Text: reach underneath the hood and push up on the lever located in the front center of the hood . you can now open the hood .
prop the hood open by inserting the hood support rod into the designated hole on the underside of the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Reach underneath the hood and push up on the lever located in the front center of the hood.  You can now open the hood. Prop the hood open by inserting the hood support rod into the designated hole on the underside of the hood.

Lines.Text: before touching any parts , make sure your jeep wrangler is off for at least thirty minutes to prevent any burns .
locate the oil cap on the top side of the engine ( indicated in red in the image ) . to remove the cap , twist hard in a counter-clockwise motion .
store the cap in a safe place to prevent losing it .

Steps.Text_raw: Before touching any parts, make sure your Jeep Wrangler is off for at least thirty minutes to prevent any burns. Locate the oil cap on the top side of the engine (indicated in red in the image). To remove the cap, twist hard in a counter-clockwise motion. Store the cap in a safe place to prevent losing it.

Lines.Text: place the oil drain pan underneath the vehicle .
locate the oil drain plug . it is located at the bottom of the vehicle ( indicated by the red square in the image ) .
the pan will need to be directly underneath the oil drain plug in order to catch all of the old oil .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the oil drain pan underneath the vehicle. Locate the oil drain plug. It is located at the bottom of the vehicle (indicated by the red square in the image). The pan will need to be directly underneath the oil drain plug in order to catch all of the old oil.

Lines.Text: using an appropriately sized socket and socket wrench , remove the oil drain plug . ( in a pinch , you can use an adjustable wrench . ) twist counter-clockwise to loosen it .
let the oil completely drain from the car and into the drain pan .
replace ( reinsert ) the plug by twisting it clockwise . tighten it with the wrench following the same clockwise motion .
after the plug is replaced , wipe it down with a dirty rag to clean off any outside oil . this ensures that oil will not drip onto the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Using an appropriately sized socket and socket wrench, remove the oil drain plug. (In a pinch, you can use an adjustable wrench.) Twist counter-clockwise to loosen it. Let the oil completely drain from the car and into the drain pan. Replace (reinsert) the plug by twisting it clockwise. Tighten it with the wrench following the same clockwise motion. After the plug is replaced, wipe it down with a dirty rag to clean off any outside oil. This ensures that oil will not drip onto the ground.

Lines.Text: move the drain pan toward the front of the vehicle . be careful not to spill any oil !
place it directly underneath the oil filter ( indicated by the red square in the image ) . this image is looking down from the front of the engine , underneath the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the drain pan toward the front of the vehicle. Be careful not to spill any oil! Place it directly underneath the oil filter (indicated by the red square in the image). This image is looking down from the front of the engine, underneath the hood.

Lines.Text: oil will begin flowing as soon as you unscrew the filter . be sure to catch all of the oil in the drain pan .
loosen the oil filter by twisting counter-clockwise . it may be easier to access the oil filter from the top-side of the engine .
if it is too difficult to twist by hand , use an oil filter wrench to loosen it .
place the removed oil filter in the oil pan .

Steps.Text_raw: Oil will begin flowing as soon as you unscrew the filter.  Be sure to catch all of the oil in the drain pan. Loosen the oil filter by twisting counter-clockwise. It may be easier to access the oil filter from the top-side of the engine. If it is too difficult to twist by hand, use an oil filter wrench to loosen it. Place the removed oil filter in the oil pan.

Lines.Text: check the socket for loose bits of the old rubber gasket . remove these and wipe the area clean .
take the new oil filter and insert it into the socket . twist it clockwise to fasten it into place .
use the oil filter wrench to ensure that it is a tight fit .

Steps.Text_raw: Check the socket for loose bits of the old rubber gasket. Remove these and wipe the area clean. Take the new oil filter and insert it into the socket. Twist it clockwise to fasten it into place. Use the oil filter wrench to ensure that it is a tight fit.

Lines.Text: on the top of the engine , find the hole for the oil cap you removed earlier .
using a funnel , pour 5.5 quarts of 5 w-20 motor oil into the hole .
be sure to let all of the oil drain from each oil container .

Steps.Text_raw: On the top of the engine, find the hole for the oil cap you removed earlier. Using a funnel, pour 5.5 quarts of 5W-20 Motor Oil into the hole. Be sure to let all of the oil drain from each oil container.

Lines.Text: put the oil cap back on by twisting it clockwise . check that it is tightly screwed on .
start your engine and let in run for about a minute .
letting your engine run will get the oil flowing inside the engine .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the oil cap back on by twisting it clockwise.  Check that it is tightly screwed on. Start your engine and let in run for about a minute. Letting your engine run will get the oil flowing inside the engine.

Lines.Text: check the oil level . first , locate the oil dip-stick ( marked in the first image by red ) .
pull out the oil dip-stick and wipe clean it clean with a paper towel or rag .
re-insert the oil dip-stick completely and pull it slowly out .
the oil should reach to the safe-fill area on the stick ( marked in the image in yellow ) . if it doesn't , add more fresh oil through the funnel until it reaches this mark .

Steps.Text_raw: Check the oil level.  First, locate the oil dip-stick (marked in the first image by red). Pull out the oil dip-stick and wipe clean it clean with a paper towel or rag. Re-insert the oil dip-stick completely and pull it slowly out. The oil should reach to the safe-fill area on the stick (marked in the image in yellow). If it doesn't, add more fresh oil through the funnel until it reaches this mark.

Lines.Text: do not dump your oil down any drain . this is extremely bad for the environment ! act responsibly .
make sure to dispose of your old oil filter and dirty , old oil correctly .
many vehicle repair shops will recycle it free of charge .

Steps.Text_raw: Do not dump your oil down any drain. This is extremely bad for the environment! Act responsibly. Make sure to dispose of your old oil filter and dirty, old oil correctly. Many vehicle repair shops will recycle it free of charge.

Title: Audi Navigation Plus CD-ROM Drive Lens Cleaning

Lines.Text: use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover .
when closing the cover , make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover. When closing the cover, make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture.

Lines.Text: remove one gold colored phillips screw located in the center .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove one gold colored Phillips screw located in the center.

Lines.Text: it is advisable to grab an old cd and push it half way into the cd-rom drive until it is visible through the hole marked in the first picture . this will prevent the part that has to be removed in this step to fall down into the unit , with the risk of damaging the laser .
the metal plate slides forward as shown in the first picture .

use a pair of tweezers to very carefully slide forward and then lift up and remove the metal plate together with the white plastic disk , if they fall into the unit you are going to have to take it apart completely ( guide ) .

Steps.Text_raw: It is advisable to grab an old CD and push it half way into the CD-ROM drive until it is visible through the hole marked in the first picture. This will prevent the part that has to be removed in this step to fall down into the unit, with the risk of damaging the laser. The metal plate slides forward as shown in the first picture. Use a pair of tweezers to very carefully slide forward and then lift up and remove the metal plate together with the white plastic disk, if they fall into the unit you are going to have to take it apart completely ([guide|12405|using this guide]).

Lines.Text: locate the lens inside the cd-rom drive .

make sure that there is no dust on or near the player and area you are working on . dust can get on the lens and scratch it while you are cleaning . it is very important that the lens is not damaged because the lens is used to read the discs .
dip one end of a cotton swab in rubbing alcohol .
lightly dab the swab on the lens . be very gentle .
let the lens dry before putting the unit back together .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the lens inside the CD-ROM drive. Make sure that there is no dust on or near the player and area you are working on. Dust can get on the lens and scratch it while you are cleaning. It is very important that the lens is not damaged because the lens is used to read the discs. Dip one end of a cotton swab in rubbing alcohol. Lightly dab the swab on the lens. Be very gentle. Let the lens dry before putting the unit back together.

Lines.Text: remove the three 6 mm t9 torx screws securing the cover plate .
slightly loosen the rubber knob since it pushes down on the cover plate .
slide the cover plate about 1 or 2 mm upwards and remove it from the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 6 mm T9 Torx screws securing the cover plate. Slightly loosen the rubber knob since it pushes down on the cover plate. Slide the cover plate about 1 or 2 mm upwards and remove it from the unit.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to disconnect the cable connecting the gps with the radio unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to disconnect the cable connecting the GPS with the radio unit.

Lines.Text: remove two 6 mm t9 torx screws from the left side of the unit .
remove two 6 mm t9 torx screws from the right side of the unit .
the gps/cd-rom unit can now be separated from the radio .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the left side of the unit. Remove two 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the right side of the unit. The GPS/CD-ROM unit can now be separated from the radio.

Lines.Text: use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover .
when closing the cover , make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover. When closing the cover, make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture.

Lines.Text: remove five 6 mm t9 torx screws from the top side of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove five 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the top side of the unit.

Lines.Text: the cd-rom has to be pulled out straight up . some force might be needed since the unit is plugged into the logic board at the bottom of the housing with a connector board ( see the third photo ) . the board might come out with the cd-rom unit , or still be connected to the logic board .
at the left side , it might be possible to use fingers to pull out the unit .
at the right side , a flat head screwdriver can be used . the force that is needed will most likely bend a metal spudger .
once disconnected , flip over the cd-rom unit and place it next to the housing with the logic board .
the brown cable will still be connected , optionally remove the one t9 torx screw located next to the cooling fan ( see second photo ) to disconnect the connector from the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: The CD-ROM has to be pulled out straight up. Some force might be needed since the unit is plugged into the logic board at the bottom of the housing with a connector board (see the third photo). The board might come out with the CD-ROM unit, or still be connected to the logic board. At the left side, it might be possible to use fingers to pull out the unit. At the right side, a flat head screwdriver can be used. The force that is needed will most likely bend a metal spudger. Once disconnected, flip over the CD-ROM unit and place it next to the housing with the logic board. The brown cable will still be connected, optionally remove the one T9 Torx screw located next to the cooling fan (see second photo) to disconnect the connector from the housing.

Lines.Text: if the connector board is still connected to the cd-rom unit :
remove the connector board using two fingers on either side of the board and prying it up .
when assembling , place the connector board on the logic board inside the housing . push it down until the connector pins are visible at the surface of the connector board .
when assembling , make sure the two logic boards ( one in the housing and one on the cd-rom unit ) are pushed into the connector board all the way .

Steps.Text_raw: If the connector board is still connected to the CD-ROM unit: Remove the connector board using two fingers on either side of the board and prying it up. When assembling, place the connector board on the logic board inside the housing. Push it down until the connector pins are visible at the surface of the connector board. When assembling, make sure the two logic boards (one in the housing and one on the CD-ROM unit) are pushed into the connector board all the way.

Lines.Text: use the tip of a plastic spudger to disconnect the cable that connects the ( what is assumed to be an ) angle calibration unit , to the logic board of the cd-rom drive .
flip the unit over to remove four 6 mm t9 torx screws .
the cd-rom unit is now separated from the surrounding bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the tip of a plastic spudger to disconnect the cable that connects the (what is assumed to be an) angle calibration unit, to the logic board of the CD-ROM drive. Flip the unit over to remove four 6 mm T9 Torx screws. The CD-ROM unit is now separated from the surrounding bracket.

Lines.Text: use a plastic spudger to open the three plastic connectors and slide the ribbon cables out , no force should be used .
disconnect the three other connectors from the logic board , using a spudger if necessary .
remove the four 6 mm t9 torx screws from the corners of the logic board .
the board can now safely be removed from the cd-rom drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic spudger to open the three plastic connectors and slide the ribbon cables out, no force should be used. Disconnect the three other connectors from the logic board, using a spudger if necessary. Remove the four 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the corners of the logic board. The board can now safely be removed from the CD-ROM drive.

Lines.Text: flip the cd-rom unit back over .
remove one gold colored phillips screw located in the center .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the CD-ROM unit back over. Remove one gold colored Phillips screw located in the center.

Lines.Text: it is advisable to grab an old cd and push it half way into the cd-rom drive until it is visible through the hole marked in the first picture . this will prevent the part that has to be removed in this step to fall down into the unit , with the risk of damaging the laser .
the metal plate slides forward as shown in the first picture .
use a pair of tweezers to very carefully slide forward and then lift up and remove the metal plate together with the white plastic disk .
i did not take the unit apart beyond this level , taking it apart any further might offset the calibration of the laser and damage the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: It is advisable to grab an old CD and push it half way into the CD-ROM drive until it is visible through the hole marked in the first picture. This will prevent the part that has to be removed in this step to fall down into the unit, with the risk of damaging the laser. The metal plate slides forward as shown in the first picture. Use a pair of tweezers to very carefully slide forward and then lift up and remove the metal plate together with the white plastic disk. I did not take the unit apart beyond this level, taking it apart any further might offset the calibration of the laser and damage the unit.

Lines.Text: start by removing top cover .
use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover .
when closing the cover , make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture .

Steps.Text_raw: Start by removing top cover. Use the flat edge of a metal spudger and/or a flat head screwdriver to pry open the top cover. When closing the cover, make sure the cover is completely locked as shown in the third picture.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to open the clip locking the flatcable , you can leave the cable in because it's difficult to remove it from the connector at this point .
use a spudger to disconnect the screen powercable .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to open the clip locking the flatcable, you can leave the cable in because it's difficult to remove it from the connector at this point. Use a spudger to disconnect the screen powercable.

Lines.Text: remove two 6 mm t9 torx screws from the left side of the unit .
remove two 6 mm t9 torx screws from the right side of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the left side of the unit. Remove two 6 mm T9 Torx screws from the right side of the unit.

Lines.Text: gently separate the front part from the radio unit just far enough until you are able to pull out the flatcable by it's pulling-flap .
slowly fold down the front keeping in mind the two black sleeved cables still connected .

the two black cables are at the left and right bottom side and are long enough to allow the front to fold down without disconnecting them . but do make sure the folded cable is pulled out from behind the metal plate while folding the front away from the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently separate the front part from the radio unit just far enough until you are able to pull out the flatcable by it's pulling-flap. Slowly fold down the front keeping in mind the two black sleeved cables still connected. The two black cables are at the left and right bottom side and are long enough to allow the front to fold down without disconnecting them. But do make sure the folded cable is pulled out from behind the metal plate while folding the front away from the unit.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the two black wires out of their connector . it's almost impossible to use a spudger so pull them out by pulling at the sleeved cable . do this '''very''' carefully .
when assembling , make sure these two cables are plugged in all the way into the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the two black wires out of their connector. It's almost impossible to use a spudger so pull them out by pulling at the sleeved cable. Do this '''very''' carefully. When assembling, make sure these two cables are plugged in all the way into the connector.

Lines.Text: remove two 4 mm t10 torx screws .
the screen can fall out after you have removed these two screws so be careful .
guide the flatcable through the metal plate when removing the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 4 mm T10 Torx screws. The screen can fall out after you have removed these two screws so be careful. Guide the flatcable through the metal plate when removing the screen.

Lines.Text: remove four 6 mm t9 torx screws .
carefully remove the metal plate , guiding the two wires through the holes .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four 6 mm T9 Torx screws. Carefully remove the metal plate, guiding the two wires through the holes.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to disconnect the connector from the board .
flip over the front panel and pull off the rubber knob of the rotary push button .
remove the 11 mm nut with a pair of pliers or a socket wrench if you have one that is long enough .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to disconnect the connector from the board. Flip over the front panel and pull off the rubber knob of the rotary push button. Remove the 11 mm nut with a pair of pliers or a socket wrench if you have one that is long enough.

Lines.Text: you can now remove the rotary push button unit from the back .
repeat these same procedure for the rotary push button on the right side .

Steps.Text_raw: You can now remove the rotary push button unit from the back. Repeat these same procedure for the rotary push button on the right side.

Lines.Text: remove eight 6 mm t6 torx screws from the left side logic board .
remove eight 6 mm t6 torx screws from the right side logic board .
remove the logic boards from the front panel of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove eight 6 mm T6 Torx screws from the left side logic board. Remove eight 6 mm T6 Torx screws from the right side logic board. Remove the logic boards from the front panel of the unit.

Title: 1997-2003 Pontiac Grand Prix GT Fuel Filter Replacement

Lines.Text: '''unless you are smaller like myself , you will need to lift the grand prix further off the ground with jack stands or ramps . '''
on the driver's side , under the rear .
''approximately where the cardboard box is located . ''
in the second image is a what you will see when first coming under the grand prix .
third image is a little further back , showing the fuel filter and brace .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Unless you are smaller like myself, you will need to lift the Grand Prix further off the ground with jack stands or ramps.''' On the driver's side, under the rear. ''Approximately where the cardboard box is located.'' In the second image is a what you will see when first coming under the Grand Prix. Third image is a little further back, showing the fuel filter and brace.

Lines.Text: de-pressurizing the fuel line will keep from gas shooting out of the fuel line and covering your face with gas .
lift your hood and locate the housing for your fuses and relays . next , remove the cover from the housing .
turn on your grand prix and walk over to the housing . find the fuel pump relay . for my grand prix , it was the black box shaped one in the center of the second photo .
'''''the inside of the fuse housing is a diagram that labels the fuses and relays . be sure to make sure you are pulling the correct relay . '''''
now , pull out the fuel pump relay . it doesn't like to come out without a fight . just be sure not to break any of the prongs on the relay . put the relay somewhere that you will not lose it .
'''your engine will stall and stop running . this is what we want . '''
'''turn off your car and remove the key before continuing ! '''

Steps.Text_raw: De-pressurizing the fuel line will keep from gas shooting out of the fuel line and covering your face with gas. Lift your hood and locate the housing for your fuses and relays. Next, remove the cover from the housing. Turn on your Grand Prix and walk over to the housing. Find the fuel pump relay. For my Grand Prix, it was the black box shaped one in the center of the second photo. '''''The inside of the fuse housing is a diagram that labels the fuses and relays. Be sure to make sure you are pulling the correct relay.''''' Now, pull out the fuel pump relay. it doesn't like to come out without a fight. Just be sure not to break any of the prongs on the relay. Put the relay somewhere that you will not lose it. '''Your engine will stall and stop running. This is what we want.''' '''TURN OFF YOUR CAR AND REMOVE THE KEY BEFORE CONTINUING!'''

Lines.Text: remove the bolt holding the fuel filter brace in place . put this bolt somewhere you will not lose .
on the left side of the fuel filter ( the end facing towards the engine ) , there is a nut you must unscrew .
''if your fuel filter hasn't been changed for a long while , it may not come off too easily . if so , use a second wrench to hold the fuel filter in place . ''
'''dirt may fall loose from the bottom of the grand prix and get into your eyes . wear something to protect your eyes if necessary ! '''
when the line gets unscrewed , some gas will come out of both the line and the filter . use something to catch the gas and keep it from getting all over the ground and yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bolt holding the fuel filter brace in place. Put this bolt somewhere you will not lose. On the left side of the fuel filter (The end facing towards the engine), there is a nut you must unscrew. ''If your fuel filter hasn't been changed for a long while, it may not come off too easily. If so, use a second wrench to hold the fuel filter in place.'' '''Dirt may fall loose from the bottom of the Grand Prix and get into your eyes. Wear something to protect your eyes if necessary!''' When the line gets unscrewed, some gas will come out of both the line and the filter. Use something to catch the gas and keep it from getting all over the ground and yourself.

Lines.Text: removing this end is the easiest part . simply push in the two tabs on the plastic piece and pull the filter off .
''more gas will come out once this is out . be sure to have your drip pan ready . ''
'''there''' , the old fuel filter is no longer attached to your car .
'''be sure to remove the brace from the old filter . it must be attached to the new one . '''

Steps.Text_raw: Removing this end is the easiest part. Simply push in the two tabs on the plastic piece and pull the filter off. ''More gas will come out once this is out. Be sure to have your drip pan ready.'' '''There''', the old fuel filter is no longer attached to your car. '''Be sure to remove the brace from the old filter. it must be attached to the new one.'''

Lines.Text: ''put the brace on the new filter before going any further . ''
''before putting on the new fuel filter , use a rag and clean the gas off of the two fuel lines . ''
''remember to put the brace on the new fuel filter . look at the photo to know which direction it should go on . ''
screw the fuel filter onto the fuel line nearer to the engine . be sure to make it tight so that no gas will leak .
now attach the end with the clip on it . simply push the fuel line onto the filter end . you will hear a small click when it is all the way on .
'''now you must attach the brace onto the frame . '''
screw the bolt back in , and the brace is back on .

Steps.Text_raw: ''Put the brace on the new filter before going any further.'' ''Before putting on the new fuel filter, use a rag and clean the gas off of the two fuel lines.'' ''Remember to put the brace on the new fuel filter. Look at the photo to know which direction it should go on.'' Screw the fuel filter onto the fuel line nearer to the engine. Be sure to make it tight so that no gas will leak. Now attach the end with the clip on it. Simply push the fuel line onto the filter end. You will hear a small click when it is all the way on. '''Now you must attach the brace onto the frame.''' Screw the bolt back in, and the brace is back on.

Lines.Text: pick up your tools from the ground and make your way to the housing for the fuses and relays .
reinsert the relay for the fuel pump .
close up the housing and shut the hood .
'''do not turn on the car'''
get into the driver's seat and turn the '''key''' on . '''do not turn the engine on'''
now , keep just the key on and keep it on . this will re-pressurize your fuel line .
get out of the car , with the key still on , and head back to the fuel filter . feel around both ends of the fuel filter to make sure there are no leaks .

Steps.Text_raw: Pick up your tools from the ground and make your way to the housing for the fuses and relays. Reinsert the relay for the fuel pump. Close up the housing and shut the hood. '''DO NOT TURN ON THE CAR''' Get into the driver's seat and turn the '''KEY''' on. '''DO NOT TURN THE ENGINE ON''' Now, keep just the key on and keep it on. This will re-pressurize your fuel line. Get out of the car, with the key still on, and head back to the fuel filter. Feel around both ends of the fuel filter to make sure there are no leaks.

Lines.Text: if no leaks are present , then turn the engine on . it may stutter for a second as fuel re-enters the engine .
let the engine idle for a few seconds to ensure everything fills back up and pressurizes correctly .
now , get out with the engine on , and check the fuel filter once more . make sure again there are no leaks present .
if still no leaks , then it's time for the fun part . test drive that thing !
if your fuel filter has not been changed in a while , you will notice a bit of an increase in performance !
as soon as your test drive is over , check the fuel filter one last time for any leaks . if no leaks are there , then congratulations , you successfully changed your fuel filter !

Steps.Text_raw: If no leaks are present, then turn the engine on. It may stutter for a second as fuel re-enters the engine. Let the engine idle for a few seconds to ensure everything fills back up and pressurizes correctly. Now, get out with the engine on, and check the fuel filter once more. Make sure again there are no leaks present. If still no leaks, then it's time for the fun part. Test drive that thing! If your fuel filter has not been changed in a while, you will notice a bit of an increase in performance! As soon as your test drive is over, check the fuel filter one last time for any leaks. If no leaks are there, then congratulations, you successfully changed your fuel filter!

Subject: Fuel Filter

Title: 2000 Jeep Grand Cherokee spark plug replacement

Lines.Text: the 4.0 l 6cylinder engine uses a one-piece coil rail containing three independent coils . located on the right hand side ( passenger side ) of the engine .
the one-piece coil bolts directly to the cylinder head with 4 13 mm hex bolt ( m8 x50 ) . 3 of the bolts are immediately visible .
the fourth one is somewhat hidden in the back , under the coolant lines for the heater . the hoses can easily be moved out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: The 4.0L 6–cylinder engine uses a one-piece coil rail containing three independent coils. Located on the right hand side (passenger side) of the engine. The one-piece coil bolts directly to the cylinder head with 4 13mm hex bolt (M8X50). 3 of the bolts are immediately visible. The fourth one is somewhat hidden in the back, under the coolant lines for the heater. The hoses can easily be moved out of the way.

Lines.Text: start removing the 13 mm bolts from the coil rail . use an extension will make it easier to clear the radiator hoses and throttle cables .
use a smaller extension to remove the 4th bolt in the back of the rail .
all 4 bolts are identical in size and need not to be separated .

Steps.Text_raw: Start removing the 13mm bolts from the coil rail. Use an extension will make it easier to clear the radiator hoses and throttle cables. Use a smaller extension to remove the 4th bolt in the back of the rail. All 4 bolts are identical in size and need not to be separated.

Lines.Text: with all 4 bolts removed , the rail should easily pull off the spark plugs . one electrical connector ( located at the rear end of the coil rail ) is used for all three coils . it is not necessary to totally remove the rail for a spark plug change .
rubber boots seal the secondary terminal ends of the coils to the top of all 6 spark plugs .
use a 5 /8 inch spark plug socket and extension to remove the spark plug . again , the ignition rail can be easily moved out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: With all 4 bolts removed, the rail should easily pull off the spark plugs.  One electrical connector (located at the rear end of the coil rail) is used for all three coils. It is not necessary to totally remove the rail for a spark plug change. Rubber boots seal the secondary terminal ends of the coils to the top of all 6 spark plugs. Use a 5/8inch spark plug socket and extension to remove the spark plug. Again, the ignition rail can be easily moved out of the way.

Lines.Text: continue to remove all spark plugs .
to remove the last spark plug in the rear , use a longer extension . always ensure that the socket is properly seated on the spark plug .
with all spark plugs removed , it is clearly visible that these plugs were in definite need to be replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to remove all spark plugs. To remove the last spark plug in the rear, use a longer extension. Always ensure that the socket is properly seated on the spark plug. With all spark plugs removed, it is clearly visible that these plugs were in definite need to be replaced.

Subject: Spark Plugs

Lines.Text: place wheel ramps in front of the front tires .
carefully drive car onto wheel ramps .
set parking brake and place a wedge between a rear tire to prevent rollback .

Steps.Text_raw: Place wheel ramps in front of the front tires. Carefully drive car onto wheel ramps. Set parking brake and place a wedge between a rear tire to prevent rollback.

Lines.Text: gather oil drip pan , oil filter wrench , socket wrench and socket .
locate oil drain plug ( as shown in picture ) and place oil drip pan under plug .
using the socket wrench and socket , remove the oil drain plug by turning it counterclockwise .
allow oil to drain into oil drip pan for 10-15 minutes .
screw oil drain plug back in until hand tight . using socket wrench and socket , turn oil drain plug one more full rotation .

Steps.Text_raw: Gather oil drip pan, oil filter wrench, socket wrench and socket. Locate oil drain plug (as shown in picture) and place oil drip pan under plug. Using the socket wrench and socket, remove the oil drain plug by turning it counterclockwise. Allow oil to drain into oil drip pan for 10-15 minutes. Screw oil drain plug back in until hand tight. Using socket wrench and socket, turn oil drain plug one more full rotation.

Lines.Text: locate the oil filter ( as shown in picture ) and place oil drip pan underneath .
using oil filter wrench , loosen oil filter . remove rest of the way by hand . be careful as filter is full of oil .
allow oil to drip into pan for 5-10 minutes .
lightly coat rubber seal on new filter with fresh oil .
screw on new filter until hand tight .
dispose of used oil at local auto store or repair shop .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the oil filter (as shown in picture) and place oil drip pan underneath. Using oil filter wrench, loosen oil filter. Remove rest of the way by hand. Be careful as filter is full of oil. Allow oil to drip into pan for 5-10 minutes. Lightly  coat rubber seal on new filter with fresh oil. Screw on new filter until hand tight. Dispose of used oil at local auto store or repair shop.

Lines.Text: pop open hood .
locate the oil fill cap ( as shown in picture ) and remove .
place funnel into hole and carefully pour four fresh quarts of oil into funnel .
replace oil fill cap and close hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Pop open hood. Locate the oil fill cap (as shown in picture) and remove. Place funnel into hole and carefully pour four fresh quarts of oil into funnel. Replace oil fill cap and close hood.

Lines.Text: remove wedge from rear tires .
disengage parking brake and slowly back off of ramps .
allow car to run for about 5 minutes .
check for any leaks around oil filter and oil drain plug .
if any leaks , tighten oil filter or oil drain plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove wedge from rear tires. Disengage parking brake and slowly back off of ramps. Allow car to run for about 5 minutes. Check for any leaks around oil filter and oil drain plug. If any leaks, tighten oil filter or oil drain plug.

Title: Installing a Tow Hitch on a 2013 RAV4

Steps.Text_raw: The Curt 56166 T-connector wiring kit comes everything I needed for this installation.

Lines.Text: remove the cargo area cover emptying all the junk and spare tire . the rear scuff panel and cargo tray on the drivers side are removed by popping the plastic rivets and metal bolts .
