Steps.Text_raw: Locate the oil drain plug underneath the car. It is on the passenger side and facing towards the rear of the vehicle. Place the oil drain pan slightly off the side of the plug. The oil that drains out will come in a stream, not straight down. If not already done so, now is the time to put on the protective eyewear and gloves.

Lines.Text: use the 14 mm socket wrench to loosen the oil drain plug . after a few turns , use your hands to loosen the plug until it is off .
oil contents may be hot if the car has been running recently !
allow the oil to completely drain into the pan .

look for small , shiny specks in the oil . the specks could be metal flakes from the engine and may be a sign of a serious problem with the engine . take your car in for maintenance if you see these shiny specks .
use a rag to wipe around the opening for any remnants of the oil .
after the oil has drained , screw the oil drain plug back onto the car . hand tighten as much and use a 14 mm socket wrench to tighten about a half turn more .
do not overtighten ! this could lead to cracking the oil pan .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the 14 mm socket wrench to loosen the oil drain plug. After a few turns, use your hands to loosen the plug until it is off. Oil contents may be hot if the car has been running recently! Allow the oil to completely drain into the pan. Look for small, shiny specks in the oil. The specks could be metal flakes from the engine and may be a sign of a serious problem with the engine. Take your car in for maintenance if you see these shiny specks. Use a rag to wipe around the opening for any remnants of the oil. After the oil has drained, screw the oil drain plug back onto the car. Hand tighten as much and use a 14 mm socket wrench to tighten about a half turn more. Do not overtighten! This could lead to cracking the oil pan.

Lines.Text: locate the oil filter from either above or below the car ( the images are from above ) .
the oil filter is located below the engine and aligned horizontally , facing the front of the car .
place the oil drain pan under the filter .
unscrew the filter by hand . turn the filter counterclockwise if looking at the filter from the front .
if the filter is too hard to loosen , use either some pliers or an oil filter wrench .
wipe around the area where the filter was settled .
make sure the washer part of the filter comes off . if left on with the new filter , the seal may be broken and can lead to a leak .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the oil filter from either above or below the car (The images are from above). The oil filter is located below the engine and aligned horizontally, facing the front of the car. Place the oil drain pan under the filter. Unscrew the filter by hand. Turn the filter counterclockwise if looking at the filter from the front. If the filter is too hard to loosen, use either some pliers or an oil filter wrench. Wipe around the area where the filter was settled. Make sure the washer part of the filter comes off. If left on with the new filter, the seal may be broken and can lead to a leak.

Lines.Text: dip your gloved finger in the new oil and coat the washer part of the filter . this helps make the seal to ensure there are no leaks .
tighten the oil filter clockwise . hand tighten as much as possible . do not tighten with some pliers or oil filter wrench .
it may be helpful to take the glove off as the glove may be oily and hard to grip the new filter .

Steps.Text_raw: Dip your gloved finger in the new oil and coat the washer part of the filter. This helps make the seal to ensure there are no leaks. Tighten the oil filter clockwise. Hand tighten as much as possible. Do not tighten with some pliers or oil filter wrench. It may be helpful to take the glove off as the glove may be oily and hard to grip the new filter.

Lines.Text: put the funnel in the oil filler hole .
pour all 4 quarts of the oil into the funnel .
screw the oil cap back on by rotating it clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the funnel in the oil filler hole. Pour all 4 quarts of the oil into the funnel. Screw the oil cap back on by rotating it clockwise.

Lines.Text: place the jack back underneath the car and raise the car off of the jack stand .
remove the jack stand .
slowly lower the car back down to the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack back underneath the car and   raise the car off of the jack stand. Remove the jack stand. Slowly lower the car back down to the ground.

Lines.Text: take the dip stick out and wipe it down .
place the dip stick back into it's original place .
turn on the car and let it idle for 30 seconds , then turn the car off .
take the dip stick back out and check for the oil level . the level should be between the two bumps on the dipstick .
if low , add more oil until within the two bumps .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the dip stick out and wipe it down. Place the dip stick back into it's original place. Turn on the car and let it idle for 30 seconds, then turn the car off. Take the dip stick back out and check for the oil level. The level should be between the two bumps on the dipstick. If low, add more oil until within the two bumps.

Lines.Text: turn the car on and look under the car for any leaks . if there are any leaks , turn the car off and tighten the area where it is leaking . for example , if the oil is leaking around the oil filter , tighten the oil filter .
if there are no problems , turn the car off . then put the hood support rod down and close the hood .
clean up the surrounding area and throw away all trash .
do not throw away the oil or filter .
take the used oil and filter to a local auto-parts store or dealership . they will take it and recycle it for you .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the car on and look under the car for any leaks. If there are any leaks, turn the car off and tighten the area where it is leaking. For example, if the oil is leaking around the oil filter, tighten the oil filter. If there are no problems, turn the car off. Then put the hood support rod down and close the hood. Clean up the surrounding area and throw away all trash. Do not throw away the oil or filter. Take the used oil and filter to a local auto-parts store or dealership. They will take it and recycle it for you.

Subject: Engine Oil, Oil Filter

Title: 1999-2004 Jeep Grand Cherokee Headlight Bulb Replacement

Lines.Text: here is a 2000 jeep grand cherokee with a burned out driver side headlight bulb .
open the hood . on top of the affected headlight assembly is a single 7 mm hex bolt .
remove the bolt

Steps.Text_raw: Here is a 2000 Jeep Grand Cherokee with a burned out driver side headlight bulb. Open the hood. On top of the affected headlight assembly is a single 7mm hex bolt. Remove the bolt

Lines.Text: remove the bolt . it is approximately 6 inches long .
grab the headlight assembly on the fender side ,
as well as the grill side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bolt. It is approximately 6 inches long. Grab the headlight assembly on the fender side, as well as the grill side.

Lines.Text: then pull the assembly straight out
the light bulbs will now be accessible .
remove the bulb by twisting it in a counter clockwise direction , then pulling it out of the headlight assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Then pull the assembly straight out The light bulbs will now be accessible. Remove the bulb by twisting it in a counter clockwise direction, then pulling it out of the headlight assembly.

Lines.Text: use a flathead screwdriver ( or similar tool ) to lift the socket clip of the tab on the bulb and remove the bulb .
change the bulb and the result will be fully functional headlights .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flathead screwdriver (or similar tool) to lift the socket clip of the tab on the bulb and remove the bulb. Change the bulb and the result will be fully functional headlights.

Subject: Headlight Bulb

Lines.Text: before shot of bench seat in a 2005 ford f-350 super duty . removal of the seat requires an 18 mm socket . preferably a deep wall socket and a t60 torx bit w/ratchet or impact wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Before shot of bench seat in a 2005 Ford F-350 Super Duty.  Removal of the seat requires an 18mm socket.  Preferably a deep wall socket and a T60 Torx Bit w/ratchet or impact wrench.

Lines.Text: adjust the seat as far back as you can . using an 18 mm deep wall socket , remove the bolts on the front that attachs the seat to the floor . on my bench seat there were only two bolts . if you have a 60 /40 seat or bucket seats there will be more .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjust the seat as far back as you can.  Using an 18mm deep wall socket, remove the bolts on the front that attachs the seat to the floor.  On my bench seat there were only two bolts.  If you have a 60/40 seat or bucket seats there will be more.

Lines.Text: adjust seat to it's most forward position . look for a stud with a plastic protection cap . remove the cap with a screwdriver . using an 18 mm wrench or socket ( if space allows ) remove the bolt from the stud . on my bench seat there were only two studs/bolts . other style seats will have more . lift seat off studs and position seat forward of studs .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjust seat to it's most forward position. Look for a stud with a plastic protection cap.  Remove the cap with a screwdriver. Using an 18mm wrench or socket (if space allows) remove the bolt from the stud.  On my bench seat there were only two studs/bolts.  Other style seats will have more. Lift seat off studs and position seat forward of studs.

Lines.Text: using the t60 torx bit , remove the bolts attaching the seat belt receivers to the floor and remove the seat belt receivers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the T60 Torx bit, remove the bolts attaching the seat belt receivers to the floor and remove the seat belt receivers.

Lines.Text: unplug the seat belt receiver from the vehicle seat belt buzzer plug . it will be just under the back side of the seat .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the seat belt receiver from the vehicle seat belt buzzer plug.  it will be just under the back side of the seat.

Lines.Text: you may now remove the old seat from the truck . if you have a bench seat like in this guide , you will need someone to help .

Steps.Text_raw: You may now remove the old seat from the truck.  if you have a bench seat like in this guide, you will need someone to help.

Lines.Text: next , if your truck was only using the outter body holes you will need to locate the two close to the transmission tunnel . you can press your finger in the center and locate the opening . take a razor knife and gently cut an x over the hole . gently remove each of the triangle shaped tabs exposing the additional hole . repeat on opposite side .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, if your truck was only using the outter body holes you will need to locate the two close to the transmission tunnel.  You can press your finger in the center and locate the opening.  Take a razor knife and gently cut an X over the hole.  Gently remove each of the triangle shaped tabs exposing the additional hole.  Repeat on opposite side.

Lines.Text: next place your jump seat in the middle on top of the transmission tunnel . the rear holes will line up with two of the existing holes where the seat belts were attached . place two bolts in the holes but don't tighten completely . lift the bottom seat up exposing the two bolt holes in the bottom of the jump seat .

Steps.Text_raw: Next place your jump seat in the middle on top of the transmission tunnel.  The rear holes will line up with two of the existing holes where the seat belts were attached. Place two bolts in the holes but don't tighten completely.  Lift the bottom seat up exposing the two bolt holes in the bottom of the jump seat.

Lines.Text: now mark and drill two holes in the transmission tunnel . carefully check what is below the tunnel to make sure you don't damage wiring or other system that may be run along the path . this is best done with one person drilling and one person watching underneath . these are the only holes you must drill for 2011 to 2014 seats to fit .

Steps.Text_raw: Now mark and drill two holes in the transmission tunnel.  Carefully check what is below the tunnel to make sure you don't damage wiring or other system that may be run along the path.  This is best done with one person drilling and one person watching underneath.  These are the only holes you must drill for 2011 to 2014 seats to fit.

Lines.Text: notice the jump seat is a little lower than the buckets . place your buckets in temporarily and use washers or other spacers between the floor and jump seat frame to adjust the jump seat to the same level as the buckets .

Steps.Text_raw: Notice the jump seat is a little lower than the buckets.  Place your buckets in temporarily and use washers or other spacers between the floor and jump seat frame to adjust the jump seat to the same level as the buckets.

Lines.Text: place your bucket seats in the truck . you should be able to line up all 4 holes in the seat frame with a hole in the truck body . you may use the same bolts you removed from the old seat to bolt the new seats down . replace the plastic bolt covers on the new bucket seats .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your bucket seats in the truck.  You should be able to line up all 4 holes in the seat frame with a hole in the truck body.  You may use the same bolts you removed from the old seat to bolt the new seats down.  Replace the plastic bolt covers on the new bucket seats.

Lines.Text: in my case the seat belt buzzer on the new seat didn't match the vehicle plug . simply remove the seat belt receiver from the side of the seat with a t60 torq bit and re-attach your old seat belt receiver to the floor bolt . using the old seat belt receiver gives you the proper connector and allows the buzzer to work properly .

Steps.Text_raw: In my case the seat belt buzzer on the new seat didn't match the vehicle plug.  Simply remove the seat belt receiver from the side of the seat with a T60 Torq bit and re-attach your old seat belt receiver to the floor bolt.  Using the old seat belt receiver gives you the proper connector and allows the buzzer to work properly.

Lines.Text: be sure to tighten all bolts properly . your safety depends on it . you now have modern much more comfortable seats in your truck . enjoy . before and after pics below .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure to tighten all bolts properly.  Your safety depends on it.  You now have modern much more comfortable seats in your truck.  Enjoy.  Before and After pics below.

Title: 2012-2015 Honda Civic Honda Key Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the key down so that the honda symbol is facing upward .
use a phillips 0 screwdriver to remove one screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the key down so that the Honda symbol is facing upward. Use a Phillips #0 screwdriver to remove one screw.

Lines.Text: insert the flat end of the spudger into the side of the key remote .
pry the key remote apart to remove the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the flat end of the Spudger into the side of the key remote. Pry the key remote apart to remove the cover.

Lines.Text: remove the existing battery .
insert a new cr1616 battery with the '+' sign facing upward .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the existing battery. Insert a new CR1616 battery with the '+' sign facing upward.

Lines.Text: place the two halves of the remote cover back together .
press the unlock or lock buttons to make sure the remote is working .
place the screw into the hole and tighten with a phillips 0 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the two halves of the remote cover back together. Press the unlock or lock buttons to make sure the remote is working. Place the screw into the hole and tighten with a Phillips  #0 screwdriver.

Subject: Honda Key Battery

Lines.Text: open trunk . most 2013 models do not have a trunk button on the remote . in order to open trunk , hold down unlock button .

Steps.Text_raw: Open trunk.  Most 2013 models do not have a trunk button on the remote.  In order to open trunk, hold down unlock button.

Lines.Text: remove the three trunk mats , shown in order .
the bottom , hard plastic mat serves as a surface to lay on , if need , whilst changing tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three trunk mats, shown in order. The bottom, hard plastic mat serves as a surface to lay on, if need, whilst changing tire.

Lines.Text: spare tire and tools needed to change tire are located under the trunk mats .
the jack and lug wrench are placed in a styrofoam container on top of the spare tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Spare tire and tools needed to change tire are located under the trunk mats. The jack and lug wrench are placed in a styrofoam container on top of the spare tire.

Lines.Text: turning counterclockwise , unscrew and remove plastic place holder in center of spare tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Turning counterclockwise, unscrew and remove plastic place holder in center of spare tire.

Lines.Text: loosen lug nuts turning counterclockwise , one turn each .

do not loosen lug nuts by circling the tire . loosen them first in the 1 , 3 and 5 positions ( shown in red circles ; the '1 ' position pointing north ) . after loosening the 1 , 3 and 5 positions , loosen 2 and 4.
do not completely remove any lug nuts until tire is raised from ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen lug nuts turning counterclockwise, one turn each. Do not loosen lug nuts by circling the tire.  Loosen them first in the 1, 3 and 5 positions (shown in red circles; the '1' position pointing north).  After loosening the 1, 3 and 5 positions, loosen 2 and 4. Do not completely remove ANY lug nuts until tire is raised from ground.

Lines.Text: place jack under jack plate , under appropriate tire .
jack plates are welded to frame with two tabs and raised dots to indicate index with jack .

Steps.Text_raw: Place jack under jack plate, under appropriate tire. Jack plates are welded to frame with two tabs and raised dots to indicate index with jack.

Lines.Text: insert jack hook into loop on jack .
insert end of jack hook into lug wrench .
to raise vehicle turn the lug wrench , attached to jack hook , clockwise . turn until tire is one inch ( approximately 30 mm ) off ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert jack hook into loop on jack. Insert end of jack hook into lug wrench. To raise vehicle turn the lug wrench, attached to jack hook, clockwise.  Turn until tire is one inch (approximately 30mm) off ground.

Lines.Text: once tire is elevated , remove lug nuts by hand .
be aware that the tire will shift as lug nuts are removed .
after removing lug nuts , carefully take tire off of frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Once tire is elevated, remove lug nuts by hand. Be aware that the tire will shift as lug nuts are removed. After removing lug nuts, carefully take tire off of frame.

Lines.Text: place spare tire onto frame .
hand tighten lug nuts ( the 1 , 3 and 5 positions first ) until secure .

Steps.Text_raw: Place spare tire onto frame. Hand tighten lug nuts (the 1, 3 and 5 positions first) until secure.

Lines.Text: lower vehicle , turning jack counterclockwise , until tire touches ground .
tighten lug nuts ( again , beginning with the 1 , 3 and 5 positions ) with lug wrench until secure .

Steps.Text_raw: Lower vehicle, turning jack counterclockwise, until tire touches ground. Tighten lug nuts (again, beginning with the 1, 3 and 5 positions) with lug wrench until secure.

Lines.Text: congratulations , your tire is changed !
note : obey the speed limitations of your spare tire . exceeding the recommended speed is dangerous and can damage the spare .

Steps.Text_raw: Congratulations, your tire is changed! NOTE: obey the speed limitations of your spare tire.  Exceeding the recommended speed is dangerous and can damage the spare.

Title: 1999-2004 Jeep Grand Cherokee Power Steering Pressure Hose Replacement

Lines.Text: here is a view of the power steering pump . it is located on the front left side in the engine compartment . visible fresh oil stains on the fan shroud and other parts .
most sludge was found at the pressure line connection
the leak is on top of the flare nut where the pipe enters the pump .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is a view of the power steering pump. It is located on the front left side in the engine compartment. Visible fresh oil stains on the fan shroud and other parts. Most sludge was found at the pressure line connection The leak is on top of the flare nut where the pipe enters the pump.

Lines.Text: to remove the hoses from the power steering pump , the air cleaner housing has to be removed . remove the four clips on the air filter cover
remove the air filter
loosen the clamps from the air intake duct to remove the air cleaner cover from the engine .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the hoses from the power steering pump, the air cleaner housing has to be removed. Remove the four clips on the air filter cover Remove the air filter Loosen the clamps from the air intake duct to remove the air cleaner cover from the engine.

Lines.Text: here is the complete housing . there are three 13 mm hex head mounting bolts for the air cleaner housing . one on the front left
one on the rear left
and the last one is difficult to find on the front right .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is the complete housing. There are three 13mm hex head mounting bolts for the air cleaner housing. One on the front left one on the rear left and the last one is difficult to find on the front right.

Lines.Text: all three bolts have lock nuts that can be accessed from the driver side front wheel well
use a socket wrench or similar tool to loosen the bolts , then remove the nuts in the wheel well .
all three bolts and nuts are identical

Steps.Text_raw: All three bolts have lock nuts that can be accessed from the driver side front wheel well Use a socket wrench or similar tool to loosen the bolts, then remove the nuts in the wheel well. All three bolts and nuts are identical

Lines.Text: with the three bolts remove the air filter housing can simply removed . this gives full access to the power steering gear and hoses .
new line .
use a 16 mm x 18 mm flare nut wrench . it will be safer then a open end wrench since it provides a better grip . this will prevent any damage to the flare nut on the hose .
disconnect the hose on the power steering pump by loosing the flare nut in a counter clockwise rotation

Steps.Text_raw: With the three bolts remove the air filter housing can simply removed. This gives full access to the power steering gear and hoses. New line. Use a 16mm x 18mm flare nut wrench. It will be safer then a open end wrench since it provides a better grip. This will prevent any damage to the flare nut on the hose. Disconnect the hose on the power steering pump by loosing the flare nut in a counter clockwise rotation

Lines.Text: disconnect the hose on the power steering gear by loosing the flare nut in a counter clockwise rotation
once both ends are disconnected , remove the hose from the vehicle .
new line .
install the supplied o-rings on either side of the new hose .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the hose on the power steering gear by loosing the flare nut in a counter clockwise rotation Once both ends are disconnected, remove the hose from the vehicle. New line. Install the supplied O-rings on either side of the new hose.

Lines.Text: install new power steering pressure hose .

Steps.Text_raw: Install new power steering pressure hose.

Subject: Power Steering Pressure Hose

Lines.Text: gather all the required items

Steps.Text_raw: Gather all the required items

Lines.Text: open the hood by pulling the hood latch .
the hood latch is located down and to the left of the steering wheel by the trunk button .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the hood by pulling the hood latch. The hood latch is located down and to the left of the steering wheel by the trunk button.

Lines.Text: lift the hood and hold it open with the hood prop bar .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the hood and hold it open with the hood prop bar.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic engine cover by lifting up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic engine cover by lifting up.

Lines.Text: jack up the car using the car jack .
caution : if at all possible , use a dedicated car jack instead of the emergency jack .
the emergency jack is not designed for frequent uses and could sustain damage if overused . if the emergency jack must be used , do not put any body part under the car until jack stands are secured .
be sure to place the car jack under the proper reinforced areas .
the reinforced area is located just behind the front wheels , between two bumps in the undercarrage frame .
reference the car's manual if you require more information on how to safely jack up your car without damaging the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Jack up the car using the car jack. Caution: If at all possible, use a dedicated car jack instead of the emergency jack. The emergency jack is not designed for frequent uses and could sustain damage if overused. If the emergency jack must be used, do not put any body part under the car until jack stands are secured. Be sure to place the car jack under the proper reinforced areas. The reinforced area is located just behind the front wheels, between two bumps in the undercarrage frame. Reference the car's manual if you require more information on how to safely jack up your car without damaging the frame.

Lines.Text: place a jack stand under the car near the jack .
lower the jack until the weight of the car is on the jack stand .
standing beside the car , lightly shake the car to ensure that it is securely on the jack stand before getting under the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Place a jack stand under the car near the jack. Lower the jack until the weight of the car is on the jack stand. Standing beside the car, lightly shake the car to ensure that it is securely on the jack stand before getting under the car.

Lines.Text: place the oil pan under the drain plug of the oil pan .
the oil pan is located under the car between the front wheels .
the drain plug will be on the left side of the oil pan when facing the front of the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the oil pan under the drain plug of the oil pan. The oil pan is located under the car between the front wheels. The drain plug will be on the left side of the oil pan when facing the front of the car.

Lines.Text: loosen the drain plug with the crescent wrench .
if you are using a socket , you will need a 19 mm socket to remove the oil pan nut
once the plug is loose , unscrew it by hand letting the oil flow out .
caution : if the engine has not cooled down before the oil is drained , the oil will be hot . use proper precautions to avoid burns .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the drain plug with the crescent wrench. If you are using a socket, you will need a 19mm socket to remove the oil pan nut Once the plug is loose, unscrew it by hand letting the oil flow out. Caution: If the engine has not cooled down before the oil is drained, the oil will be hot. Use proper precautions to avoid burns.

Lines.Text: leave the car for about 20 minuites to allow all the oil to drain .
once the oil stops dripping , screw the drain plug back in by hand .
tighten the drain plug with the crescent wrench until it is secure . do not over tighten as the plug will have to be removed for the next oil change .
the torque spec on the drain plug is 29.4-39.2 n-m ( 21.7-28.9 ft-lbf ) . over or under tightening the plug could damage the oil pan and lead to future leaks .

Steps.Text_raw: Leave the car for about 20 minuites to allow all the oil to drain. Once the oil stops dripping, screw the drain plug back in by hand. Tighten the drain plug with the crescent wrench until it is secure. Do not over tighten as the plug will have to be removed for the next oil change. The torque spec on the drain plug is 29.4-39.2 N-m (21.7-28.9 ft-lbf). Over or under tightening the plug could damage the oil pan and lead to future leaks.

Lines.Text: jack the car up unitil the weight of the car is on the jack , and then remove the jack stand .
after the jack stand is removed , lower the car using the jack , and then remove the jack from under the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Jack the car up unitil the weight of the car is on the jack, and then remove the jack stand. After the jack stand is removed, lower the car using the jack, and then remove the jack from under the car.

Lines.Text: locate the old oil filter .
it should be located in the back of the engine bay , behind the engine .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the old oil filter. It should be located in the back of the engine bay, behind the engine.

Lines.Text: using the socket wrench , extender , and oil filter wrench , loosen and remove the old oil filter .
the oil filter may be stuck on very tight . some may find it easier to use a gloved hand to begin to loosen the filter initially .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the socket wrench, extender, and oil filter wrench, loosen and remove the old oil filter. The oil filter may be stuck on very tight. Some may find it easier to use a gloved hand to begin to loosen the filter initially.

Lines.Text: take the new filter out of the box .
place a small amount of oil on the o-ring and threads of the new filter make it easier to remove in the future .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the new filter out of the box. Place a small amount of oil on the o-ring and threads of the new filter make it easier to remove in the future.

Lines.Text: screw new oil filter into the spot where the old one was using your hand .
tighten the filter using the filter wrench .
be sure not to over tighten the filter .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw new oil filter into the spot where the old one was using your hand. Tighten the filter using the filter wrench. Be sure not to over tighten the filter.

Lines.Text: unscrew the yellow oil fill cap using your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the yellow oil fill cap using your hands.

Lines.Text: using the funnel , add approximately 3.7 quarts of oil into the fill hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the funnel, add approximately 3.7 quarts of oil into the fill hole.

Lines.Text: screw the oil fill cap back on and tighten .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw the oil fill cap back on and tighten.

Lines.Text: wait a couple minutes for the oil to settle at the bottom of the oil pan .
using the dip stick , ensure the oil level is within the recommended range .

Steps.Text_raw: Wait a couple minutes for the oil to settle at the bottom of the oil pan. Using the dip stick, ensure the oil level is within the recommended range.

Lines.Text: wipe off the dipstick before to remove any excess oil on it .
put the dipstick back in the dipstick hole in the engine bay and push it all the way down
pull the dipstick back up and look at where the oil line is with respect to the markings on the dipstick
the low oil line is the lower raised line on the dipstick , and the high oil line is the higher raised line . you want the oil level to be in between the two
because the rx-8 engine is designed to burn oil during operation , i suggest you try to keep the oil in the upper third of the fill range to avoid driving with low oil in the future

if the oil level is too low , add more clean oil into the oil fill spout . if the oil level is too high it may be necessary to drain the oil and repeat the guide over again to avoid engine damage from excess engine oil

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe off the dipstick before to remove any excess oil on it. Put the dipstick back in the dipstick hole in the engine bay and push it all the way down Pull the dipstick back up and look at where the oil line is with respect to the markings on the dipstick The low oil line is the lower raised line on the dipstick, and the high oil line is the higher raised line. You want the oil level to be in between the two Because the RX-8 engine is designed to burn oil during operation, I suggest you try to keep the oil in the upper third of the fill range to avoid driving with low oil in the future If the oil level is too low, add more clean oil into the oil fill spout. If the oil level is too high it may be necessary to drain the oil and repeat the guide over again to avoid engine damage from excess engine oil

Lines.Text: loosen lug nuts with the socket/wrench just until they begin to turn .
removing lug nuts requires a 21 mm socket

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen lug nuts with the socket/wrench just until they begin to turn. Removing lug nuts requires a 21mm socket

Lines.Text: place jack under the car ( as shown ) .
it's best to avoid using the jack included with the car . if at all possible , use at least a 2 ton floor jack .
use the jack handle to crank up just enough so that the tire noticeably lifts off the ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Place Jack under the car (as shown). It's best to avoid using the jack included with the car. If at all possible, use at least a 2 ton floor jack. Use the Jack Handle to crank up just enough so that the tire noticeably lifts off the ground.

Lines.Text: put the jack stand under the car to ensure the car will not fall back down while you are working on it .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the jack stand under the car to ensure the car will not fall back down while you are working on it.

Lines.Text: remove all lug nuts holding the wheel on the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all lug nuts holding the wheel on the car.

Lines.Text: remove the front wheel from the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the front wheel from the vehicle.

Lines.Text: with the front wheel off repeat step 4 and step 5 to remove the rear wheel as well .

Steps.Text_raw: With the front wheel off repeat step 4 and step 5 to remove the rear wheel as well.

Lines.Text: place the rear wheel on the front of the car and place the front wheel in the rear . tighten up the lug nuts and your tire rotation is complete .
begin to tighten the lug nuts as much as you can with the wheel in the air , and then lower the car to the ground to finish tightening .
tighten the nuts in a star pattern to avoid over tightening one side leaving the wheel installed crooked
mazda recommends that the lug nuts be torqued to 108 ftlbs to ensure that the wheel is secure

Steps.Text_raw: Place the rear wheel on the front of the car and place the front wheel in the rear. Tighten up the lug nuts and your tire rotation is complete. Begin to tighten the lug nuts as much as you can with the wheel in the air, and then lower the car to the ground to finish tightening. Tighten the nuts in a star pattern to avoid over tightening one side leaving the wheel installed crooked Mazda recommends that the lug nuts be torqued to 108 ft*lbs to ensure that the wheel is secure

Title: 2011-2013 Scion tC Mid-Range Door Speaker Replacement

Lines.Text: using plastic pry tool . pry silver cover from handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using plastic pry tool. Pry silver cover from handle.

Lines.Text: using plastic pry tool . pry control panel off which controls locking , unlocking and windows .

Steps.Text_raw: Using plastic pry tool. Pry Control panel off which controls locking, unlocking and windows.

Lines.Text: un-attach white header ( connector ) from control panel . push side tab on side of white connector if a little stuck .

Steps.Text_raw: Un-attach white header(connector) from control panel. Push side tab on side of white connector if a little stuck.

Lines.Text: using pry tool . pry off plastic plate in section of door lock or pull handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using pry tool. Pry off plastic plate in section of door lock or pull handle.

Lines.Text: remove the 4 25 mm screw and the 2 25 mm screw on panel with a standard phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the #4 25mm screw and the #2 25mm screw on panel with a standard Phillips Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: pry off full door panel starting at bottom and working up the side , pulling fairly hard waiting . clicking noises are a good sign the door panel is unlocking .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry Off Full Door Panel starting at bottom and working up the side, pulling fairly hard waiting. Clicking noises are a good sign the door panel is unlocking.

Lines.Text: once door panel is free , remember to remove header from the tweeter in upper right hand corner of panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Once door panel is free, remember to remove header from the tweeter in upper right hand corner of panel.

Lines.Text: remove bracket from door by unscrewing the two 14 mm nuts pictured here connected to the speaker unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove bracket from door by unscrewing the two 14 mm nuts pictured here connected to the speaker unit.

Lines.Text: remove speaker from bracket by unscrewing the two 2 12 mm screws using a phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove speaker from bracket by unscrewing the two #2 12mm screws using a Phillips head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: desolder wires to new speaker unit using solder wick or a desoldering tool .
if you don't have experience soldering , make sure to check out soldering guide .
soldering uses high temperatures . be careful not to damage the components or injure yourself in the process .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder wires to new speaker unit using solder wick or a desoldering tool. If you don't have experience soldering, make sure to check out [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|this soldering guide]. Soldering uses high temperatures. Be careful not to damage the components or injure yourself in the process.

Subject: Mid-Range Door Speaker

Title: 2009 Subaru Impreza WRX Rear Speaker Replacement

Lines.Text: pry off the plastic tab inside the rear door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry off the plastic tab inside the rear door handle.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 phillips screw inside the door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" Phillips screw inside the door handle.

Lines.Text: use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the plastic tab inside the rear door armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the plastic tab inside the rear door armrest.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 phillips screw inside the armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" Phillips screw inside the armrest.

Lines.Text: use flathead to pry off the upper panel located at the top of the rear door panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Use flathead to pry off the upper panel located at the top of the rear door panel.

Lines.Text: use the flathead screwdriver to pry off and remove the panel over the door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flathead screwdriver to pry off and remove the panel over the door handle.

Lines.Text: remove the bundle of wires from the panel by pressing the tabs on the sides of the large white plastic connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bundle of wires from the panel by pressing the tabs on the sides of the large white plastic connector.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 screws behind the door handle panel that was just removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" screws behind the door handle panel that was just removed.

Lines.Text: use the flathead screwdriver to pry off the door panel , starting from the outside edge of the door .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flathead screwdriver to pry off the door panel, starting from the outside edge of the door.

Lines.Text: use your hands to pull off and remove the door panel from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your hands to pull off and remove the door panel from the frame.

Lines.Text: using your hands , remove the two remaining wires connecting the door panel to the frame .
the door panel is now completely removed from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands, remove the two remaining wires connecting the door panel to the frame. The door panel is now completely removed from the frame.

Lines.Text: locate and remove all three phillips 8x3 /4 screws . there's one on top and two on the sides where the arrows are pointing .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove all three Phillips 8x3/4" screws. There's one on top and two on the sides where the arrows are pointing.

Lines.Text: once the screws are removed , the speaker will easily pop out of the door revealing two wires attached to the speaker with a white clip . remove this white clip by simply squeezing one of the tabs that lock it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are removed, the speaker will easily pop out of the door revealing two wires attached to the speaker with a white clip. Remove this white clip by simply squeezing one of the tabs that lock it in place.

Lines.Text: once the clip is removed from the speaker , you will want to then cut the wires from the white clip using a wire cutters .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the clip is removed from the speaker, you will want to then cut the wires from the white clip using a wire cutters.

Lines.Text: once the white clip is removed from the wires , you will then want to strip about 0.5 of plastic from the wire revealing bare copper wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the white clip is removed from the wires, you will then want to strip about 0.5" of plastic from the wire revealing bare copper wire.

Lines.Text: once the wires are cut , you will then want to add separate clips on the end of the wires by placing the clips on the wires , and then using a pliers , squeeze the plastic to crimp the clip securely on the wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the wires are cut, you will then want to add separate clips on the end of the wires by placing the clips on the wires, and then using a pliers, squeeze the plastic to crimp the clip securely on the wire.

Lines.Text: once the new clips are now on the separate wires , place these clips into the back of your new speaker .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the new clips are now on the separate wires, place these clips into the back of your new speaker.

Lines.Text: insert your new speaker where the old speaker once was .
use the same three screws that you removed in the first step to secure your new speaker in the door .
if you're having problems with your new speaker , refer to the troubleshooting guide 2009_subaru_impreza_wrx_troubleshootinghere .
congratulations ! you are now done !

Steps.Text_raw: Insert your new speaker where the old speaker once was. Use the same three screws that you removed in the first step to secure your new speaker in the door. If you're having problems with your new speaker, refer to the troubleshooting guide [[2009_Subaru_Impreza_WRX_Troubleshooting|here]]. Congratulations! You are now done!

Subject: Rear Speaker

Title: 2009 Subaru Impreza WRX Front Door Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: pry up the plastic tab from inside the handle located on the front door armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry up the plastic tab from inside the  handle located on the front door armrest.

Lines.Text: pry up the plastic tab from inside the door handle housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry up the plastic tab from inside the door handle housing.

Lines.Text: use your phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 phillips screw by the upper door handle .
unscrew the second 8x3 /4 phillips screw located inside the lower door handle on the door's armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" Phillips screw by the upper door handle. Unscrew the second 8x3/4" Phillips screw located inside the lower door handle on the door's armrest.

Lines.Text: pry off the entire door speaker and its housing located inside of the mirror .
using your flathead screwdriver , pry up the latch connecting the two white cords and disconnect the speaker .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry off the entire door speaker and its housing located inside of the mirror. Using your flathead screwdriver, pry up the latch connecting the two white cords and disconnect the speaker.

Lines.Text: using your flathead screwdriver , pry the middle plastic door piece away from the armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your flathead screwdriver, pry the middle plastic door piece away from the armrest.

Lines.Text: using your flathead screwdriver , press the white tab on the side of the larger cord bundle connecting the assembly .
the larger cord bundle now can be pulled out .
press the white tab on the smaller cord bundle and disconnect the smaller cord bundle from the assembly .
take note of the two screws that are now visible in the middle of the door panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your flathead screwdriver, press the white tab on the side of the larger cord bundle connecting the assembly. The larger cord bundle now can be pulled out. Press the white tab on the smaller cord bundle and disconnect the smaller cord bundle from the assembly. Take note of the two screws that are now visible in the middle of the door panel.

Lines.Text: unscrew both 8x3 /4 phillips screws from the middle of the door panel using your phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both 8x3/4" Phillips screws from the middle of the door panel using your Phillips screwdriver.

Lines.Text: pry the left side of the door panel away from the door using a flathead screwdriver .
it may be easiest to start by prying away where the red circle is located .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the left side of the door panel away from the door using a flathead screwdriver. It may be easiest to start by prying away where the red circle is located.

Lines.Text: using your hands now , pry the door panel away from the door .
you will hear a series of pops when the white tabs disconnect from the door .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands now, pry the door panel away from the door. You will hear a series of pops when the white tabs disconnect from the door.

Lines.Text: finish pulling the door off of the frame , now that all the clips have been disconnected .
pull the door from the top , not the bottom or sides .

Steps.Text_raw: Finish pulling the door off of the frame, now that all the clips have been disconnected. Pull the door from the top, not the bottom or sides.

Lines.Text: disconnect the final two power window cables that connect the door panel to the door frame by pulling both out of their sockets .
congratulations ! you are now done .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the final two power window cables that connect the door panel to the door frame by pulling both out of their sockets. Congratulations! You are now done.

Subject: Front Door Panel

Title: 2009 Subaru Impreza WRX Rear Door Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: pry off the plastic tab inside the rear door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry off the plastic tab inside the rear door handle.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 phillips screw inside the door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" Phillips screw inside the door handle.

Lines.Text: use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the plastic tab inside the rear door armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the plastic tab inside the rear door armrest.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 phillips screw inside the armrest .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" Phillips screw inside the armrest.

Lines.Text: use flathead to pry off the upper panel located at the top of the rear door panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Use flathead to pry off the upper panel located at the top of the rear door panel.

Lines.Text: use the flathead screwdriver to pry off and remove the panel over the door handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flathead screwdriver to pry off and remove the panel over the door handle.

Lines.Text: remove the bundle of wires from the panel by pressing the tabs on the sides of the large white plastic connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bundle of wires from the panel by pressing the tabs on the sides of the large white plastic connector.

Lines.Text: use the phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3 /4 screws behind the door handle panel that was just removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips screwdriver to unscrew the 8x3/4" screws behind the door handle panel that was just removed.

Lines.Text: use the flathead screwdriver to pry off the door panel , starting from the outside edge of the door .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flathead screwdriver to pry off the door panel, starting from the outside edge of the door.

Lines.Text: use your hands to pull off and remove the door panel from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your hands to pull off and remove the door panel from the frame.

Lines.Text: using your hands , remove the two remaining wires connecting the door panel to the frame .
the door panel is now completely removed from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands, remove the two remaining wires connecting the door panel to the frame. The door panel is now completely removed from the frame.

Subject: Rear Door Panel

Toolbox.Name: lighter if using heat shrink tubing

Lines.Text: insert a plastic trim removal tool or pry tool into the seam behind the trim surround , and twist lightly .
if you don't have a trim removal tool , you can use a thin flathead screwdriverbut be careful not to damage the trim or dash materials .
use your hands to slowly pry off the rest of the trim surround .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a plastic trim removal tool or pry tool into the seam behind the trim surround, and twist lightly. If you don't have a trim removal tool, you can use a thin flathead screwdriver—but be careful not to damage the trim or dash materials. Use your hands to slowly pry off the rest of the trim surround.

Lines.Text: remove the four 8x3 /4 phillips screws highlighted . then slowly slide the stereo out from its housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 8x3/4" Phillips screws highlighted. Then slowly slide the stereo out from its housing.

Lines.Text: unplug both the white and black wiring harnesses by pressing the small tab above the socket connector .
remove the antennae cord by sliding it from its housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug both the white and black wiring harnesses by pressing the small tab above the socket connector. Remove the antennae cord by sliding it from its housing.

Lines.Text: locate your aftermarket wiring harness included with the aftermarket stereo .
strip each wire necessary for installation ( see table in step 7 ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate your aftermarket wiring harness included with the aftermarket stereo. Strip each wire necessary for installation (See Table in Step 7).

Lines.Text: locate the white wiring harness behind the stereo housing .
cut the cords to separate the wires connecting the harness to the car's electrical system .
note : be careful not to cut the black wiring harness instead . the black harness is for the cd changer and isn't used in this installation .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the white wiring harness behind the stereo housing. Cut the cords to separate the wires connecting the harness to the car's electrical system. Note: Be careful not to cut the black wiring harness instead. The black harness is for the CD changer and isn't used in this installation.

Lines.Text: strip each wire in the wiring harness necessary for installation .
be careful while stripping the wires . they are extremely brittle and tend to rip easily .
once both the oem white wiring harness and the black aftermarket wiring harness are stripped , bring the two ends together to start comparing which wires need to be connected .

Steps.Text_raw: Strip each wire in the wiring harness necessary for installation. Be careful while stripping the wires. They are extremely brittle and tend to rip easily. Once both the OEM white wiring harness and the black aftermarket wiring harness are stripped, bring the two ends together to start comparing which wires need to be connected.

Lines.Text: connect the wires from the two wiring harnesses .
crimp caps , soldering , or wire butt connectors can be used for the connection . please see related guides for instruction on each method .
use the table to the left to match up correct wires . wires not listed are not used in the installation and should either be uncut or taped with electrical tape at the ends .

Steps.Text_raw: Connect the wires from the two wiring harnesses. Crimp Caps, soldering, or wire butt connectors can be used for the connection. Please see related guides for instruction on each method. Use the table to the left to match up correct wires. Wires not listed are not used in the installation and should either be uncut or taped with electrical tape at the ends.

Lines.Text: once the two wiring harnesses are connected completely , it's time to install the new stereo .
locate the aftermarket installation bracket included with the stereo .
screw it into place with the same four 8x3 /4 phillips screws from the original stereo .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the two wiring harnesses are connected completely, it's time to install the new stereo. Locate the aftermarket installation bracket included with the stereo. Screw it into place with the same four 8x3/4" Phillips screws from the original stereo.

Lines.Text: locate the aftermarket metal spacer .
slide it into the mounting bracket .
press the triangle tabs along each edge to form a solid connection .
note : there may be a slight amount of movement after the tabs are already pressed . is is unavoidable and most movement will be removed once the stereo is in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the aftermarket metal spacer. Slide it into the mounting bracket. Press the triangle tabs along each edge to form a solid connection. Note: There may be a slight amount of movement after the tabs are already pressed. Is is unavoidable and most movement will be removed once the stereo is in place.

Lines.Text: reconnect the black wiring harness into the new stereo . be careful of the rejoined wire connections because they are often fragile .
reconnect the antennae cord into the cylindrical slot . if it doesn't fit , you will need to purchase and antennae adapter specific to your car .

Steps.Text_raw: Reconnect the black wiring harness into the new stereo. Be careful of the rejoined wire connections because they are often fragile. Reconnect the antennae cord into the cylindrical slot. If it doesn't fit, you will need to purchase and antennae adapter specific to your car.

Lines.Text: once the cords are reconnected , slide the stereo back into the housing . it will click into place .
note : do not force the stereo into place . if it doesn't slid in smoothly , most likely the wiring is in the way and should be adjusted to prevent damage .
snap the final molding back into place to complete the dash .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the cords are reconnected, slide the stereo back into the housing. It will click into place. Note: Do not force the stereo into place. If it doesn't slid in smoothly, most likely the wiring is in the way and should be adjusted to prevent damage. Snap the final molding back into place to complete the dash.

Lines.Text: you now have completed the aftermarket stereo installation .
check to see if the stereo has power and connects to the speakers . if there is an electrical issue , follow the troubleshooting tips associated with this guide for more instruction .

Steps.Text_raw: You now have completed the aftermarket stereo installation. Check to see if the stereo has power and connects to the speakers. If there is an electrical issue, follow the troubleshooting tips associated with this guide for more instruction.

Lines.Text: open the spare tire compartment in the trunk of the vehicle by pulling up on the black tab .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the spare tire compartment in the trunk of the vehicle by pulling up on the black tab.

Lines.Text: locate the manufacturer supplied jack and jack handle in the spare tire compartment , these will be needed for the replacement .
this is an emergency jack , and is not safe to use for routine maintenance . use a floor jack with a weight rating appropriate for your vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the manufacturer supplied jack and jack handle in the spare tire compartment, these will be needed for the replacement. This is an emergency jack, and is not safe to use for routine maintenance. Use a floor jack with a weight rating appropriate for your vehicle.

Lines.Text: place the jack approximately 2 feet behind the passenger wheel tire at the shown location . finger tighten the jack until snug against the frame .
it's best to avoid using the jack included with the car . if at all possible , use at least a 2 ton floor jack .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack approximately 2 feet behind the passenger wheel tire at the shown location. Finger tighten the jack until snug against the frame. It's best to avoid using the jack included with the car. If at all possible, use at least a 2 ton floor jack.

Lines.Text: place the jack handle in the jack to begin lifting the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the jack handle in the jack to begin lifting the car.

Lines.Text: using two hands , turn the jack handle clockwise and raise the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two hands, turn the jack handle clockwise and raise the car.

Lines.Text: raise the car until the jack stand can fit underneath the frame . place the jack stand under the frame as close to the jack as possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the car until the jack stand can fit underneath the frame. Place the jack stand under the frame as close to the jack as possible.

Lines.Text: lower the car onto the jack stand by turning the handle counterclockwise . remove the jack once the load is taken off .

Steps.Text_raw: Lower the car onto the jack stand by turning the handle counterclockwise. Remove the jack once the load is taken off.

Lines.Text: once the jack stand is securely in place locate the engine oil drain plug . this is most accessible by crawling on your back from the front of the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the jack stand is securely in place locate the engine oil drain plug. This is most accessible by crawling on your back from the front of the car.

Lines.Text: using the 14 mm socket wrench loosen the drain plug by turning counterclockwise until you can turn the plug by hand . be careful not to loosen all the way to avoid spilling oil .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 14mm socket wrench loosen the drain plug by turning counterclockwise until you can turn the plug by hand. Be careful not to loosen all the way to avoid spilling oil.

Lines.Text: once the plug is slightly loose , place the oil drain pan underneath the plug , remember to account for the arc of the stream when placing the oil pan . once the pan is placed continue to loosen the plug until oil begins to flow . allow oil to drain freely until only slow drops come from the drain .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the plug is slightly loose, place the oil drain pan underneath the plug, remember to account for the arc of the stream when placing the oil pan. Once the pan is placed  continue to loosen the plug until oil begins to flow. Allow oil to drain freely until only slow drops come from the drain.

Lines.Text: allow oil to drain freely until drops of oil are slowly coming from the drain . then re-tighten the oil drain plug using the 14 mm socket wrench .
do not over-tighten the drain plug , only apply approximately 20 lbs to the end of the wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Allow oil to drain freely until drops of oil are slowly coming from the drain. Then re-tighten the oil drain plug using the 14mm socket wrench. Do not over-tighten the drain plug, only apply approximately 20 lbs to the end of the wrench.

Lines.Text: now locate the oil filter , this most accessible on your back from the front of the car . the filter should be about a foot closer to the front of the car from the oil drain plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Now locate the oil filter, this most accessible on your back from the front of the car. The filter should be about a foot closer to the front of the car from the oil drain plug.

Lines.Text: using the 3 /8 inch socket wrench with extension loosen the oil filter by putting the extension in the square hole in the filter and turning counterclockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 3/8 inch socket wrench with extension loosen the oil filter by putting the extension in the square hole in the filter and turning counterclockwise.

Lines.Text: place the oil drain pan directly under the filter . fully loosen the filter by hand until you are able to remove it from the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the oil drain pan directly under the filter. Fully loosen the filter by hand until you are able to remove it from the vehicle.

Lines.Text: remove paper filter from filter cartridge , this is disposable . use the flathead screwdriver to pry the o-ring off the cartridge .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove paper filter from filter cartridge, this is disposable. Use the flathead screw driver to pry the o-ring off the cartridge.

unscrew the second 8x3 /4 phillips screw located inside the lower door handle on the door's armrest .

using your flathead screwdriver , pry up the latch connecting the two white cords and disconnect the speaker .

Lines.Text: using your flathead screwdriver , press the white tab on the side of the larger cord bundle connecting the assembly .
the larger cord bundle now can be pulled out .
press the white tab on the smaller cord bundle and disconnect the smaller cord bundle from the assembly .
take note of the two screws that are now visible in the middle of the door panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your flathead screwdriver, press the white tab on the side of the larger cord bundle connecting the assembly. The larger cord bundle now can be pulled out. Press the white tab on the smaller cord bundle and disconnect the smaller cord bundle from the assembly. Take note of the two screws that are now visible in the middle of the door panel.

Lines.Text: unscrew both 8x3 /4 phillips screws from the middle of the door panel using your phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both 8x3/4" Phillips screws from the middle of the door panel using your Phillips screwdriver.

Lines.Text: pry the left side of the door panel away from the door using a flathead screwdriver .
it may be easiest to start by prying away where the red circle is located .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the left side of the door panel away from the door using a flathead screwdriver. It may be easiest to start by prying away where the red circle is located.

you will hear a series of pops when the white tabs disconnect from the door .

Lines.Text: finish pulling the door off of the frame , now that all the clips have been disconnected .

Lines.Text: disconnect the final two power window cables that connect the door panel to the door frame by pulling both out of their sockets .
congratulations ! you are now done .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the final two power window cables that connect the door panel to the door frame by pulling both out of their sockets. Congratulations! You are now done.

Lines.Text: this is how the speaker will look when the inside of the door is removed ( refer to front door removal guide for more info ) .

Steps.Text_raw: This is how the speaker will look when the inside of the door is removed (refer to front door removal guide for more info).

Lines.Text: there will be three 8x3 /4 phillips screws ( the third screw is indicated by the arrow ; you can't see the screw in the picture ) keeping the speaker in place . use a 0 phillips screwdriver to remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: There will be three 8x3/4" Phillips screws (the third screw is indicated by the arrow; you can't see the screw in the picture) keeping the speaker in place. Use a #0 Phillips screwdriver to remove them.

Lines.Text: there will be a plastic adapter connecting wires to the speaker . to separate the adapter from the speaker , use a flathead screwdriver to pry the adapter off .

Steps.Text_raw: There will be a plastic adapter connecting wires to the speaker. To separate the adapter from the speaker, use a flathead screwdriver to pry the adapter off.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic adapter from the wiring using wire cutters as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic adapter from the wiring using wire cutters as shown.

Lines.Text: using wire strippers , strip the two wires shown ( blue and white , respectively ) at about 1 inch from the end .

Steps.Text_raw: Using wire strippers, strip the two wires shown (blue and white, respectively) at about 1 inch from the end.

Lines.Text: using pliers , attach a special adapter piece to both wires as shown . simply insert the wire into the plastic cavity and apply pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Using pliers, attach a special adapter piece to both wires as shown. Simply insert the wire into the plastic cavity and apply pressure.

Lines.Text: locate the part of your new speaker which has two 8x3 /4 phillips screws in line . unscrew these screws slightly to allow the adapter pieces to fit under them , then screw them back in to secure the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the part of your new speaker which has two 8x3/4" Phillips screws in line. Unscrew these screws slightly to allow the adapter pieces to fit under them, then screw them back in to secure the wires.

Lines.Text: the final step is to place the new speaker , and tighten the same three screws as before to secure it .
if you're having problems with your new speaker , refer to the troubleshooting guide 2009_subaru_impreza_wrx_troubleshootinghere .

Steps.Text_raw: The final step is to place the new speaker, and tighten the same three screws as before to secure it. If you're having problems with your new speaker, refer to the troubleshooting guide [[2009_Subaru_Impreza_WRX_Troubleshooting|here]].

Lines.Text: begin by opening the hood of the car and locating the battery on the front of the driver side in the engine compartment

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by opening the hood of the car and locating the battery on the front of the driver side in the engine compartment

Lines.Text: using a socket wrench , loosen the 2 ( 5 /16 inch ) nuts on the top of the battery support bracket
remove the bracket by lifting up

Steps.Text_raw: Using a socket wrench, loosen the 2 (5/16 inch) nuts on the top of the battery support bracket Remove the bracket by lifting up

Lines.Text: after removing the bracket , locate the supporting rod behind the battery
the rod is hooked on a hole in the metal behind the battery . unhook the rod and remove it

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the bracket, locate the supporting rod behind the battery The rod is hooked on  a hole in the metal behind the battery. Unhook the rod and remove it

Lines.Text: start with the negative terminal of the battery
loosen the nut on the negative terminal with a 10 mm socket wrench
remove the wire by slightly twisting and pulling up

Steps.Text_raw: Start with the negative terminal of the battery Loosen the nut on the negative terminal with a 10mm socket wrench Remove the wire by slightly twisting and pulling up

Lines.Text: remove the cap from the positive terminal of the battery
using a 10 mm socket wrench , loosen the nut on the positive terminal
remove the wire from the positive terminal by slightly twisting and pulling up
remove the battery by lifting it out of the engine compartment

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cap from the positive terminal of the battery Using a 10mm socket wrench, loosen the nut on the positive terminal Remove the wire from the positive terminal by slightly twisting and pulling up Remove the battery by lifting it out of the engine compartment

Title: Chevrolet Windshield Wiper Motor / Transmission Replacement

Lines.Text: raise the hood .
remove the negative terminal clamp from the battery . should be 10 mm

Steps.Text_raw: Raise the hood. Remove the negative terminal clamp from the battery.  Should be 10 mm

Lines.Text: apply painters tape to the windshield under each wiper arm .
use a mark to record the wiper arm position on the windshield

Steps.Text_raw: Apply painters tape to the windshield under each wiper arm. Use a mark to record the wiper arm position on the windshield

Lines.Text: remove antenna , use the proper wrench to loosen the antenna from the base .
pull the washer hoses off of the small studs near the wiper arm bases .
open the plastic caps from the base of the washer arms , using the proper socket wrench , loosen and remove the hold down nut .
remove the washer arms . they make a puller tool but you should be able to wiggle them back and forth and lift them off the stud .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove Antenna, use the proper wrench to loosen the antenna from the base. Pull the washer hoses off of the small studs near the wiper arm bases. Open the plastic caps from the base of the washer arms, using the proper socket wrench, loosen and remove the hold down nut. Remove the washer arms.  They make a puller tool but you should be able to wiggle them back and forth and lift them off the stud.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic end covers by prying them off with a wide screwdriver
remove 2 clips on the front of the plastic grille .
remove 2 bolts from each side of the plastic grille .
pull up on the grille and disconnect the wiper fluid tube near the drivers fender . there should be a section that will pull apart to allow removal .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic end covers by prying them off with a wide screw driver Remove 2 clips on the front of the plastic grille. Remove 2 bolts from each side of the plastic grille. Pull up on the grille and disconnect the wiper fluid tube near the drivers fender.  there should be a section that will pull apart to allow removal.

Lines.Text: remove three bolts holding the wiper transmission to the body . there should be a rubber gasket on each one - do not remove them from the assembly .
remove the power plug , squeeze the plug on the bottom and pull , it should release with little effort .
now you have to wiggle the transmission back and forth in the fire wall area in order to get it out

Steps.Text_raw: remove three bolts holding the wiper transmission to the body. There should be a rubber gasket on each one - do not remove them from the assembly. Remove the power plug, squeeze the plug on the bottom and pull, it should release with little effort. Now you have to wiggle the transmission back and forth in the fire wall area in order to get it out

Lines.Text: using a screwdriver , pry off the linkage from the motor arm .
remove three torx ( 30 ) screws which will separate the wiper motor from the wiper transmission .
note - if you purchase the wiper transmission assembly from a chevy dealership , it will probably come with a new motor already attached . this means you can skip this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a screwdriver, pry off the linkage from the motor arm. Remove three TORX (30) screws which will separate the wiper motor from the wiper transmission. NOTE - if you purchase the wiper transmission assembly from a Chevy dealership, it will probably come with a new motor already attached.  This means you can skip this step.

Lines.Text: reverse the steps to install the wiper transmission assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Reverse the steps to install the wiper transmission assembly.

Subject: Windshield Wiper Motor Transmission

Title: Installing Truck LED Roof Cab Lights

Lines.Text: lower the headliner . you'll need to remove both visors and the overhead storage console .
get your fingers where you can grab the ( 4 ) metal clips to release .
you will also need to remove the driver and passenger side a-pillar covers .

Steps.Text_raw: Lower the headliner. You'll need to remove both visors and the overhead storage console. Get your fingers where you can grab the (4) metal clips to release. You will also need to remove the driver and passenger side A-pillar covers.

Lines.Text: get some painters tape and tape up the entire front area of the roof where you will be installing the led cab lights .
mark the locations where you will be attaching each led light and the holes that you will be drilling . ( you can use a dry erase marker . )

Steps.Text_raw: Get some painters tape and tape up the entire front area of the roof where you will be installing the LED cab lights. Mark the locations where you will be attaching each LED light and the holes that you will be drilling. (You can use a dry erase marker.)

Lines.Text: draw a line perpendicular to the sides of the truck and measure the distance from the windshield molding by the driver's side door . you will basically need to draw a horizontal straight line from both sides of the truck and then find the center of the truck . use the midpoint as a guideline and measure where you will be placing the rest .

Steps.Text_raw: Draw a line perpendicular to the sides of the truck and measure the distance from the windshield molding by the driver's side door.  You will basically need to draw a horizontal straight line from both sides of the truck and then find the center of the truck. Use the midpoint as a guideline and measure where you will be placing the rest.

Lines.Text: you should have five lines to mark each of the led roof lights .
measure 6.5 inches for each of the lines to mark the center hole . when you mark all the center holes , lay all of the led cab lights in place to see if you like the look .

Steps.Text_raw: You should have five lines to mark each of the LED roof lights. Measure 6.5 inches for each of the lines to mark the center hole. When you mark all the center holes, lay all of the LED cab lights in place to see if you like the look.

Lines.Text: get some spare cardboard laying around and trace out a template of the led roof light . mark the locations where you will drill the holes and align the template onto the lines you drew so you know where all the holes will be drilled later on .
double check all the locations .

Steps.Text_raw: Get some spare cardboard laying around and trace out a template of the LED roof light. Mark the locations where you will drill the holes and align the template onto the lines you drew so you know where all the holes will be drilled later on. Double check all the locations.

Lines.Text: drill the holes through the painter's tape .
bolt down the led cab lights onto the truck's roof .
the underside of the led roof cab light shows the 3 locations that will need to be marked on the roof to drill .

Steps.Text_raw: Drill the holes through the painter's tape. Bolt down the LED cab lights onto the truck's roof. The underside of the LED roof cab light shows the 3 locations that will need to be marked on the roof to drill.

Lines.Text: connect the wires . the plugs are polar sensitive , so if it doesn't light up , you will need to flip it 180 degrees . you'll need to wire them up in parallel and use some electrical tape so they maintain a parallel wiring .
tape the wire harness onto the reinforcement beam .

Steps.Text_raw: Connect the wires. The plugs are polar sensitive, so if it doesn't light up, you will need to flip it 180 degrees.  You'll need to wire them up in parallel and use some electrical tape so they maintain a parallel wiring. Tape the wire harness onto the reinforcement beam.

Lines.Text: route all the wire through the front map light assembly to complete installation .

Steps.Text_raw: Route all the wire through the front map light assembly to complete installation.

Subject: Ford F250 LED Roof Cab Lights

Title: 1992-1999 BMW 3 Series  Brake Light Bulb Replacement

Lines.Text: determine which brake light is out . have a friend step on the brake and see which light does not illuminate .
in the trunk , locate the plastic cover that protects the taillight . turn the handle clockwise ( as shown by the arrow above the handle ) and gently pull outwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Determine which brake light is out. Have a friend step on the brake and see which light does not illuminate. In the trunk, locate the plastic cover that protects the taillight. Turn the handle clockwise (as shown by the arrow above the handle) and gently pull outwards.

Lines.Text: pinch the top and bottom of the power connection . pull hard on the power connection to remove it , disconnecting the wiring .

Steps.Text_raw: Pinch the top and bottom of the power connection. Pull hard on the power connection to remove it, disconnecting the wiring.

Lines.Text: undo all four nuts with the 8 mm socket and ratchet .
the nuts are marked by red circles in the second image .

Steps.Text_raw: Undo all four nuts with the 8mm socket and ratchet. The nuts are marked by red circles in the second image.

Lines.Text: to remove the taillight from the metal frame , push outwards ( towards the back of the car ) on the back of one of the plastic bulb carriers .
support the taillight housing with your free hand to keep it from falling and being damaged .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the taillight from the metal frame, push outwards (towards the back of the car) on the back of one of the plastic bulb carriers. Support the taillight housing with your free hand to keep it from falling and being damaged.

Lines.Text: the brake light bulb is behind the bottom right plug . push the plug inwards while turning it counterclockwise to remove the assembly . you may need to use a lot of force to turn the plug .

Steps.Text_raw: The brake light bulb is behind the bottom right plug. Push the plug inwards while turning it counterclockwise to remove the assembly. You may need to use a lot of force to turn the plug.

Lines.Text: the 7528 bulb is in the off-white plastic carrier . apply slight pressure downwards and twist counterclockwise to remove the bulb .

Steps.Text_raw: The 7528 bulb is in the off-white plastic carrier.  Apply slight pressure downwards and twist counterclockwise to remove the bulb.

Lines.Text: to determine whether or not a bulb is burnt , check for a connection break in the bulb . in the image shown , wires run continuously between both connections . this means the bulb is working correctly and can be installed .
insert the new bulb into the white housing and turn clockwise to install .

Steps.Text_raw: To determine whether or not a bulb is burnt, check for a connection break in the bulb.  In the image shown, wires run continuously between both connections. This means the bulb is working correctly and can be installed. Insert the new bulb into the white housing and turn clockwise to install.

Lines.Text: the plastic carriers only fit into the taillight carrier one way . the fit is very snug against the metal ground .

align the two plastic tabs with the indents in the metal sheet . push hard inward while twisting clockwise until the bulb is horizontal , similar to the other four bulbs . when the bulb fits correctly , you will hear a loud snap .

note : the bulb carrier is very hard to place correctly . ensure the tabs are lined up , and apply hard pressure while turning clockwise . if the bulb carrier does not sit properly , remove it and reseat it .

Steps.Text_raw: The plastic carriers only fit into the taillight carrier one way.  The fit is very snug against the metal ground. Align the two plastic tabs with the indents in the metal sheet.  Push hard inward while twisting clockwise until the bulb is horizontal, similar to the other four bulbs. When the bulb fits correctly, you will hear a loud snap. Note: The bulb carrier is very hard to place correctly.  Ensure the tabs are lined up, and apply hard pressure while turning clockwise.  If the bulb carrier does not sit properly, remove it and reseat it.

Subject: Brake Light Bulb

Title: How to Replace the Wiper Arm(s) of a 2005 Toyota Corolla

Lines.Text: take the tip of your flathead screwdriver , and wedge it underneath the wiper cap .
firmly pry the wiper cap ++upwards++ until it's completely off .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the tip of your flathead screwdriver, and wedge it underneath the wiper cap. Firmly pry the wiper cap ++upwards++ until it's completely off.
