Lines.Text: place the head of your ratchet on the exposed nut .
loosen the nut by turning your ratchet counter clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the head of your ratchet on the exposed nut. Loosen the nut by turning your ratchet counter clockwise.

Lines.Text: once the nut is loose enough , you may grab it and place it to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the nut is loose enough, you may grab it and place it to the side.

Lines.Text: firmly grip the lower end of the wiper arm .
pull it towards you , so that the wiper arm is extended in the upward position .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grip the lower end of the wiper arm. Pull it towards you, so that the wiper arm is extended in the upward position.

Lines.Text: while holding the lower end of the wiper arm , tug the wiper arm upwards until completely detached .
don't be discouraged if the wiper arm isn't detached right away . you may have to tug upwards a few times to detach it .

Steps.Text_raw: While holding the lower end of the wiper arm, tug the wiper arm upwards until completely detached. Don't be discouraged if the wiper arm isn't detached right away. You may have to tug upwards a few times to detach it.

Lines.Text: have your new wiper arm extended in the upward position ( just how your old wiper arm was extended at the end of step 4 ) .
take your wiper arm , and center its hole on the exposed metal threading .

Steps.Text_raw: Have your new wiper arm extended in the upward position (just how your old wiper arm was extended at the end of Step 4). Take your wiper arm, and center its hole on the exposed metal threading.

Lines.Text: once the wiper arm has been placed onto the metal threading , firmly grip the lower end of the wiper arm .
slowly push the wiper arm downwards and away from you , so that it's flat with the windshield .
make sure to do this slowly so that your fingers are not compressed by the wiper arm and the windshield .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the wiper arm has been placed onto the metal threading, firmly grip the lower end of the wiper arm. Slowly push the wiper arm downwards and away from you, so that it's flat with the windshield. Make sure to do this slowly so that your fingers are not compressed by the wiper arm and the windshield.

Lines.Text: place the same nut from earlier onto the exposed threaded metal .
place the head of your ratchet onto the nut .
tighten the nut by turning your ratchet clockwise , until it can no longer be tightened .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the same nut from earlier onto the exposed threaded metal. Place the head of your ratchet onto the nut. Tighten the nut by turning your ratchet clockwise, until it can no longer be tightened.

Lines.Text: firmly press the wiper cap upon the exposed nut .
once the wiper cap is secure , you may repeat steps 1-9 to the other wiper arm .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly press the wiper cap upon the exposed nut. Once the wiper cap is secure, you may repeat steps 1-9 to the other wiper arm.

Subject: Wiper Arm

Lines.Text: locate the latch to open your hood , normally located by your left foot when sitting in the driver's seat .
after lifting the latch , open your hood and securely hold it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the latch to open your hood, normally located by your left foot when sitting in the driver's seat. After lifting the latch, open your hood and securely hold it up.

Lines.Text: you will lose your radio station presets and clock time if you do not use a memory saver . one will not be used in this guide .
the battery is located on the front driver's side of the vehicle .
begin using your ratchet to loosen and remove the negative ( black ) cable from the terminal .
you can use a rag or towel to cover the cable in order to prevent a short .

Steps.Text_raw: You will lose your radio station presets and clock time if you do not use a Memory Saver.  One will NOT be used in this guide. The battery is located on the front driver's side of the vehicle. Begin using your ratchet to loosen and remove the negative (black) cable from the terminal. You can use a rag or towel to cover the cable in order to prevent a short.

Lines.Text: loosen and remove the positive ( red ) cable from the terminal .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen and remove the positive (Red) cable from the terminal.

Lines.Text: remove the cross-bar that holds the battery in place by loosening both bolts .
lift out the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cross-bar that holds the battery in place by loosening both bolts. Lift out the bracket.

Lines.Text: remove the battery by lifting it straight up and out .
avoid tilting the battery in order to prevent an acid spill .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the battery by lifting it straight up and out. Avoid tilting the battery in order to prevent an acid spill.

Lines.Text: replace with a new battery .
secure the battery cover back in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace with a new battery. Secure the battery cover back in place.

Lines.Text: place the cross-bar back in place .
when placing the cross-bar back in , make sure the bars are properly hooked into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the cross-bar back in place. When placing the cross-bar back in, make sure the bars are properly hooked into place.

Lines.Text: repeat the steps in reverse order to properly secure battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat the steps in reverse order to properly secure battery.

Lines.Text: start your car in order to make sure all of your electronic components are working properly .

Steps.Text_raw: Start your car in order to make sure all of your electronic components are working properly.

Title: How to Replace the Dashboard Tweeter in a 2005-2016 Nissan Xterra

Lines.Text: take your flat head screwdriver and gently pry off the plastic grille covering your tweeter .
there are 4 clips holding the grille down , 1 in each corner . be careful not to break them .

Steps.Text_raw: Take your flat head screwdriver and gently pry off the plastic grille covering your tweeter. There are 4 clips holding the grille down, 1 in each corner. Be careful not to break them.

Lines.Text: take your offset screwdriver and unscrew the screws holding down the tweeter bracket .
some models and years have 2 screws , others have 4. remove them all .

Steps.Text_raw: Take your offset screwdriver and unscrew the  screws holding down the tweeter bracket. Some models and years have 2 screws, others have 4. Remove them all.

Lines.Text: gently lift the tweeter bracket with the tweeter inside and locate the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the tweeter bracket with the tweeter inside and locate the connector.

Lines.Text: unbox your new tweeter and place it inside of the bracket that it comes with .
refer to the manual included with the tweeter for this step . bracket installation varies between models .

Steps.Text_raw: Unbox your new tweeter and place it inside of the bracket that it comes with. Refer to the manual included with the tweeter for this step. Bracket installation varies between models.

Lines.Text: disconnect the old tweeter from the car .
make sure to note that the positive wire has a red line on it . this is important .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the old tweeter from the car. Make sure to note that the positive wire has a red line on it. This is important.

Lines.Text: take your new tweeter and plug it in to the same connections as the old one .
make sure that you connect the positive lead to the lead you noted earlier ( red line ) . connecting them incorrectly could result in damage to your tweeter or stereo .

Steps.Text_raw: Take your new tweeter and plug it in to the same connections as the old one. Make sure that you connect the positive lead to the lead you noted earlier (red line). Connecting them incorrectly could result in damage to your tweeter or stereo.

Lines.Text: if your tweeter only has 2 screws , attach a zip tie through the other holes and over the tweeter to help secure it in place .
cut off the excess tie .

Steps.Text_raw: If your tweeter only has 2 screws, attach a zip tie through the other holes and over the tweeter to help secure it in place. Cut off the excess tie.

Lines.Text: take any excess cable and fold it neatly so that it will fit down the hole below the tweeter .

Steps.Text_raw: Take any excess cable and fold it neatly so that it will fit down the hole below the tweeter.

Lines.Text: place the new tweeter and bracket assembly back into the dashboard .
make sure the orientation is how you would like it , and that the holes of the bracket line up with the holes in the dashboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the new tweeter and bracket assembly back into the dashboard. Make sure the orientation is how you would like it, and that the holes of the bracket line up with the holes in the dashboard.

Lines.Text: place the screws from the original tweeter back in their holes and tighten them with the offset screwdriver .
make sure you do not over tighten them ! over tightening can strip the plastic that holds them in place . snug is good .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the screws from the original tweeter back in their holes and tighten them with the offset screw driver. Make sure you do not over tighten them! Over tightening can strip the plastic that holds them in place. Snug is good.

Lines.Text: replace the grille that covers the tweeter .
make sure you install it in the correct orientation . it should snap in easily . installing incorrectly could damage the clips .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the grille that covers the tweeter. Make sure you install it in the correct orientation. It should snap in easily. Installing incorrectly could damage the clips.

Subject: Dashboard Tweeter

Lines.Text: '''open the trunk door . ''' in order to remove the rear light assembly , it must be accessed with the trunk open .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Open the trunk door. ''' In order to remove the rear light assembly, it must be accessed with the trunk open.

Lines.Text: '''remove the three screws '''that are holding the rear light assembly to the body of the jeep . use the wrench to remove the screws .
each screw is an indented hexagon washer head and is 3 /16 in diameter and 3 /4 long .
all three screws are identical and can be removed in any order .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Remove the three screws '''that are holding the rear light assembly to the body of the Jeep. Use the wrench to remove the screws. Each screw is an indented hexagon washer head and is 3/16" in diameter and 3/4" long. All three screws are identical and can be removed in any order.

Lines.Text: '''gently pull the rear light assembly away''' from the car to gain access to the bulbs and wires .
be careful when pulling away the rear light assembly . the wires will still be attached to the inside of the car .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Gently pull the rear light assembly away''' from the car to gain access to the bulbs and wires. Be careful when pulling away the rear light assembly.  The wires will still be attached to the inside of the car.

Lines.Text: '''locate the brake light . '''turn the light assembly over and you will see three light bulb sockets . the brake light is the top bulb and the bulb behind the red plastic lens .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Locate the brake light. '''Turn the light assembly over and you will see three light bulb sockets.  The brake light is the top bulb and the bulb behind the red plastic lens.

Lines.Text: '''remove the brake light . '''twist the light bulb socket clockwise and remove the light bulb socket from the rear light assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Remove the brake light. '''Twist the light bulb socket clockwise and remove the light bulb socket from the rear light assembly.

Lines.Text: '''remove the bulb''' by pinching on either side of the bulb and gently pulling the bulb out .
be careful not to force the bulb when pulling as it may damage the bulb socket .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Remove the bulb''' by pinching on either side of the bulb and gently pulling the bulb out. Be careful not to force the bulb when pulling as it may damage the bulb socket.

Lines.Text: '''replace with the new bulb . '''gently put in the new bulb in the same manner as you removed the old bulb .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Replace with the new bulb. '''Gently put in the new bulb in the same manner as you removed the old bulb.

Lines.Text: '''lock the bulb back in place . '''carefully put the bulb back into the light assembly and twist counter clockwise until it locks in place .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Lock the bulb back in place. '''Carefully put the bulb back into the light assembly and twist counter clockwise until it locks in place.

Lines.Text: '''set the light assembly back in place . ''' there is a tab on the bottom of the light assembly that must line up with the hole in the car .
the red brake light should be on top .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Set the light assembly back in place. ''' There is a tab on the bottom of the light assembly that must line up with the hole in the car. The red brake light should be on top.

Lines.Text: '''tighten the three screws''' back into place . this will fasten the light assembly back onto the car .
the order and the positioning of the screws will have no effect on the assembly , because they are all identical .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Tighten the three screws''' back into place. This will fasten the light assembly back onto the car. The order and the positioning of the screws will have no effect on the assembly, because they are all identical.

Lines.Text: '''check the brake light . ''' have another person step on the brake to ensure proper lighting occurs .

Steps.Text_raw: '''Check the brake light.''' Have another person step on the brake to ensure proper lighting occurs.

Title: How to remove  FHX-720bt head unit in a 1999-2007 Chevrolet Silverado

Lines.Text: locate the hood latch in your vehicle located on the drivers side under the dash to the left of the parking brake pedal .
pull the latch to release hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hood latch in your vehicle located on the drivers side under the dash to the left of the parking brake pedal. Pull the latch to release hood.

Lines.Text: locate the hood release latch in between the grille and hood .
you will find this release latch near the center of the hood in the small gap between the hood and grille .
lift up on the latch then raise the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hood release latch in between the grille and hood. You will find this release latch near the center of the hood in the small gap between the hood and grille. Lift up on the latch then raise the hood.

Lines.Text: locate your battery . it's in the front of the engine compartment , on the drivers side .
remove the negative terminal with 5 /16 socket or by using a 5 /16 wrench .
be careful . do not cross positive and negative wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate your battery. It's in the  front of the engine compartment, on the drivers side. Remove the negative terminal with 5/16" socket or by using a 5/16" wrench. BE CAREFUL. DO NOT CROSS POSITIVE AND NEGATIVE WIRES.

Lines.Text: make sure the vehicle is on a flat surface , then use the parking brake .
shift vehicle into 1 st gear so the shifter will be out of the way for the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vehicle is on a flat surface, then use the parking brake. Shift vehicle into 1st gear so the shifter will be out of the way for the next step.

Lines.Text: firmly grasp the dash trim and pull it towards you .
once it is removed from its clips , pull up and the trim will come out the rest of the way .
set the trim aside ; you are ready for the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grasp the dash trim and pull it towards you. Once it is removed from its clips, pull up and the trim will come out the rest of the way. Set the trim aside; you are ready for the next step.

Lines.Text: remove the face plate from the head unit .
to do this , pull out on both the left and right sides to release the head unit from its clips .
after being released from the clips , set the face plate aside and continue to the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the face plate from the head unit. To do this, pull out on both the left and right sides to release the head unit from its clips. After being released from the clips, set the face plate aside and continue to the next step.

Lines.Text: remove the three bolts on both sides of the unit using the 7 mm socket and ratchet .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three bolts on both sides of the unit using the 7 mm socket  and ratchet.

Lines.Text: now that the bolts are removed ; you can gently pull the head unit out .
you can now access the back of the head unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the bolts are removed; You can gently pull the head unit out. You can now access the back of the head unit.

Lines.Text: this is the back panel of the head unit and assorted wiring connections that you can now access for upgrades , replacements , or fixes .
listed below are the wires coming connected to the head unit . the colors correspond to the same color of the wire .
rca inputs
microphone input/wire
power/audio/assorted control wire harness
antenna input/wire
harness disconnect

Steps.Text_raw: This is the back panel  of the head unit and assorted wiring connections that you can now access for upgrades, replacements, or fixes. Listed below are the wires coming connected to the head unit. The colors correspond to the same color of the wire. RCA inputs Microphone input/wire Power/audio/assorted control wire harness Antenna input/wire Harness disconnect

Title: How to Remove a Car Stereo in a Chevy Tracker

Lines.Text: first , you must disconnect the negative end of the car battery .
you will potentially be shocked if you mishandle the battery . make sure the car is off before inspecting the engine and grabbing the negative connector .
open the hood of your car and locate the battery .
look for the negative end of your battery . it is usually indicated with a minus sign next to it .
disconnecting the negative connection prevents you from receiving any electrical shocks while removing the stereo .

Steps.Text_raw: First, you must disconnect the negative end of the car battery. You will potentially be shocked if you mishandle the battery. Make sure the car is off before inspecting the engine and  grabbing the negative connector. Open the hood of your car and locate the battery. Look for the negative end of your battery. It is usually indicated with a minus sign next to it. Disconnecting the negative connection prevents you from receiving any electrical shocks while removing the stereo.

Lines.Text: use a socket wrench to remove the nut that holds the negative connector in place .
place the negative connector away from the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a socket wrench to remove the nut that holds the negative connector in place. Place the negative connector away from the battery.

Lines.Text: a chevy tracker will have a trim that surrounds the stereo .
the trim is the black plastic that encompasses the stereo and the small tray/compartment .
remove the screw located on the underside of the trim above the car stereo .

Steps.Text_raw: A Chevy Tracker will have a trim that surrounds the stereo. The trim is the black plastic that encompasses the stereo and the small tray/compartment. Remove the screw located on the underside of the trim above the car stereo.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two screws hidden behind the tiny tray/compartment .
afterwards , you can safely remove the trim .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two screws hidden behind the tiny tray/compartment. Afterwards, you can safely remove the trim.

Lines.Text: once the trim is removed , remove the four screws found on each corner of the stereo .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the trim is removed, remove the four screws found on each corner of the stereo.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the stereo .
look behind the stereo to see how it is connected .
the grouped up , different colored collection of wires connect to the speakers , amplifiers , and stereo buttons depending on the color .
the thick , metal wire connects to the car antennae .
don't pull too hard ! there are connections to the radio that we need to unplug .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the stereo. Look behind the stereo to see how it is connected. The grouped up, different colored collection of wires connect to the speakers, amplifiers, and stereo buttons depending on the color. The thick, metal wire connects to the car antennae. Don't pull too hard! There are connections to the radio that we need to unplug.

Lines.Text: unplugging the connections , except for the multicolored group of wires . all are located on the back of stereo should be as simple as pulling on them .
to remove the group of wires , follow the wires until you reach a connector and unplug the connector .
the thick , metal wire connecting to the radio antennae can be easily removed by pulling on it .
the harness ( the grayish female connector circled in red ) is what connects the wires to the various components of the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplugging the connections, except for the multicolored group of wires. All are located on the back of stereo should be as simple as pulling on them. "To remove the group of wires", follow the wires until you reach a connector and unplug the connector. The thick, metal wire connecting to the radio antennae can be easily removed by pulling on it. The harness (the grayish female connector circled in red) is what connects the wires to the various components of the car.

Lines.Text: some car stereos are attached to a mount .
each mount is similarly installed as the image shows .
remove the screws located on each side of the mount .

Steps.Text_raw: Some car stereos are attached to a mount. Each mount is similarly installed as the image shows. Remove the screws located on each side of the mount.

Lines.Text: you have now successfully uninstalled a car stereo from a chevy tracker !
do not forget to reconnect the negative connector to the battery when finished !

Steps.Text_raw: You have now successfully uninstalled a car stereo from a Chevy Tracker! Do not forget to reconnect the negative connector to the battery when finished!

Lines.Text: locate the two gray latches on either side of the hood near the headlights .
pull the latches away from the hood to release the latches .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two gray latches on either side of the hood near the headlights. Pull the latches away from the hood to release the latches.

Lines.Text: reach under the hood and push the lever left to right . you should now be able to lift the hood .
prop open the hood by inserting the support rod into the designated hole on the underside of the hood .

Steps.Text_raw: Reach under the hood and push the lever left to right.  You should now be able to lift the hood. Prop open the hood by inserting the support rod into the designated hole on the underside of the hood.

Lines.Text: locate all six push on fasteners on the top of the grill .
use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the fasteners , and make sure you put the screws somewhere safe .
if the fasteners will not come up , use two flathead screwdrivers on either side of the fastener to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate all six push on fasteners on the top of the grill. Use a flathead screwdriver to pry up the fasteners, and make sure you put the screws somewhere safe. If the fasteners will not come up, use two flathead screwdrivers on either side of the fastener to remove.

Lines.Text: locate right and left blinker lights under the fenders .
twist blinker light toward the ground , and make sure you pull the bulb out carefully .
make sure you are handling bulb carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate right and left blinker lights under the fenders. Twist blinker light toward the ground, and make sure you pull the bulb out carefully. Make sure you are handling bulb carefully.

Lines.Text: make sure all fasteners are removed from top of the grill , and the top of the grill is loose .
firmly pull the bottom of the grill until the grill disconnects from the jeep .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure all fasteners are removed from top of the grill, and the top of the grill is loose. Firmly pull the bottom of the grill until the grill disconnects from the jeep.

Lines.Text: locate the 4 screws holding the headlight in place .
use a star bit screwdriver to unscrew the . 164-18 x . 625 mm star bit screws around the headlight , and make sure you place screws somewhere safe .
hold the headlight when unscrewing last screw to prevent the headlight from falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the 4 screws holding the headlight in place. Use a star bit screwdriver to unscrew the .164-18 x .625 mm star bit screws around the headlight, and make sure you place screws somewhere safe. Hold the headlight when unscrewing last screw to prevent the headlight from falling.

Lines.Text: use your hands to carefully remove silver ring from the headlight .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your hands to carefully remove silver ring from the headlight.

Lines.Text: locate red tab on the headlight plug connector , and push it away from the headlight .
firmly pull the connector away from headlight to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate red tab on the headlight plug connector, and push it away from the headlight. Firmly pull the connector away from headlight to remove.

Title: How to Replace a Tail Light for a 2011-2015 Ford Explorer

Lines.Text: lift and open the rear cargo door .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and open the rear cargo door.

Lines.Text: locate the two plastic screw covers that are adjacent to the rear light covers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two plastic screw covers that are adjacent to the rear light covers.

Lines.Text: using a flathead screwdriver , pry out both plastic screw covers .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a flathead screwdriver, pry out both plastic screw covers.

Lines.Text: once covers are removed , there will be an 8 mm hex head screw located beneath each cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Once covers are removed, there will be an 8 mm hex head screw located beneath each cover.

Lines.Text: using an 8 mm deep socket wrench , remove both of the 20 mm ( length ) hex-head screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using an 8 mm Deep Socket Wrench, remove both of the 20 mm (length) hex-head screws.

Lines.Text: gently pull the tail light cover from the car .
you may have to gently play with the cover by moving it back and forth in order to pry it loose form the car .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the tail light cover from the car. You may have to gently play with the cover by moving it back and forth in order to pry it loose form the car.

Lines.Text: once removed , the bulb sockets will be located on the inside portion of the tail light cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Once removed, the bulb sockets will be located on the inside portion of the tail light cover.

Lines.Text: turn the bulb socket about one quarter turn in a counterclockwise direction .
after it is turned , gently pull and remove the bulb socket from the tail light cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the bulb socket about one quarter turn in a counterclockwise direction. After it is turned, gently pull and remove the bulb socket from the tail light cover.

Lines.Text: gently remove the bulb from the bulb socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the bulb from the bulb socket.

Lines.Text: gently place the new bulb in the bulb socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently place the new bulb in the bulb socket.

Subject: Tail Light Bulbs

Title: How to Replace Battery and Program Keyless Entry Remote for a Mercury Mountaineer  1997-2007

Lines.Text: locate the space to put the screwdriver .
put the screwdriver in this space and pry open the remote .
you do not need to use much force to open it .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the space to put the screwdriver. Put the screwdriver in this space and pry open the remote. You do not need to use much force to open it.

Lines.Text: take the half with the buttons and use your fingernails to take out the button pad .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the half with the buttons and use your fingernails to take out the button pad.

Lines.Text: clean out dirt from remote cover and button pad .
this helps the remote stick once you put it back together .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean out dirt from remote cover and button pad. This helps the remote stick once you put it back together.

Lines.Text: put the screwdriver in between the battery and the remote cover .
push the screwdriver down which will make the battery pop out of the remote cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the screwdriver in between the battery and the remote cover. Push the screwdriver down which will make the battery pop out of the remote cover.

Lines.Text: get your new battery and locate the positive side .
put the positive side facing down towards the cover .
click it into its position .
take the other half of the remote and put the case back together .

Steps.Text_raw: Get your new battery and locate the positive side. Put the positive side facing down towards the cover. Click it into its position. Take the other half of the remote and put the case back together.

Lines.Text: get in your vehicle and make sure all doors are closed .
put the key in the ignition .

Steps.Text_raw: Get in your  vehicle and make sure all doors are closed. Put the key in the ignition.

Lines.Text: these are the positions the key has to be in to be on and off .
this position is on .
this position is off .

Steps.Text_raw: These are the positions the key has to be in to be on and off. This position is on. This position is off.

Lines.Text: turn the car on .
turn the car off .
repeat this eight times .
do not turn on the engine .
stop on the eighth time with the key turning the car on .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the car on. Turn the car off. Repeat this eight times. Do not turn on the engine. Stop on the eighth time with the key turning the car on.

Lines.Text: the car ( not the engine ) should be on for this whole step .
you will then hear the car lock then unlock , telling you that it is time to pair the remote with the vehicle .
then press any button on the remote to pair with the car .
the car should then lock and unlock again to verify that your vehicle and your remote have paired .

Steps.Text_raw: The car (not the engine) should be on for this whole step. You will then hear the car lock then unlock, telling you that it is time to pair the remote with the vehicle. Then press any button on the remote to pair with the car. The car should then lock and unlock again to verify that your vehicle and your remote have paired.

Lines.Text: turn off the car and take it out of the ignition .
click all four buttons to check and see if the remote is paired .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the car and take it out of the ignition. Click all four buttons to check and see if the remote is paired.

Subject: Battery

Title: 2012-2016 Subaru Forester Oil and Oil Filter Replacement

Lines.Text: park your car on a level surface .
make sure to put the car in park ( first gear for manual transmissions ) with the emergency break engaged .
do not change oil within 2 hours of driving the car to allow the oil time to cool .

Steps.Text_raw: Park your car on a level surface. Make sure to put the car in park (first gear for manual transmissions) with the emergency break engaged. Do not change oil within 2 hours of driving the car to allow the oil time to cool.

Lines.Text: place the oil pan under the oil drain plug . ( this is located under the front end of the car )
you may choose to protect the ground with a tarp or piece of cardboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the oil pan under the oil drain plug. (this is located under the front end of the car) You may choose to protect the ground with a tarp or piece of cardboard.

Lines.Text: unscrew the oil drain plug with the 17 mm wrench . this is located under the front of the car in the gap in the bottom panel .
adjust the placement of the oil pan if necessary .
allow the oil to completely drain into the oil pan .
wear clothes that you would not mind getting oil on .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the oil drain plug with the 17mm wrench.  This is located under the front of the car in the gap in the bottom panel. Adjust the placement of the oil pan if necessary. Allow the oil to completely drain into the oil pan. Wear clothes that you would not mind getting oil on.

Lines.Text: after letting the oil drain for 10 minutes unscrew and remove the oil filter . this is located to the right of the engine when the hood is opened .
place the old oil filter in the oil filter disposal bag .

Steps.Text_raw: After letting the oil drain for 10 minutes unscrew and remove the oil filter.  This is located to the right of the engine when the hood is opened. Place the old oil filter in the oil filter disposal bag.

Lines.Text: coat the o-ring of the new filter with oil to ensure a good seal .
screw the new filter into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Coat the o-ring of the new filter with oil to ensure a good seal. Screw the new filter into place.

Lines.Text: when reinstalling the oil drain plug , replace the crush washer ( part 803916010 ) .
tighten the oil drain plug to 32 ft/lbs of torque .

Steps.Text_raw: When reinstalling the oil drain plug, replace the crush washer (part# 803916010) . Tighten the oil drain plug to 32 ft/lbs of torque.

Lines.Text: unscrew cap for engine oil . this is located directly to the left of the oil filter .
place a clean funnel in the tube .
slowly fill with the 5.1 quarts of engine oil .
screw the engine oil cap back on .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew cap for engine oil.  This is located directly to the left of the oil filter. Place a clean funnel in the tube. Slowly fill with the 5.1 quarts of engine oil. Screw the engine oil cap back on.

Lines.Text: pour the oil from the pan into the empty milk jug .
your local waste disposal company will recycle this for you .

Steps.Text_raw: Pour the oil from the pan into the empty milk jug. Your local waste disposal company will recycle this for you.

Lines.Text: allow the car to run for 10 minutes in idle .
check the oil level with the dipstick . this is located to the right of the engine when the hood is opened .
check under the car for any dripping liquids .
you have completed an oil and filter change on your 2015 subaru forester .

Steps.Text_raw: Allow the car to run for 10 minutes in idle. Check the oil level with the dipstick.  This is located to the right of the engine when the hood is opened. Check under the car for any dripping liquids. You have completed an oil and filter change on your 2015 Subaru Forester.

Subject: Oil and Oil Filter

Title: 2013 Subaru Impreza WRX Mud Flaps Replacement

Lines.Text: always make sure your car is off , the parking break is applied , and you are in a safe area free from other passing cars .

Steps.Text_raw: Always make sure your car is off, the parking break is applied, and you are in a safe area free from other passing cars.

Lines.Text: turn the wheels all the way towards the side you will be working on .
this will create easier access to the inside of the wheel well when you are replacing the mud flap .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the wheels all the way towards the side you will be working on. This will create easier access to the inside of the wheel well when you are replacing the mud flap.

Lines.Text: start with the front mud flaps .
attach the 7 /16th size socket piece to the wrench and begin removing the 7 /16th diameter nuts .

Steps.Text_raw: Start with the front mud flaps. Attach the 7/16th size socket piece to the wrench and begin removing the 7/16th diameter nuts.

Lines.Text: use your phillips head screwdriver to unscrew the farthest 6 3 /4 stainless phillips screw .
be careful not to loose the rubber gasket attached to the screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your Philips Head screwdriver to unscrew the farthest #6 3/4" Stainless Philips Screw. Be careful not to loose the rubber gasket attached to the screw.

Lines.Text: once the old mud flap is removed , grab your new mud flap and reattach it in the same manner as how you removed the old or broken one .
repeat for opposite front mud flap .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the old mud flap is removed, grab your new mud flap and reattach it in the same manner as how you removed the old or broken one. Repeat for opposite front mud flap.

Lines.Text: for the back two mud flaps you will need to use a slightly different technique due to the limited space you will be working in .
use your hands and the 10 mm wrench piece to unbolt the mud flap .
once you have removed the nuts , you can move on to the 6 3 /4 phillips head screw .
this step will be aided by the use of an extra small phillips screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: For the back two mud flaps you will need to use a slightly different technique due to the limited space you will be working in. Use your hands and the 10mm wrench piece to unbolt the mud flap. Once you have removed the nuts, you can move on to the #6 3/4" Philips Head Screw. This step will be aided by the use of an extra small Philips screwdriver.

Lines.Text: replace both back mud flaps and fasten all pieces back in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace both back mud flaps and fasten all pieces back in place.

Lines.Text: make sure the mud flaps are all properly tightened and positioned before driving your car again .
enjoy your brand new mud flaps .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the mud flaps are all properly tightened and positioned before driving your car again. Enjoy your brand new mud flaps.

Subject: Mud Flaps

Lines.Text: apply putty knife to edge of cover until it pops open
remove screws off of broken cup holder
take cup holder out

Steps.Text_raw: Apply putty knife to edge of cover until it pops open Remove screws off of broken cup holder Take cup holder out

Lines.Text: remove plastic cover on cup holder by pulling apart where the lips meet
locate spring in device

Steps.Text_raw: Remove plastic cover on cup holder by pulling apart where the lips meet Locate spring in device

Lines.Text: fully take apart the cup holder to get to the inside of the cup holder
locate where spring is placed

Steps.Text_raw: Fully take apart the cup holder to get to the inside of the cup holder Locate where spring is placed

Lines.Text: locate where the spring connects
if hole is not broken then just apply spring into hole
if the hole broke , like in this case here , then drill a hole the size of the spring around the same spot of the other hole
caution : be careful drilling the hole , the plastic is slippery when in contact with drill bit

Steps.Text_raw: Locate where the spring connects If hole is not broken then just apply spring into hole If the hole broke, like in this case here, then drill a hole the size of the spring around the same spot of the other hole Caution: Be careful drilling the hole, the plastic is slippery when in contact with drill bit

Lines.Text: test to make sure spring is properly working
reassemble the cup holder

Steps.Text_raw: Test to make sure spring is properly working Reassemble the cup holder

Lines.Text: put cup holder back in place
screw in screws

Steps.Text_raw: Put cup holder back in place Screw in screws

Lines.Text: check to make sure cup holder works
start to put on cover by lining up holes

Steps.Text_raw: Check to make sure cup holder works Start to put on cover by lining up holes

Lines.Text: press firmly on cover all around until it is fully on

Steps.Text_raw: Press firmly on cover all around until it is fully on

Lines.Text: enjoy your fixed cup holder !

Steps.Text_raw: Enjoy your fixed cup holder!

Lines.Text: wipe the surface of the tire with a rag to remove any loose dirt , rocks , or debris .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe the surface of the tire with a rag to remove any loose dirt, rocks, or debris.

Lines.Text: using the air compressor , air the tire up to the original recommended weight for the vehicle .
air is expected to continue to leak out so do not worry if you cannot get it perfect .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the air compressor, air the tire up to the original recommended weight for the vehicle. Air is expected to continue to leak out so do not worry if you cannot get it perfect.

Lines.Text: use the air pressure gauge to make sure the tire is now aired up to its original pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the air pressure gauge to make sure the tire is now aired up to its original pressure.

Lines.Text: spray the surface of the tire completely with the soapy water .

Steps.Text_raw: Spray the surface of the tire completely with the soapy water.

Lines.Text: look for tiny air bubbles forming from the leaking air and soap combination , this is where the hole is located .

Steps.Text_raw: Look for tiny air bubbles forming from the leaking air and soap combination, this is where the hole is located.

Lines.Text: once the hole is located , remove any foreign objects with the pliers if present .
any object that is stuck in the tire , or puncturing the tire is considered a foreign object . these may include sharp objects , commonly seen as nails , screws , or pieces of metal .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the hole is located, remove any foreign objects with the pliers if present. Any object that is stuck in the tire, or puncturing the tire is considered a foreign object. These may include sharp objects, commonly seen as nails, screws, or pieces of metal.

Lines.Text: insert the reamer into the puncture .
work the reamer in and out while twisting to clean and prep the puncture .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the reamer into the puncture. Work the reamer in and out while twisting to clean and prep the puncture.

Lines.Text: put the plug into the insertion tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the plug into the insertion tool.

Lines.Text: insert the plug into the punctured area , leaving about ¼ inch of the plug above the surface of the tire .
yank the insertion tool so the plug remains in the tire , but the tool releases .
cut the remaining plug so it is flush with the tire .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plug into the punctured area, leaving about ¼ inch of the plug above the surface of the tire. Yank the insertion tool so the plug remains in the tire, but the tool releases. Cut the remaining plug so it is flush with the tire.

Lines.Text: refill the tire to the proper pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Refill the tire to the proper pressure.

Lines.Text: use the air pressure gauge to make sure that the tire is back to its original air pressure .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the air pressure gauge to make sure that the tire is back to its original air pressure.

Title: How to Clean an Electric Valve for Air Horns

Lines.Text: use the socket wrench to rotate the valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the socket wrench to rotate the valve.

Lines.Text: unscrew the fixing nut using the wrench .
don't lose the pieces : put them in order in a safe place . a good example is a white sheet of paper .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the fixing nut using the wrench. Don't lose the pieces:  put them in order in a safe place. A good example is a white sheet of paper.

Lines.Text: remove the solenoid ( the black plastic box ) .
carefully unscrew the head of the valve : it could be hard to remove due to the threadlocker .
use the rib jonit plier and apply a counterclockwise rotation on it .
finish the unscrewing by hand .
don't lose the head : put it , again , in a safe place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the solenoid (the black plastic box). Carefully unscrew the head of the valve: it could be hard to remove due to the threadlocker. Use the Rib Jonit plier and apply a counterclockwise rotation on it. Finish the unscrewing by hand. Don't lose the head: put it, again, in a safe place.

Lines.Text: gently tilt the whole thing and the spring and piston should exit the valve .
inspect them for cleanliness and put them in a safe place .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently tilt the whole thing and the spring and piston should exit the valve. Inspect them for cleanliness and put them in a safe place.

Lines.Text: blow in the valve with compressed air to clean it
blow on the piston and other pieces , if dirty , as well .

Steps.Text_raw: Blow in the valve with compressed air to clean it Blow on the piston and other pieces, if dirty, as well.

Lines.Text: place the piston , first .
then put the spring in the piston's hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the piston, first. Then put the spring in the piston's hole.

Lines.Text: put some threadlocker on the thread
'''don't exceed : ''' you may permanently damage the device !
screw the head on the valve .
use the plier to tighten valve's head : there's no need to tighten it too much .

Steps.Text_raw: Put some threadlocker on the thread '''Don't exceed:''' you may permanently damage the device! Screw the head on the valve. Use the plier to tighten valve's head: there's no need to tighten it too much.

Lines.Text: insert the solenoid and put the washer on the top .
finally , screw the nut with the wrench .
set the valve back in blace , using the wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the solenoid and put the washer on the top. Finally, screw the nut with the wrench. Set the valve back in blace, using the wrench.

Lines.Text: first the truck should be prepared to be worked on .
disconnect the negative battery terminal from the battery in order to be sure that no electrical current is running through the truck .
set the parking break and put the truck in 1 st gear .
be sure to chock the wheels , so that it will not roll while you are underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: First the truck should be prepared to be worked on. Disconnect the negative battery terminal from the battery in order to be sure that no electrical current is running through the truck. Set the parking break and put the truck in 1st gear. Be sure to chock the wheels, so that it will not roll while you are underneath.

Lines.Text: locate the idler arm .
it can be found underneath the vehicle , next to the front passenger tire bolted onto the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the idler arm. It can be found underneath the vehicle, next to the front passenger tire bolted onto the frame.

Lines.Text: the first step is to remove the set nut holding the arm to the relay rod .
begin with cleaning any oil and dirt from the set nut and then spray with the penetrating lubricant .
once the spray has sat for 5 minutes , use needle nose pliers to straighten the cotter pin and pull it out .
during reassembly , never reuse a cotter pin . a new one should be included in a new arm . if a new arm is not purchased then one can be purchased from an auto parts store .
remove the set nut using a 19 mm socket .
when installing the arm this nut should be torqued to 43 ft . -lb .

Steps.Text_raw: The first step is to remove the set nut holding the arm to the relay rod. Begin with cleaning any oil and dirt from the set nut and then spray with the penetrating lubricant. Once the spray has sat for 5 minutes, use needle nose pliers to straighten the cotter pin and pull it out. During reassembly, never reuse a cotter pin. A new one should be included in a new arm. If a new arm is not purchased then one can be purchased from an auto parts store. Remove the set nut using a 19 mm socket. When  installing the arm this nut should be torqued to 43 ft.-lb.

Lines.Text: now that the relay rods are disconnected , the arm can be unbolted from the frame .
spray both the bolts and the nuts with the penetrating lubricant .
on the bolt head use the breaker bar and 17 mm socket ; put the 17 mm box wrench on the nut on the back side of the arm .
the wrench will get stuck on the frame and the breaker bar can then be used to break the rust off the bolt holding it onto the frame .
once the bolt is loose a socket wrench can replace the breaker bar to make the job easier .
the ( 2 ) 4 1 /4 bolts go on either side of the arm . the ( 1 ) 3 1 /2 bolt goes at the top .
all three bolts should be torqued to 70 ft-lb when putting the arm back on .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the relay rods are disconnected, the arm can be unbolted from the frame. Spray both the bolts and the nuts with the penetrating lubricant. On the bolt head use the breaker bar and 17 mm socket; put the 17 mm box wrench on the nut on the back side of the arm. The wrench will get stuck on the frame and the breaker bar can then be used to break the rust off the bolt holding it onto the frame. Once the bolt is loose a socket wrench can replace the breaker bar to make the job easier. The (2) 4 1/4"  bolts go on either side of the arm. The (1) 3 1/2" bolt goes at the top. All three bolts should be torqued to 70 ft-lb when putting the arm back on.

Lines.Text: to separate the arm from the relay rods , a hammer may be used to gently tap up on the idler arm .
do not hit down on the relay rods ; doing so may cause damage and require them to be replaced .
a pitman arm puller can be used if the hammer is not able to knock it loose .
the idler arm can now be removed from the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: To separate the arm from the relay rods, a hammer may be used to gently tap up on the idler arm. Do not hit down on the relay rods; doing so may cause damage and require them to be replaced. A pitman arm puller can be used if the hammer is not able to knock it loose. The idler arm can now be removed from the frame.

Lines.Text: first the idler arm must be removed from the truck . another guide has instructions to take the arm off .

Steps.Text_raw: First the Idler arm must be removed from the truck. Another guide has instructions to [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/1984-1989+Toyota+4Runner+Idler+Arm+Replacement/53763| take the arm off.]

Lines.Text: place the arm in a vise .
spray the cap with penetrating lubricant .
using a screwdriver , tap the idler arm bracket cap off .
if it will not come off easily , then check out the shooting page .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the arm in a vise. Spray the cap with penetrating lubricant. Using a screw driver, tap the idler arm bracket cap off. If it will not come off easily, then check out the [https://www.ifixit.com/Wiki/1984-1989_Toyota_4Runner_Troubleshooting|trouble shooting page.]

Lines.Text: using a 19 mm socket , take the nut off from inside the idler arm bracket .
if the arm rotates in the bracket , then it can be taken out of the vice and placed on the ground .
once on the ground , your foot can be used to stop the arm from rotating and enable you to put torque on the nut .
once the nut is off , the arm can be gently tapped out of the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a 19 mm socket, take the nut off from inside the idler arm bracket. If the arm rotates in the bracket, then it can be taken out of the vice and placed on the ground. Once on the ground, your foot can be used to stop the arm from rotating and enable you to put torque on the nut. Once the nut is off, the arm can be gently tapped out of the bracket.

Lines.Text: remove the oil seal .
remove the plastic bushings with a flat head .
both bushings and oil seals should be removed and replaced .
fill the bracket with mp grease and then put the arm back into the bracket .
wipe off any grease that squeezes out of the bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the oil seal. Remove the plastic bushings with a flat head. Both bushings and oil seals should be removed and replaced. Fill the bracket with MP grease and then put the arm back into the bracket. Wipe off any grease that squeezes out of the bracket.

Title: How to Activate 12 V Aux Power in a 2007-2014 Chevrolet Suburban

Lines.Text: locate the wiring harness bundle , which exits the firewall underneath the brake booster .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the wiring harness bundle, which exits the firewall underneath the brake booster.

Lines.Text: identify the auxiliary wire , which is folded and taped to either the wiring harness or the fire wall .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the auxiliary wire, which is folded and taped to either the wiring harness or the fire wall.

Lines.Text: use a knife to cut the tape away from the wire and unravel it .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a knife to cut the tape away from the wire and unravel it.

Lines.Text: run the wire against the battery box .

Steps.Text_raw: Run the wire against the battery box.

Lines.Text: place the ring terminal ( washer end ) of the wire on the right post located at the front of the battery .
place the 10 mm washer on the post .
tighten the washer using a 10 mm wrench , crescent wrench , or pliers .
post size and location may vary slightly in different models . the washer will fit snuggly around the correct post .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the ring terminal (washer end) of the wire on the right post located at the front of the battery. Place the 10 mm washer on the post. Tighten the washer using a 10 mm wrench, crescent wrench, or pliers. Post size and location may vary slightly in different models. The washer will fit snuggly around the correct post.

Lines.Text: after hooking up the wire , check to make sure the 40 amp fuse is installed for the auxiliary pin .
if the fuse is not installed , there will be an empty space . this fuse can be purchased at any automotive shop .

Steps.Text_raw: After hooking up the wire, check to make sure the 40 amp fuse is installed for the auxiliary pin. If the fuse is not installed, there will be an empty space. This fuse can be purchased at any automotive shop.

Title: 2002-2007 Jeep Liberty fuel pipes on tank Replacement

Lines.Text: there are 2 rivets in each corner that need to be drilled out .
once the head of the rivet is drilled off , you will likely end up with the rest of the rivet sticking out the floor . just take a punch and knock them out ,
you only need to remove the rear most 2 to be able to pull the carpet back far enough to gain access , although i did end up removing 3 corners .

Steps.Text_raw: there are 2 rivets in each corner that need to be drilled out. Once the head of the rivet is drilled off, you will likely end up with the rest of the rivet sticking out the floor. Just take a punch and knock them out, You only need to remove the rear most 2 to be able to pull the carpet back far enough to gain access, although I did end up removing 3 corners.

Lines.Text: the is a 10 mm head nut in each corner of the panel under all that sealant . so the first job is to chip it away by whatever means possible . i used a hammer and chisel .
once the nuts are removed , you then need to chip away all the sealant around the panel itself . it takes a while !

Steps.Text_raw: The is a 10mm head nut in each corner of the panel under all that sealant. So the first job is to chip it away by whatever means possible. I used a hammer and chisel. Once the nuts are removed, you then need to chip away all the sealant around the panel itself. It takes a while!

Lines.Text: with the access panel now removed , you're ready to start removing and replacing the pipes . i started with the outlet which is the bigger of the 2 and the one closest to the rear of the vehicle . just press both sides of the quick connect coupling in simultaneously and pull it off . then go underneath and remove it from there .

Steps.Text_raw: with the access panel now removed, you're ready to start removing and replacing the pipes. I started with the outlet which is the bigger of the 2 and the one closest to the rear of the vehicle. Just press both sides of the quick connect coupling in simultaneously and pull it off. Then go underneath and remove it from there.

Lines.Text: grab your new hose and slide it onto the connector on the tank first . be careful when pushing it on as the elbows on the tank are plastic . if you break them off , you're gonna have a bad day ! the size of hose you need for the outlet is 8 mm id ( inside diameter ) before sliding it onto the tank , be sure to put your new clamp on first !

tighten the clamp up but be careful . you want it to be tight , but bear in mind the elbow is plastic and could easily break . once that's done , head underneath , cut your hose to size , put another clamp on and tighten up . this end is going onto a metal pipe , so tighten it up good .

once you've done that , it's just a case of repeating the process for the return pipe . whilst not strictly necessary to replace both , for all the time it will take , i did it anyway . the only difference for the return pipe , is that you will need 7 mm id pipe .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab your new hose and slide it onto the connector on the tank first. Be careful when pushing it on as the elbows on the tank are plastic. If you break them off, you're gonna have a bad day! The size of hose you need for the outlet is 8mm id (inside diameter) before sliding it onto the tank, be sure to put your new clamp on first! tighten the clamp up but be careful. You want it to be tight, but bear in mind the elbow is plastic and could easily break. Once that's done, head underneath, cut your hose to size, put another clamp on and tighten up. This end is going onto a metal pipe, so tighten it up good. Once you've done that, it's just a case of repeating the process for the return pipe.  Whilst not strictly necessary to replace both, for all the time it will take, I did it anyway. The only difference for the return pipe, is that you will need 7mm id pipe.

Subject: fuel pipes on tank

Title: 2004 - 2008 Acura TSX (CL9) Windshield wiper insert Replacement

Lines.Text: the wiper blade is the entire assembly attached to the wiper arm ( 30 , 31 in the illustration ) . though many feel you should just replace this , the oem acura icon-style blades have replaceable inserts ( blade , rubber according to the parts guide ) that are easily and economically replaced . anyone can do it , no special skills or tools are required .
the parts blade , rubber are identified as 21 and 23 in the parts illustration .

Steps.Text_raw: The wiper blade is the entire assembly attached to the wiper arm (#30, #31 in the illustration). Though many feel you should just replace this, the OEM Acura ICON-style blades have replaceable inserts ("Blade, Rubber" according to the parts guide) that are easily and economically replaced. Anyone can do it, no special skills or tools are required. The parts "Blade, rubber" are identified as #21 and #23 in the parts illustration.

Lines.Text: the first thing the manual tells you is to lift both arms , and remove the wipers . like a lot of wipers , this is locked onto the arm by sliding the wiper assembly from the base of the arm into a crooked end , where it snaps in place . depress the spring tab towards the wiper arm , and gently slide the wiper down towards the base of the wiper arm .

instead of leaving the wiper arm up where a bump or unforeseen factor could slam it down on the window glass , wrap the end in a soft towel or rag , and let the arm down gently . there . isn't that better ?

Steps.Text_raw: The first thing the manual tells you is to lift both arms, and remove the wipers. Like a lot of wipers, this is "locked" onto the arm by sliding the wiper assembly from the base of the arm into a crooked end, where it snaps in place. Depress the spring tab towards the wiper arm, and gently slide the wiper down towards the base of the wiper arm. Instead of leaving the wiper arm up where a bump or unforeseen factor could slam it down on the window glass, wrap the end in a soft towel or rag, and let the arm down gently. There. Isn't that better?

Lines.Text: now you're ready to get to work . no doubt you've examined your new blades inserts , and see that there are two ends marked , tip and lock . note the difference .

the blade inserts have a groove or slot running the length that will take the metal or plastic reinforcement splines . ( your replacement inserts probably did not come with new splines . you'll reuse the ones in your current blades . )
below this groove is another slot which runs all the way through on one end , and on the other has a little ramp leading to a separate pocket . this is the lock feature of the wiper blade .

since you haven't removed your old blade insert , you can't see what that second slot mates with . along the interior length of the wiper blade is a series of brackets which this slot slides through . the separate pocket on the lock end stops on the teeth of the last bracket on either end of the wiper assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Now you're ready to get to work. No doubt you've examined your NEW blades inserts, and see that there are two ends marked, "TIP" and "LOCK." Note the difference. The blade inserts have a groove or slot running the length that will take the metal or plastic reinforcement splines. (Your replacement inserts probably did not come with new splines. You'll reuse the ones in your current blades.) Below this groove is another slot which runs all the way through on one end, and on the other has a little ramp leading to a separate pocket. This is the "lock" feature of the wiper blade. Since you haven't removed your old blade insert, you can't see what that second slot mates with. Along the interior length of the wiper blade is a series of brackets which this slot slides through. The separate pocket on the "LOCK" end stops on the teeth of the last bracket on either end of the wiper assembly.

Lines.Text: start with the passenger side blade , which is 400 mm . it's a little easier working with a shorter wiper blade before tackling the 650 mm driver side blade .

removing a used blade can be difficult as it has no doubt lost its slipperiness . you could spray some armorall cleaner in there , but unless your wiper assembly is really dirty , you oughtn't need to .
find the end of the blade where the insert is marked lock . this is the end you'll remove it from .
trying to slide the insert out from the tip end will be frustrating , and potentially damage the brackets of the wiper blade !
the manual describes you peeling down the flexible end of the wiper blade , but doing so carelessly could rip it .

instead , use an orangewood cuticle pushing stick ( you can find them in most big box stores , in the beauty section with other nail care items ) , or an ifixit spudger and work it underneath the end of the blade insert on the lock side , so that you can grab it .
now , gently tug on the insert until you can feel the lock give against the bracket . the insert should now slide out over the flexible end of the wiper blade .

Steps.Text_raw: Start with the passenger side blade, which is 400mm. It's a little easier working with a shorter wiper blade before tackling the 650mm driver side blade. Removing a used blade can be difficult as it has no doubt lost its slipperiness. You could spray some ArmorAll cleaner in there, but unless your wiper assembly is really dirty, you oughtn't need to. Find the end of the blade where the insert is marked "LOCK." This is the end you'll remove it from. Trying to slide the insert out from the "TIP" end will be frustrating, and potentially damage the brackets of the wiper blade! The manual describes you peeling down the flexible end of the wiper blade, but doing so carelessly could rip it. Instead, use an orangewood “cuticle pushing stick” (you can find them in most “big box” stores, in the Beauty section with other nail care items), or an IFixit Spudger and work it underneath the end of the blade insert on the "LOCK" side, so that you can grab it. Now, gently tug on the insert until you can feel the lock "give" against the bracket. The insert should now slide out over the flexible end of the wiper blade.

Lines.Text: the insert should now slide out smoothly . do not try to lift it out , but gently slide it out from the end of the blade .

as you slide it out , you will see the splines ( one on each side ) coming free . try to keep those in the insert until it's about 50 removed . you can then slide them out -- carefully ! -- and set them aside .
try not to drop the splines or otherwise damage them . they are not sold separately .

since you have the blade insert fully removed , now's a good time to clean the wiper blades , inside and out . i like using a small interior detailing brush in the slot and brackets , but an old ''soft'' toothbrush will suffice .

Steps.Text_raw: The insert should now slide out smoothly. Do not try to lift it out, but gently slide it out from the end of the blade. As you slide it out, you will see the splines (one on each side) coming free. Try to keep those in the insert until it's about 50% removed. You can then slide them out -- carefully! -- and set them aside. Try not to drop the splines or otherwise damage them. They are not sold separately. Since you have the blade insert fully removed, now's a good time to clean the wiper blades, inside and out. I like using a small interior detailing brush in the slot and brackets, but an old ''soft'' toothbrush will suffice.

Lines.Text: insert the splines into the new insert . you may find use of a gentle clip to hold them in place will help .
i slide the spline all the way to the end of the groove at the tip end of the insert . this gives the insert some rigidity ( stop giggling , boys ) for initial insertion into the blade's brackets .

insert the insert with splines into the blade groove , starting with the tip end of the insert . slide it into the soft edge end of the blade . gently work the insert into the blade and move/remove the clips as you proceed .

i find that this is easiest way to do this is with the blade held vertically , sliding the insert in ''upwards '' while hanging down to the ground . this keeps the splines hanging down with the insert , but the clips are really helpful to keep the splines from just falling or sliding out of the insert .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the splines into the new insert. You may find use of a gentle clip to hold them in place will help. I slide the spline all the way to the end of the groove at the "Tip" end of the insert. This gives the insert some rigidity (stop giggling, boys) for initial insertion into the blade's brackets. Insert the insert with splines into the blade groove, starting with the "Tip" end of the insert. Slide it into  the "soft edge" end of the blade. Gently work the insert into the blade and move/remove the clips as you proceed. I find that this is easiest way to do this is with the blade held vertically, sliding the insert in ''upwards '' while hanging down to the ground. This keeps the splines hanging down with the insert, but the clips are really helpful to keep the splines from just falling or sliding out of the insert.

Lines.Text: when you get to the end of the insert , the lock portion of that groove will resist against the last bracket . gently push against this until you feel it lock .

examine the whole wiper blade . the insert should be locked into each of the brackets , without skipping any . the outer lip of the insert should be flush against the brackets , covering them from view .
at this point , the soft edge of the blade should swallow up the insert , or you can help it out with your '''spudger''' . you're wiper blade is ready to be installed ; set it aside for now .
you're finished - with one blade . now repeat with the other blade .

Steps.Text_raw: When you get to the end of the insert, the "lock" portion of that groove will resist against the last bracket. Gently push against this until you feel it lock. Examine the whole wiper blade. The insert should be locked into each of the brackets, without skipping any. The outer lip of the insert should be flush against the  brackets, covering them from view. At this point, the soft edge of the blade should "swallow up" the insert, or you can help it out with your '''spudger'''. You're wiper blade is ready to be installed; set it aside for now. You're finished - with one blade.  Now repeat with the other blade.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the wiper arms from the windshield and snap the blades into the u end of the arms . if you cleaned these snap fittings earlier , they will go on quite effortlessly .

the shorter 400 mm passenger side blade goes on the passenger side of the car , and the 650 mm driver side blade goes on the driver's side . just reminding you in case you lost track in all of the excitement .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the wiper arms from the windshield and snap the blades into the "U" end of the arms. If you cleaned these snap fittings earlier, they will go on quite effortlessly. The shorter 400mm passenger side blade goes on the passenger side of the car, and the 650mm driver side blade goes on the driver's side. Just reminding you in case you lost track in all of the excitement.

Subject: Windshield wiper insert

Title: 2008 Subaru Impreza Windshield Wiper Arm Adjustment

Lines.Text: to begin , pop open your hood for best access .

Steps.Text_raw: To begin, pop open your hood for best access.

Lines.Text: there will be a rectangular bolt cover on the end of the wiper arm .
to remove this cover , grab each side with your fingers and pull upward .
it may help to wedge your fingernails underneath the cover piece .

Steps.Text_raw: There will be a rectangular bolt cover on the end of the wiper arm. To remove this cover, grab each side with your fingers and pull upward. It may help to wedge your fingernails underneath the cover piece.

Lines.Text: after removing the bolt cover , you will find the bolt that holds the wiper arm onto the vehicle .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the bolt cover, you will find the bolt that holds the wiper arm onto the vehicle.

Lines.Text: loosen the bolt with the socket wrench just enough to be able to move the arm up and down the windshield .
to loosen with the wrench , place the socket directly on top of the bolt and turn counter clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the bolt with the socket wrench just enough to be able to move the arm up and down the windshield. To loosen with the wrench, place the socket directly on top of the bolt and turn counter clockwise.

Lines.Text: adjust the windshield wiper arm such that it is in the proper resting position .

Steps.Text_raw: Adjust the windshield wiper arm such that it is in the proper resting position.

Lines.Text: there should be approximately 2 inches of space between the bottom of the windshield and the wiper in proper resting position .

Steps.Text_raw: There should be approximately 2 inches of space between the bottom of the windshield and the wiper in proper resting position.

Lines.Text: once the arm is in correct position , tighten the same bolt at the bottom of the arm to keep the wiper in place .
to tighten the bolt , place the socket directly on top of the bolt and turn in clockwise position until you are no longer able to turn .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the arm is in correct position, tighten the same bolt at the bottom of the arm to keep the wiper in place. To tighten the bolt, place the socket directly on top of the bolt and turn in clockwise position until you are no longer able to turn.

Lines.Text: place the bolt cover back over the bolt and push it down into clipped position .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the bolt cover back over the bolt and push it down into clipped position.

Lines.Text: close the hood of the vehicle . your windshield wiper should now be in the correct position .

Steps.Text_raw: Close the hood of the vehicle. Your windshield wiper should now be in the correct position.

Title: Ford Focus Door Handle Bracket Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the screw cover in the handle housing using a flathead screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw cover in the handle housing using a flathead screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the screw that is holding the handle housing with a t20 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw that is holding the handle housing with a T20 Torx screwdriver.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the handle housing off .
do not pull too hard . there are wires attached to the back of the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the handle housing off. Do not pull too hard. There are wires attached to the back of the housing.

Lines.Text: detach the wires on the handle housing with a flathead screwdriver by pushing upwards on the release slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the wires on the handle housing with a flathead screwdriver by pushing upwards on the release slot.

Lines.Text: remove the cover on the door grip by prying gently with a flathead screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cover on the door grip by prying gently with a flathead screwdriver.

Lines.Text: take off the inside door panel by removing all screws with a t20 torx screwdriver .
there are nine screws in total : two on the front , three on the outer side , two on bottom , and two on the inner side .

Steps.Text_raw: Take off the inside door panel by removing all screws with a T20 Torx screwdriver. There are nine screws in total: two on the front, three on the outer side, two on bottom, and two on the inner side.

Lines.Text: pull the insulation back to access the door handle bracket .
use an x-acto knife if needed .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the insulation back to access the door handle bracket. Use an X-acto knife if needed.

Lines.Text: remove the two screws holding the handle bracket with a t20 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two screws holding  the handle bracket with a T20 Torx screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the outside door handle by prying gently with a flathead screwdriver to loosen , and then slide it back .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the outside door handle by prying gently with a flathead screwdriver to loosen, and then slide it back.

Lines.Text: detach the door latch rod from the handle bracket by pulling the plastic end out of the metal loop .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach the door latch rod from the handle bracket by pulling the plastic end out of the metal loop.

Lines.Text: pull the locking rod free from the handle bracket and remove the broken handle bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the locking rod free from the handle bracket and remove the broken handle bracket.

Subject: Handle Bracket

Lines.Text: remove cap and squeeze metal brackets revealed underneath to loosen and remove from interior of car .
make a note of where the clips of the lever arm fit into the interior of car for reinstatement of the visor later .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove cap and squeeze metal brackets revealed underneath to loosen and  remove from interior of car. Make a note of where the clips of the lever arm fit into the interior of car for reinstatement of the visor later.

Lines.Text: tear open the seam surrounding the hole that the swing arm inserts into with a seam ripper .
pull the fabric back to show the inner casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Tear open the seam surrounding the hole that the swing arm inserts into with a  seam ripper. Pull the fabric back to show the inner casing.

Lines.Text: reinsert the swing arm back into the visor , make sure the metal prongs on the swing arm line up with the holes on the visor .
the red squares show where the metal prongs fit into the holes of the visor .

Steps.Text_raw: Reinsert the swing arm back into the visor, make sure the metal prongs on the swing arm line up with the holes on the visor. The red squares show where the metal prongs fit into the holes of the visor.

Lines.Text: fold the aluminum plate around the outer casing to reinforce the arm in the casing .
the metal plate will hold both halves of the visor to the lever arm , so make sure it is secured tightly around visor to keep it together .

Steps.Text_raw: Fold the aluminum plate around the outer casing to reinforce the arm in the casing. The metal plate will hold both halves of the visor to the lever arm, so make sure it is secured tightly around visor to  keep it together.

Lines.Text: screw a one inch screw through the metal plate and plastic casing using a phillips head screwdriver .
make sure screw goes all the way through to the other side to effectively secure plate to visor .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw a one inch screw through the metal plate and plastic casing using a phillips head screwdriver. Make sure screw goes all the way through to the other side to effectively secure plate to visor.

Lines.Text: adhere the two halves of the torn seam back together over the outer casing and the aluminum plate using upholstery glue .
allow the glue to properly dry before replacing visor back into car .

Steps.Text_raw: Adhere the two halves of the torn seam back together over the outer casing and the aluminum plate​ using upholstery glue. Allow the glue to properly dry before replacing visor back into car.

Lines.Text: realign the metal clips of the swing arm to the hole in the car and snap the visor back into place .
if you go back to step one , the hinges are marked to show where the insert the swing arm .

Steps.Text_raw: Realign the metal clips of the swing arm to the hole in the car and snap the visor back into place. If you go back to step one, the hinges are marked to show where the insert the swing arm.

Title: 2001 Volkswagen Passat Key Fob Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: press the release button on the key fob so that key is extended .
locate the small indentation in the middle of the key fob .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the release button on the key fob so that key is extended. Locate the small indentation in the middle of the key fob.

Lines.Text: place a screwdriver in the indentation of the key fob .
apply pressure and rotate the screwdriver until key fob begins to separate .
using light force , pull the key fob apart .
remove the cover on lower part of the key fob and locate the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Place a screwdriver in the indentation of the key fob. Apply pressure and rotate the screwdriver until key fob begins to separate. Using light force, pull the key fob apart. Remove the cover on lower part of the key fob and locate the battery.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver to remove the battery .
place a new battery in the key fob and press down gently to secure it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver to remove the battery. Place a new battery in the key fob and press down gently to secure it in place.

Lines.Text: pick up the pieces of the key fob and begin to slide the pieces together .
this needs to be done slowly to not break the plastic on the fob .

Steps.Text_raw: Pick up the pieces of the key fob and begin to slide the pieces together. This needs to be done slowly to not break the plastic on the fob.

Lines.Text: press the key release button to make sure that the key fob operates correctly .
press the lock , unlock and trunk buttons and check for the red indicator light to make sure the key fob working properly .
depending on your vehicle , you may need to reprogram your key fob to your car . either consult a dealership or review your owner's manual on how to reprogram your key fob .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the key release button to make sure that the key fob operates correctly. Press the lock, unlock and trunk buttons and check for the red indicator light to make sure the key fob working properly. Depending on your vehicle, you may need to reprogram your key fob to your car. Either consult a dealership or review your owner's manual on how to reprogram your key fob.

Subject: Key Fob Battery

Lines.Text: remove 4 , 7.9 mm nuts using a 7.9 mm socket driver head
one of the nuts is placed underneath the l-bracket . remove the l-bracket and the 3 circled nuts before attempting to remove the remaining nut
there are two covers that need to be removed from the alternator . this step describes how to remove the back cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 4, 7.9mm  nuts using a 7.9mm socket driver head One of the nuts is placed underneath the L-Bracket. Remove the L-Bracket and the 3 circled nuts before attempting to remove the remaining nut There are two covers that need to be removed from the alternator. This step describes how to remove the back cover.

Lines.Text: pull cover off the body of the alternator
