Title: 2006 Ford F-150 Door Handle Cable Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the plastic cover from the door handle using a 7.6 cm slotted screwdriver .
insert the screwdriver into the small opening found at the top of the plastic cover .
carefully tilt the screwdriver upward to remove the plastic cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic cover from the door handle using a 7.6 cm slotted screwdriver. Insert the screwdriver into the small opening found at the top of the plastic cover. Carefully tilt the screwdriver upward to remove the plastic cover.

Lines.Text: remove the two 6 mm hex screws using a 6 mm socket .
turn the screwdriver counter-clockwise to loosen and remove the screws .
grab the door handle and remove it from its location .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 6 mm hex screws using a 6mm socket. Turn the screwdriver counter-clockwise to loosen and remove the screws. Grab the door handle and remove it from its location.

Lines.Text: remove the top plastic cover by pulling outward to snap it out of its location .
there are not any screws to remove in this part .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top plastic cover by pulling outward to snap it out of its location. There are not any screws to remove in this part.

Lines.Text: remove the other plastic cover by pulling outward to snap it out of its location .
there are not any screws to remove in this part .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the other plastic cover by pulling outward to snap it out of its location. There are not any screws to remove in this part.

Lines.Text: remove the three 6 mm hex screws off the main door cover using a 6 mm socket . there are two screws at the top and one at the bottom .
the panel itself should stay in place even after the screws have been removed .
the door panel is maintained in place by plastic hooks behind it .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 6 mm hex screws off the main door cover using a 6 mm socket. There are two screws at the top and one  at the bottom. The panel itself should stay in place even after the screws have been removed. The door panel is maintained in place by plastic hooks behind it.

Lines.Text: gently , but with a strong force , lift the door cover about an inch or two high . then , carefully pull it outward .
be careful not to damage the plastic hooks that are keeping the door in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently, but with a strong force, lift the door cover about an inch or two high. Then, carefully pull it outward. Be careful not to damage the plastic hooks that are keeping the door in place.

Lines.Text: snap out the upper end of the cable out of its location .
the upper end of the cable has a shape of a little ball . the little ball is found by where the door handle was removed .
using a plier , lift the cable high enough so that the little ball can come out through the round opening above it .

Steps.Text_raw: Snap out the upper end of the cable out of its location. The upper end of the cable has a shape of a little ball. The little ball is found by where the door handle was removed. Using a plier, lift the cable high enough so that the little ball can come out through the round opening above it.

Lines.Text: remove the three t27 hex star screws using a tamper torx screwdriver . the screws are found at the bottom of the door .
you may need a mechanic creeper to lay under the door .
wear protective goggles if you lay down under the door to do this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three T27 hex star screws using a tamper torx screw driver. The screws are found at the bottom of the door. You may need a mechanic creeper to lay under the door. Wear protective goggles if you lay down under the door to do this step.

Lines.Text: insert your hand inside the bottom of the door to retrieve the door latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert your hand inside the bottom of the door to retrieve the door latch.

Lines.Text: remove the end of the cable out of its location .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the end of the cable out of its location.

Lines.Text: make sure that your car is parked on a level surface with the emergency brake on . a common workplace for anyone without a garage is a driveway or carport .

it is helpful to place a tarp underneath your car as it provides a contrasting background to locate fallen screws and parts . the tarp also provides a smooth , non-abrasive surface to place parts and tools .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure that your car is parked on a level surface with the emergency brake on. A common workplace for anyone without a garage is a driveway or carport. It is helpful to place a tarp underneath your car as it provides a contrasting background to locate fallen screws and parts. The tarp also provides a smooth, non-abrasive surface to place parts and tools.

Lines.Text: locate the positive and negative leads on the battery and remove them with a 10 mm socket .
if you have an aftermarket air intake , it is also helpful to remove the filter to allow for more space to reach the wires and screws for the headlights .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the positive and negative leads on the battery and remove them with a 10mm socket. If you have an aftermarket air intake, it is also helpful to remove the filter to allow for more space to reach the wires and screws for the headlights.

Lines.Text: there are 7 body screws to be removed that attach the front bumper to the frame of the car . the first 5 screws are all on the same eye level as the underskirt of the car whereas screws 6 7 are above the passenger and driver side tires .
it is very common for body screws to have been replaced , especially on older cars . when replaced , bolts will always have the same size diameter , but the size of the bolt head may very .

Steps.Text_raw: There are 7 body screws to be removed that attach the front bumper to the frame of the car. The first 5 screws are all on the same eye level as the underskirt of the car whereas screws 6 & 7 are above the passenger and driver side tires. It is very common for body screws to have been replaced, especially on older cars. When replaced, bolts will always have the same size diameter, but the size of the bolt head may very.

Lines.Text: there are 2 screws which attach the grille and the front bumper to the frame which are located directly next to either headlight . once the grille is removed , there are five plastic tabs which must also be removed before taking off the bumper .
the plastic tabs are commonly missing or break when removing them . replacements are found at most auto parts store .

Steps.Text_raw: There are 2 screws which attach the grille and the front bumper to the frame which are located directly next to either headlight. Once the grille is removed, there are five plastic tabs which must also be removed before taking off the bumper. The plastic tabs are commonly missing or break when removing them. Replacements are found at most auto parts store.

Lines.Text: now as you remove the front bumper , be sure to only pull it off far enough to reach down and unplug the wires to the passenger and driver side blinkers and running lights . alternatively to freeing the wire , the bulb and wire harness may both be freed by twisting counterclockwise . once everything is unplugged , pull gently until the bumper is free .
if there is any significant resistance when trying to free the bumper , then check to see if any bolts or wire connections have been missed to prevent damages .
it is optional to place the removed bumper on a blanket to prevent damage .

Steps.Text_raw: Now as you remove the front bumper, be sure to only pull it off far enough to reach down and unplug the wires to the passenger and driver side blinkers and running lights. Alternatively to freeing the wire, the bulb and wire harness may both be freed by twisting counterclockwise. Once everything is unplugged, pull gently until the bumper is free. If there is any significant resistance when trying to free the bumper, then check to see if any bolts or wire connections have been missed to prevent damages. It is optional to place the removed bumper on a blanket to prevent damage.

Lines.Text: there is a wire harness for the high beam and low beam which may be freed by twisting counterclockwise . this should be done for passenger and driver side before attempting to remove the screws that secure the headlights .
if you have leds installed , then there is a ballast connected to the wire harness which has three wires that must be disconnected . wires on the ballast are held in by clips that simply pull apart .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a wire harness for the high beam and low beam which may be freed by twisting counterclockwise. This should be done for passenger and driver side before attempting to remove the screws that secure the headlights. If you have LEDs installed, then there is a ballast connected to the wire harness which has three wires that must be disconnected.  Wires on the ballast are held in by clips that simply pull apart.

Lines.Text: there are 3 screws securing each headlight . the top screw is the easiest to get to and can be removed in plain sight before even taking the front bumper off . the screws on the sides , however , are seen only after the bumper is removed and are still difficult to get to .
do not over tighten these screws when reassembling or you will strip the hole in the headlight housing as the threading is plastic .
if you are having trouble locating these screws , then refer to the replacement part to get a better idea .

Steps.Text_raw: There are 3 screws securing each headlight. The top screw is the easiest to get to and can be removed in plain sight before even taking the front bumper off. The screws on the sides, however, are seen only after the bumper is removed and are still difficult to get to. Do not over tighten these screws when reassembling or you will strip the hole in the headlight housing as the threading is plastic. If you are having trouble locating these screws, then refer to the replacement part to get a better idea.

Lines.Text: when removing the headlight , take care to avoid touching any bulbs with your hands or wear a latex glove . furthermore , do not force the assembly to come out . if the assembly does not come free with a gentle pull then something is likely still attached .

Steps.Text_raw: When removing the headlight, take care to avoid touching any bulbs with your hands or wear a latex glove. Furthermore, do not force the assembly to come out. If the assembly does not come free with a gentle pull then something is likely still attached.

Lines.Text: the hids are not designed to fit into the factory housing which holds the stock bulbs in with a simple locking mechanism highlighted in green . to account for this , use a strong adhesive to glue the hid into the rubber moisture barrier which will also be glued to the assembly .

it is recommended to follow the instructions for your choice of adhesive for drying , but this process may be sped up with a blow dryer if running short on time . it should also be noticed that since adhesive is being used , the moisture barrier will also have to be replaced if the hid needs to be replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: The HIDs are not designed to fit into the factory housing which holds the stock bulbs in with a simple locking mechanism highlighted in green. To account for this, use a strong adhesive to glue the HID into the rubber moisture barrier which will also be glued to the assembly. It is recommended to follow the instructions for your choice of adhesive for drying, but this process may be sped up with a blow dryer if running short on time. It should also be noticed that since adhesive is being used, the moisture barrier will also have to be replaced if the HID needs to be replaced.

Lines.Text: if hids are installed , then the factory wire harness no longer clips in . now , you will need to place the positive and negative leads from the hid into the wire harness . following , secure the connection with electrical tape . furthermore , you may secure the ballasts for the hids to the frame of your car with zip ties .

if your turn your lights on and they do not work , reverse the order in which you placed these leads . finally , be sure to place any warranties or receipts in your glove box in case the replacement parts malfunction .

Steps.Text_raw: If HIDs are installed, then the factory wire harness no longer clips in. Now, you will need to place the positive and negative leads from the HID into the wire harness. Following, secure the connection with electrical tape. Furthermore, you may secure the ballasts for the HIDs to the frame of your car with zip ties. If your turn your lights on and they do not work, reverse the order in which you placed these leads. Finally, be sure to place any warranties or receipts in your glove box in case the replacement parts malfunction.

Lines.Text: follow the disassembly steps in reverse to secure the new headlight assembly . take care to use the same bolts that were removed and replace any missing bolts with stock body screws from an auto parts store .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the disassembly steps in reverse to secure the new headlight assembly. Take care to use the same bolts that were removed and replace any missing bolts with stock body screws from an auto parts store.

Lines.Text: press the eject button on the bottom left corner of the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the eject button on the bottom left corner of the face plate.

Lines.Text: begin by slightly lifting the face plate out from the side located by the release button .
slide towards the side of the eject button , ''then'' completely lift out .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by slightly lifting the face plate out from the side located by the release button. Slide towards the side of the eject button, ''then'' completely lift out.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7.5 mm phillips 0 screws on the back of the face-plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 7.5mm Phillips #0 screws on the back of the face-plate.

Lines.Text: use a spudger or prying tool to open the back of the face plate . pry the back at multiple points around the edge of the face plate . this will take some patience . applying too much force risks breaking the plastic .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger or prying tool to open the back of the face plate. Pry the back at multiple points around the edge of the face plate. This will take some patience. Applying too much force risks breaking the plastic.

Lines.Text: lift and remove the motherboard to reveal the inside of the front panel .
you might need to pry the right side up with the spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift and remove the motherboard to reveal the inside of the front panel. You might need to pry the right side up with the spudger.

Lines.Text: use the plastic spudger to straighten out the six pegs to allow the removal of the lcd screen .
make sure to use an prying tool when working on electrical boards . here , we are using a plastic tool , not a metal one .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the plastic spudger to straighten out the six pegs to allow the removal of the LCD screen. Make sure to use an [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrostatic_discharge|ESD]-safe prying tool when working on electrical boards. Here, we are using a plastic tool, not a metal one.

Lines.Text: lift the lcd screen to remove and replace it .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the LCD screen to remove and replace it.

Lines.Text: gather the hardware , tools and protective equipment .

Steps.Text_raw: Gather the hardware, tools and protective equipment.

Lines.Text: straighten the steering wheel and remove the key from the ignition .

Steps.Text_raw: Straighten the steering wheel and remove the key from the ignition.

Lines.Text: grip the steering wheel horn pad , placing your fingertips at the edges .
gently pull it straight towards you and the clips will release it .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the steering wheel horn pad, placing your fingertips at the edges. Gently pull it straight towards you and the clips will release it.

Lines.Text: use a paint marker to mark a reference point for the top center of the steering wheel on the face of the steering shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a paint marker to mark a reference point for the top center of the steering wheel on the face of the steering shaft.

Lines.Text: using a 19 mm socket and ratchet , loosen the steering wheel retainer nut and remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a 19mm socket and ratchet, loosen the steering wheel retainer nut and remove it.

Lines.Text: place the puller tool on the wheel aligning the steering shaft with the press head and the two threaded holes in the steering wheel with the holes in the ears of the puller .
run the bolts , from the puller tool , through the holes in the ears and thread them into the steering wheel hand tight .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the puller tool on the wheel aligning the steering shaft with the press head and the two threaded holes in the steering wheel with the holes in the ears of the puller. Run the bolts, from the puller tool, through the holes in the ears and thread them into the steering wheel hand tight.

Lines.Text: slowly tighten the press shaft until the steering wheel releases .

this should not take much force to accomplish . if something starts bending or you have to use excessive force tightening the shaft , stop , reinstall the steering wheel retaining nut , and take the vehicle to a professional .

Steps.Text_raw: Slowly tighten the press shaft until the steering wheel releases. This should not take much force to accomplish. If something starts bending or you have to use excessive force tightening the shaft, stop, reinstall the steering wheel retaining nut, and take the vehicle to a professional.

Lines.Text: install the steering wheel hub onto the steering shaft , aligning the top center mark on the hub with the paint mark you made in step 4.

Steps.Text_raw: Install the steering wheel hub onto the steering shaft, aligning the top center mark on the hub with the paint mark you made in Step 4.

Lines.Text: reinstall the steering wheel retaining nut torqueing it down to 29 ftlb using a torque wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Reinstall the steering wheel retaining nut torqueing it down to 29 ft*lb using a torque wrench.

Lines.Text: place the inner horn retainer ring in-between the new steering wheel and hub , aligning the six bolt holes , and place one screw , finger tight , in the hub to temporarily hold everything in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the inner horn retainer ring in-between the new steering wheel and hub, aligning the six bolt holes, and place one screw, finger tight, in the hub to temporarily hold everything in place.

Lines.Text: make the wiring connections for the horn .

Steps.Text_raw: Make the wiring connections for the horn.

Lines.Text: press the horn into the inner horn retainer .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the horn into the inner horn retainer.

Lines.Text: hold the assembly steady and remove the screw that was temporarily installed .
place the outer horn retainer over the horn aligning the bolt pattern .
reinsert the screw to temporarily hold the steering wheel assembly together .

Steps.Text_raw: Hold the assembly steady and remove the screw that was temporarily installed. Place the outer horn retainer over the horn aligning the bolt pattern. Reinsert the screw to temporarily hold the steering wheel assembly together.

Lines.Text: place a drop of low strength thread locking compound to each screw and thread them into the steering wheel hub .
do not use excessive thread locking compound . it only takes a drop . this step is to ensure the screws do not loosen due to vibrations .

Steps.Text_raw: Place a drop of low strength thread locking compound to each screw and thread them into the steering wheel hub. Do not use excessive thread locking compound. It only takes a drop. This step is to ensure the screws do not loosen due to vibrations.

Lines.Text: tighten these screws using a 3 mm hex wrench .
tighten the screws in a star pattern sequence starting with the bolt circled in red .

Steps.Text_raw: Tighten these screws using a 3 mm hex wrench. Tighten the screws in a "star"  pattern sequence starting with the bolt circled in red.

Lines.Text: press the eject button on the bottom left corner of the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the eject button on the bottom left corner of the face plate.

Lines.Text: begin by slightly lifting the face plate out from the side located by the release button .
slide towards the side of the eject button , ''then'' completely lift out .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by slightly lifting the face plate out from the side located by the release button. Slide towards the side of the eject button, ''then'' completely lift out.

Lines.Text: grasp the outer metal sleeve with one hand and the front of the unit with the other .
slide the sleeve back until it comes off the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the outer metal sleeve with one hand and the front of the unit with the other. Slide the sleeve back until it comes off the unit.

Lines.Text: remove the thin frame from the front of the device . this can be done by first unsnapping the top pegs and then the bottom ones .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the thin frame from the front of the device. This can be done by first unsnapping the top pegs and then the bottom ones.

Lines.Text: lift the clasps of the tabs around the edges by using a plastic opening tool or spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the clasps of the tabs around the edges by using a plastic opening tool or spudger.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5.5 mm phillips 0 ( ph0 ) screws on the bottom of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 5.5mm Phillips #0 (PH0) screws on the bottom of the unit.

Lines.Text: remove the two 6 mm phillips 0 screws from the side of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 6mm Phillips #0 screws from the side of the unit.

Lines.Text: remove the 7.5 mm phillips 0 screw in between the red and white rca inputs .
remove the two 13.5 mm phillips 0 screws towards the top of the aluminum block .
remove the 10 mm phillips 0 screw towards the bottom of the aluminum block .
remove the two 6 mm phillips 0 screws found above the microphone mount and below the circular port .
remove the 7.5 mm phillips 0 screw next to the large rectangular power connector .
remove the 10 mm phillips 0 screw that resides above the aluminum block .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 7.5mm Phillips #0 screw in between the red and white RCA inputs. Remove the two 13.5mm Phillips #0 screws towards the top of the aluminum block. Remove the 10mm Phillips #0 screw towards the bottom of the aluminum block. Remove the two 6mm Phillips #0 screws found above the microphone mount and below the circular port. Remove the 7.5mm Phillips #0 screw next to the large rectangular power connector. Remove the 10mm Phillips #0 screw that resides above the aluminum block.

Lines.Text: separate the top and bottom metal housings of the unit carefully .
there is a connecting ribbon that links the two halves . too much force could rip and irreversibly damage the ribbon .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the top and bottom metal housings of the unit carefully. There is a connecting ribbon that links the two halves. Too much force could rip and irreversibly damage the ribbon.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the ribbon out of the connector found on the bottom half of the unit ( the bottom half has the cd drive ) .

to remove the ribbon , grip the black base connector with one hand and the base of the ribbon with the other . the ribbon will have a blue , reinforced section close to the base ( seen in second picture ) which makes it easier to pull .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the ribbon out of the connector found on the bottom half of the unit (the bottom half has the CD drive). To remove the ribbon, grip the black base connector with one hand and the base of the ribbon with the other. The ribbon will have a blue, reinforced section close to the base (seen in second picture) which makes it easier to pull.

Lines.Text: to fully unmount and replace the cd drive , remove the three 6 mm phllips 0 screws that hold the drive to the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: To fully unmount and replace the CD drive, remove the three 6mm Phllips #0 screws that hold the drive to the housing.

Title: How to fix a rattling window, E46 M3

Lines.Text: the door card is held securely in place with 5 screws .
keep in mind the door card has up to 3 wire bundles attached to it . be careful when removing it ! be prepared to support it while dealing with the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: The door card is held securely in place with 5 screws. Keep in mind the door card has up to 3 wire bundles attached to it. Be careful when removing it! Be prepared to support it while dealing with the wires.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , work off the cap of the first screw . the cap is tight ; you may need a jimmy or metal spudger .
using the flat end of a spudger , remove the airbag emblem . the emblem has clips on the top and bottom -- work carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, work off the cap of the first screw. The cap is tight; you may need a jimmy or metal spudger. Using the flat end of a spudger, remove the airbag emblem. The emblem has clips on the top and bottom -- work carefully.

Lines.Text: using a t20 torx driver with extension , remove all 5 bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T20 Torx driver with extension, remove all 5 bolts.

Lines.Text: if you're working on the driver side door , remove the mirror control module . disconnect it from its wiring plug .

Steps.Text_raw: If you're working on the driver side door, remove the mirror control module. Disconnect it from its wiring plug.

Lines.Text: using a trim tool or similar , begin at the bottom of the door card and pop the card away from the door frame .
after you've released the bottom clips , work your way around .
you will need to lift the door card from the door frame in order to fully release it . be careful !

Steps.Text_raw: Using a trim tool or similar, begin at the bottom of the door card and pop the card away from the door frame. After you've released the bottom clips, work your way around. You will need to lift the door card from the door frame in order to fully release it. Be careful!

Lines.Text: disconnect the following from the door panel :
unlocking cable
speaker cable ( s )
set the door panel aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the following from the door panel: Unlocking cable Speaker cable(s) Set the door panel aside.

Lines.Text: the door panel is now removed .
you will see the airbag module , vapor barrier , and other components .

Steps.Text_raw: The door panel is now removed. You will see the airbag module, vapor barrier, and other components.

Lines.Text: very gently , peel back the vapor barrier to expose the retaining bolt .
roll the window up .

the tar-like substance used to seal the vapor barrier to the door frame will release itself to a gentle pull , but it is extremely sticky , and too much pulling will tear your barrier . slow and steady is the name of the game !
inspect the bolt . it is probably missing a nut !

Steps.Text_raw: Very gently, peel back the vapor barrier to expose the retaining bolt. Roll the window up. The tar-like substance used to seal the vapor barrier to the door frame WILL release itself to a gentle pull, but it is EXTREMELY sticky, and too much pulling will tear your barrier. Slow and steady is the name of the game! Inspect the bolt. It is probably missing a nut!

Lines.Text: while you're in here , inspect and tighten the bottom bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: While you're in here, inspect and tighten the bottom bolt.

Lines.Text: look in the bottom of your door and locate the nut that fell off that top bolt .
replace the nut onto the upper bolt and tighten .
in a pinch , you can use a little bit of that tarry substance to temporarily paste the nut to your fingertip in order to screw it on to the bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: Look in the bottom of your door and locate the nut that fell off that top bolt. Replace the nut onto the upper bolt and tighten. In a pinch, you can use a little bit of that tarry substance to temporarily paste the nut to your fingertip in order to screw it on to the bolt.

Lines.Text: ta da ! now closing the door sounds great !

Steps.Text_raw: Ta da! Now closing the door sounds great!

Lines.Text: the door card is held securely in place with 5 screws .
keep in mind the door card has up to 3 wire bundles attached to it . be careful when removing it ! be prepared to support it while dealing with the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: The door card is held securely in place with 5 screws. Keep in mind the door card has up to 3 wire bundles attached to it. Be careful when removing it! Be prepared to support it while dealing with the wires.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , work off the cap of the first screw . the cap is tight ; you may need a jimmy or metal spudger .
using the flat end of a spudger , remove the airbag emblem . the emblem has clips on the top and bottom -- work carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, work off the cap of the first screw. The cap is tight; you may need a jimmy or metal spudger. Using the flat end of a spudger, remove the airbag emblem. The emblem has clips on the top and bottom -- work carefully.

Lines.Text: using a t20 torx driver with extension , remove all 5 bolts .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a T20 Torx driver with extension, remove all 5 bolts.

Lines.Text: if you're working on the driver side door , remove the mirror control module . disconnect it from its wiring plug .

Steps.Text_raw: If you're working on the driver side door, remove the mirror control module. Disconnect it from its wiring plug.

Lines.Text: using a trim tool or similar , begin at the bottom of the door card and pop the card away from the door frame .
after you've released the bottom clips , work your way around .
you will need to lift the door card from the door frame in order to fully release it . be careful !

Steps.Text_raw: Using a trim tool or similar, begin at the bottom of the door card and pop the card away from the door frame. After you've released the bottom clips, work your way around. You will need to lift the door card from the door frame in order to fully release it. Be careful!

Lines.Text: disconnect the following from the door panel :
unlocking cable
speaker cable ( s )
set the door panel aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the following from the door panel: Unlocking cable Speaker cable(s) Set the door panel aside.

Lines.Text: the door panel is now removed .
you will see the airbag module , vapor barrier , and other components .

Steps.Text_raw: The door panel is now removed. You will see the airbag module, vapor barrier, and other components.

Title: 2000-2007 Chevrolet Monte Carlo Glove Compartment Door Removal

Lines.Text: to access the hinges for the glove compartment door , the passenger side kick panel must first be removed .

there are two clips ( red ) ,and a plastic fastener ( orange , located further back ) holding this panel to the dash . you'll put less bending stress on the panel if you remove the plastic fastener first .

Steps.Text_raw: To access the hinges for the glove compartment door, the passenger side kick panel must first be removed. There are two clips (red),and a plastic fastener (orange, located further back) holding this panel to the dash. You'll put less bending stress on the panel if you remove the plastic fastener first.

Lines.Text: use a plastic fastener removal tool to pop out the plastic fastener . this fastener was not designed to be easily removable , but the tool helps a lot .

if you're careful , you can remove the fastener without damaging it . try to fold all of the ridges back before re-inserting it . if you plan on removing the kick panel again , you may want to invest in a fastener that's to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic fastener removal tool to pop out the plastic fastener. This fastener was not designed to be easily removable, but the tool helps a lot. If you're careful, you can remove the fastener without damaging it. Try to fold all of the "ridges" back before re-inserting it. If you plan on removing the kick panel again, you may want to invest in a fastener that's [https://www.amazon.com/OFFROADINGLIGHT-Retainer-Push-Style-Assortment-Chevrolet/dp/B06XG5JP3L/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1496018314&sr=8-2&keywords=plastic+fastener+assortment|easier to remove.]

Lines.Text: now remove the clips on each side . this can be done by pushing the exposed tab forward .
the kick panel should now fall down .
don't pull the panel out just yet , there's still a courtesy light that is mounted on the panel and connected with a wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove the clips on each side. This can be done by pushing the exposed tab forward. The kick panel should now fall down. Don't pull the panel out just yet, there's still a courtesy light that is mounted on the panel and connected with a wire.

Lines.Text: remove the courtesy light from the panel by twisting it 45 degrees . it should release from the panel . keep in mind that this light will get hot , and can melt plastic trim . be careful where you let it hang if its lit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the courtesy light from the panel by twisting it 45 degrees. It should release from the panel. Keep in mind that this light will get hot, and can melt plastic trim. Be careful where you let it hang if its lit.

Lines.Text: removing the kick panel should have exposed the hinge for the glove compartment door .
there are five 7 mm hex head screws holding this hinge to the dashboard , remove them .

Steps.Text_raw: Removing the kick panel should have exposed the hinge for the glove compartment door. There are five 7mm hex head screws holding this hinge to the dashboard, remove them.

Lines.Text: now open the glove compartment and empty it out if you haven't already .
there are supporting wires on each side of the door , you'll need to remove each one .

Steps.Text_raw: Now open the glove compartment and empty it out if you haven't already. There are supporting wires on each side of the door, you'll need to remove each one.

Lines.Text: the left side supporting wire is pretty easy to remove .
pushing the clip down will allow you to slide it out of the door , releasing the cable .
this cable is spring loaded , and will retract upwards into the dash .

Steps.Text_raw: The left side supporting wire is pretty easy to remove. Pushing the clip down will allow you to slide it out of the door, releasing the cable. This cable is spring loaded, and will retract upwards into the dash.

Lines.Text: to remove the right-side cable , you must push the center pin out of the clip first .
now , the clip can be removed from the door . just push it through the hole .
the door should now be fully disconnected from the car .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the right-side cable, you must push the center pin out of the clip first. Now, the clip can be removed from the door. Just push it through the hole. The door should now be fully disconnected from the car.

Lines.Text: to remove the door , there's one last thing to do .
even with everything disconnected , the door is still captive in the dash . there's a small plastic tab on the left side of the door that must be bent to release the door .
a swift yank on the door should be enough to release it , but you'll want to look for yourself at how the tab is released .
todo : take a picture with the door actually removed . . .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the door, there's one last thing to do. Even with everything disconnected, the door is still captive in the dash. There's a small plastic tab on the left side of the door that must be bent to release the door. A swift yank on the door should be enough to release it, but you'll want to look for yourself at how the tab is released. TODO: Take a picture with the door actually removed...

Title: 2000-2007 Chevrolet Monte Carlo Passenger Side Blend Door Actuator Replacement

Lines.Text: park the car on a flat surface , and remove the keys from the ignition .
under the dashboard on the drivers side is the hood release latch . pull this until you feel the latch release , the hood should pop up a little when this happens .

Steps.Text_raw: Park the car on a flat surface, and remove the keys from the ignition. Under the dashboard on the drivers side is the hood release latch. Pull this until you feel the latch release, the hood should pop up a little when this happens.

Lines.Text: the hood should have popped up a little bit after pulling the hood latch , now you must release it before it can be opened .
under the hood , slightly left-of-center is a release lever that must be pushed to open the hood all the way . this lever must be pushed to the right , in the direction of the car emblem .

once you successfully release the hood , you should feel it try to rise up . these cars all have solenoids that assist in raising the hood . simply lift the hood up , and it should stay up without any intervention .

Steps.Text_raw: The hood should have popped up a little bit after pulling the hood latch, now you must release it before it can be opened. Under the hood, slightly left-of-center is a release lever that must be pushed to open the hood all the way. This lever must be pushed to the right, in the direction of the car emblem. Once you successfully release the hood, you should feel it try to rise up. These cars all have solenoids that assist in raising the hood. Simply lift the hood up, and it should stay up without any intervention.

Lines.Text: the battery is on the left side of the engine compartment .
the cable connecting to the negative terminal should be black , and should have an exposed 8 mm bolt head that screws into the battery . the negative terminal should also be marked on the battery .
use an 8 mm wrench to disconnect the negative terminal connector . tuck the lose connector out of the way of the battery , so that it cannot make contact with the terminal .

be very careful not to touch the positive battery terminal ( with the wrench or yourself ) while you're doing this . there should be a red protective cover on the positive terminal , but it's always good to take precautions . shorting out a car battery will very likely result in a trip to the hospital .

new batteries tend to come with plastic plugs for the terminals . if you have these for your battery , this would be a good opportunity to use them . this will prevent anything from touching the terminal .

Steps.Text_raw: The battery is on the left side of the engine compartment. The cable connecting to the negative terminal should be black, and should have an exposed 8mm bolt head that screws into the battery. The negative terminal should also be marked on the battery. Use an 8mm wrench to disconnect the negative terminal connector. Tuck the lose connector out of the way of the battery, so that it cannot make contact with the terminal. Be very careful not to touch the positive battery terminal (with the wrench or yourself) while you're doing this. There should be a red protective cover on the positive terminal, but it's always good to take precautions. Shorting out a car battery will very likely result in a trip to the hospital. New batteries tend to come with plastic plugs for the terminals. If you have these for your battery, this would be a good opportunity to use them. This will prevent anything from touching the terminal.

Lines.Text: the passenger side blend door actuator is inside of the dashboard on the passenger side . it is most easily accessible by removing the glove compartment door .
the actuator mounts on the side of an air duct , and turns a flap inside the duct directing air .

Steps.Text_raw: The passenger side blend door actuator is inside of the dashboard on the passenger side. It is most easily accessible by removing the glove compartment door. The actuator mounts on the side of an air duct, and turns a flap inside the duct directing air.

Lines.Text: there is a 4-pin cable connecting to the bottom-left of the actuator . there is a tab that can be pressed to release the cable from the actuator .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a 4-pin cable connecting to the bottom-left of the actuator. There is a tab that can be pressed to release the cable from the actuator.

Lines.Text: there are two 5.5 mm hex head screws holding the actuator in place , remove them and the actuator should come free . there may be some cables that you'll need to push out of the way to get the actuator out .
if you don't have a 5.5 mm socket , 7 /32 works well as an alternative . a 6 mm socket may damage the heads of the bolts if you try to use it .
the third picture shows the old , original actuator ( right ) next to an aftermarket dorman replacement .

Steps.Text_raw: There are two 5.5mm hex head screws holding the actuator in place, remove them and the actuator should come free. There may be some cables that you'll need to push out of the way to get the actuator out. If you don't have a 5.5mm socket, 7/32" works well as an alternative. A 6mm socket may damage the heads of the bolts if you try to use it. The third picture shows the old, original actuator (right) next to an aftermarket Dorman replacement.

Lines.Text: there's a good chance that the orientation of the blend door will not match that of the new actuator you bought . since it isn't possible to rotate the servo without supplying a signal to it , you'll have to move the blend door to line up with the servo .
the white post is what the actuator turns . you should be able to turn this by hand to line up with your new actuator .
now reinstall the new actuator , don't forget to connect the electrical connector .

Steps.Text_raw: There's a good chance that the orientation of the blend door will not match that of the new actuator you bought. Since it isn't possible to rotate the servo without supplying a signal to it, you'll have to move the blend door to line up with the servo. The white post is what the actuator turns. You should be able to turn this by hand to line up with your new actuator. Now reinstall the new actuator, don't forget to connect the electrical connector.

Lines.Text: there's one last step before you're done . you must calibrate the actuator with the cars hvac control system . this is because the car doesn't know the orientation of the new actuator . the procedure for this is as follows .
reconnect the battery for the car , verify that you can start the car .
while the car is off , remove the 10 a hvac system dic/rke fuse from the passenger side fuse box . let the car sit for at least a minute .
reinstall the fuse and start the car , do not touch any of the climate controls . wait at least a minute while the car relearns the actuator positions .
turn the car back off , wait at least 10 seconds , and then start it again . the relearn procedure is now complete .

this part of the process is correct for 2000-2005 monte carlos , the calibration procedure for the 2006 and 2007 models is probably slightly different , as those cars have an entirely different set of fuses .

Steps.Text_raw: There's one last step before you're done. You must calibrate the actuator with the cars HVAC control system. This is because the car doesn't know the orientation of the new actuator. The procedure for this is as follows. Reconnect the battery for the car, verify that you can start the car. While the car is off, remove the 10A HVAC system "DIC/RKE" fuse from the passenger side fuse box. Let the car sit for at least a minute. Reinstall the fuse and start the car, do not touch any of the climate controls. Wait at least a minute while the car relearns the actuator positions. Turn the car back off, wait at least 10 seconds, and then start it again. The relearn procedure is now complete. This part of the process is correct for 2000-2005 Monte Carlos, the calibration procedure for the 2006 and 2007 models is probably slightly different, as those cars have an entirely different set of fuses.
